name: Micro Train
description:
It is your job to help connect coaches to the train. You are not only responsible for adding coaches of the colour assigned to you, but to also complete the train as quickly as possible.

A short train building game for two, consisting of only 19 cards. The winner of the game is the person with the most valuable coach segment in the color they are responsible for. Train coaches are worth different points based on their class, and coaches can only be added to coaches on the train if they have the same class or colour, where first class passenger coaches cannot be added directly to third class coaches, and vice versa.

Players face a simple choice on each turn: Take a train coach card in their hand, or add a coach coach from their hand to the train. But beware - coaches not placed at the end of the game counts against your score.

name: Minotaur Max!: Onna no Bushi
description:
A pre-release promo from the Tokyo game market.

It adds a female samurai warrior to the game, who will move before the players do. Whoever supports her the most will receive her help.

name: Tęcza
description: Rainbow colours and objects is a fun game where everyone can have fun together. The underlying theme is about recognising the pictures on the tokens, or matching the colours or creating a memory game with them. It indirectly teaches the youngest children to recognise and name colours of the rainbow while having a lot of fun. The dice with a colour on each side indicates which picture needs to be selected (or found from an overturned token). Granna have created many variations to this game.

name: Moly Diggins
description:
In Moly Diggins, players try to explore winding tunnels to collect earthworms. The game consists solely of ten tunnel cards that each bear earthworms in their paths, and players take turns placing these in order to get their mole to the worms.

In the beginning of the game, two cards are placed and one worm is attached to every worm-sign. The active player places a new card — every card is printed on front and back with different tunnels — and attaches a worm again. Then he moves his mole as far as possible, taking every worm on the way, but sometimes it's better to move not so far in order to have an advantage for his next turn.

When all ten cards have been placed, the second phase of the game starts. Now the active player takes one already-placed card without a mole, removes all remaining worms to the storage, then places it again, attaching worms again, too. In the second phase, players have the opportunity to enter the connecting tunnels of the other players.

The player who has found the most worms at the end of the day is hailed as the greatest earthworm hunter.
mechanics: Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Where's Waldo? World Game
description: Be the first to spot characters in a crowd. With punched out people in a bowl, you spin the wheel and find that person before the timer runs out.

name: Buongiorno, Signorina
description:
Buongiorno, Signorina is an Italian style reaction game for 2 to 6 players aged 8 years and up. Shuffle the cards and deal them face down to each player, so that each player has approximately the same number of cards. Don’t look at your cards, but place them face down in a deck in front of you. Then you continue in a clockwise direction. When it’s your turn, draw the top card from your deck. Reveal it by turning it away from you, so that you are not the first one to see it. That way, no one can accuse you of cheating! Place it in the middle of the table. Then each take it in turns to place your card on top of the card previously laid. Continue doing this until a card demands an action. Tip: the faster you turn over your cards, one after the other, the more fun it becomes.

Which cards demand which actions?

Pasta:
As long as pasta appears, nothing happens. The sort makes no difference whatsoever. The neighbour on your left plays the next card.

Re: As soon as one of the four Kings turns up, salute him very quickly. Move your flat hand to your forehead and touch it with your fingertips. It makes no difference whether you use your right or left hand.

Signorina:
As soon as one of the four Ladies appears, quickly call out “Buongiorno, Signorina” (pronounced Buonchorno Sinnjorina).

Mandriano:
As soon as one of the four Cowherds appears, quickly blow a kiss. To do this, simulate a kiss on your fingertips and symbolically blow it away.

Cavallo:
As soon as one of the four Horses turns up, like lightning, bang your flat hand down on the card(s) in the middle of the table.

This is how the game ends:
The game ends as soon as one of you has no more cards left. Have you laid your last card in the middle of the table? Then you’ve almost won. But Attenzione: if instead of showing pasta, it demands an action, then you must carry this out quickly and correctly. Therefore, make an effort so that you don’t have to take all the cards from the middle of the table. Did everything go well? Complimenti – you have won!

name: Monopoly: Real Madrid
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Real Madrid, a famous Soccer Club in Spain
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Pocahontas: Peace in the Forest Card Game
description:
The year is 1607. The place, Virginia. The Indians & the English settlers have been at odds ever since the villainous John Ratcliffe & his men arrived to search for gold. Chief Powhatan's daughter Pocahontas & the English Captain Jon Smith want you to bring together all their Powhatan & English friends. Gramdmother Willow will help as yo gather Meeko & Flit, Powhatan & Nakoma, & Thomas, Wiggins & Lon. The first player to overcome John Ratcliffe (& his pampered pooch Percy) & collect all the friends will bring peace to the forest - & win the game.
Ages 5 and up.

Each player begins the game with a Pocahontas card and a John Smith card. On your turn, draw a card and if it is one of Pocahontas' friends or John's friends, place the card face up below that character. If you already have one of those friends, place the card in the Friends Discard pile.
Special cards include John Ratcliffe, Percy and Grandmother Willow.
If Ratcliffe is drawn, you must turn John or Pocahontas face down. When turned face down, one of their friends must be placed in the Friends Discard pile and any friends drawn while they are face down are also discarded.
If Percy is drawn, you play him on an opponent and they must turn over their Pocahontas or John card.
If Grandmother Willow is drawn all face down John Smith and/or Pocahontas get turned face up again.
The first person to get a complete set of the two Friends groups is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Jr. Rangerland FickleFish
description:
In this unpredictable game, each roll determines if you catch a fish, choose a fish from another player, give up a fish or if the fish gets away.

Contains 23 Cards; each with their own point value and facts about the fish.

The most points wins the game.

name: Scrabble Interactivo
description:
The LCD shows the word that players need to find out, and clues are given, while the time to respond is counted. The device is passed from hand to hand with the correct answers.

Two game modes: individual or team. Individual has the option for easy or difficult (so there is really 3 modes). After choosing the options, start the game.

Individual mode: The first question appears on the screen. For example: words beginning with "A" and containing the letter "N". From that time it begins to count time (which leads the device). The player with the device in hand says a word with those conditions, and if you do, the device passes to the next player quickly, which should be another word that has not been said already. When the time expires, an alarm sounds and the player with the device on hand at the time (in this moment), is eliminated. New question appears on the screen, repeating the same cycle with the players that are left. The goal is not to be eliminated, as when only one player is the winner.

Team play is quite different. The question appears on the screen, and each of the teams will discuss among its members the number of words that are able to say with those conditions, in 60 seconds. It's like an auction. The team that makes the best bet, will play the first round of 60 sec. and each of the team members will be saying a word and pressed his team number on the device (1 or 2) so that it takes account at the end of 60 seconds. If successful you will get the first point, otherwise, the point is for the other team. Then comes another round of 60 seconds. with new question and following the same mechanics.

When starting the game will have agreed how many rounds will be played or how long the game. Once completed, the device itself will tell how many points each team leads, and whoever has the most points is the winner.

name: Business 2000
description:
Business 2000 is a board game you can play with the whole family or with friends. The game was first released in 1989. The rules of the game are very similar to the well-known series of Monopoly board games . Therefore, a person who had ever played Monopoly, will quickly adapt to the rules of Business 2000.

Business 2000 is an economic strategy that contributes to the development of logic and observation, responsibility for decision making and ability to predict results.

It is a roll-and-move game, where the participants throw the dice and walk around the perimeter of the playing field. They buy or sell various properties, companies and even entire industries. The players can also develop their property.

The players have the right to trade and negotiate with each other at any time. The ultimate goal is to drive opponents into bankruptcy. The main differences from the Monopoly series are special fields and action cards, that have specific rules, namely the "Casino" and "Hippodrome" fields and the "Shares" special action cards, that increase a player's income every turn.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Kannst du Rechnen? Piratenstarke Schatzsuche
description: Kannst du Rechnen? Piratenstarke Schatzsuche is an action game, a treasure hunt. Players take the role of pirates, roll the dice and try to move to the beach token that have exactly same number of shells as the sum of the dice. Count the dice properly together, and go with your pirate on the right beach tokens. Whether you've calculated correctly, you see when you turn the card. Who's at the Pirate Flag get a treasure chest full with gold, and you can also grab chest from the other players with your hook. When all treasure chests are obtained by players, the one who got the most gold pieces win the game!
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Pirates

name: Off the Dead: Der Adler – Spiel Essen 2013 Promo
description:
Promotional card special Essen 2013 available on the stand of ludimaniac.

Once the eagle has finished its move, shift it on the equivalent zone of the next player.

"Einigkeit und Recht und Freiheit":"Unity, justice and freedom" (at the beginning of the German hymn)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Zombies

name: Bluff
description:
Bluff is a traditional card game which could be called a card version of Liar's Dice. Players are dealt hands of only one card each and bid for poker hands that are present in all players hands' combined.

During a turn the player can raise the bid or challenge. If challenge succeded, then the bidder gets plus one card at the start of each consecutive turn. If challenge failed, then the challenger gets plus one card at the start of each consecutive turn.

The game ends when one player gets her 5th-10th card (depending on the number of players). Whoever has the fewest cards is the winner.

name: The King's Armory: Reward Expansion Set
description:
This expansion set comes with three additional "Reward" cards and one new monster named "Mr. Money Bags".

The cards are:

The Empty Coin Purse – worth 0 Gold
The Treasure Chest – worth two extra draws
The Imperial Diamond – worth 300 Gold
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Variable Player Powers

name: DangerMine
description:
A game of cutthroat miners.

DangerMine is a PnP game which you assuming the role of a miner/ prospect which is trying to collect as much as valuable materials possible. The winner is the first person to get 55 points of minerals, however no one has said you need to dig the minerals yourself you could always try to steal it from the other unfortunate miners, will you be a honest hard-worker miner or you would choose the path of betrayal and deception.

Game mechanism:
The game consists of 49 mine shaft tiles, which on clear side has a mineral picture and a corresponding dice roll to extract that mineral on the collapsed side there is a die indication a +3 for dice roll for cleaning the rubble's. There are four different minerals; Diamond, gold, silver and bronze, each need a different dice rolls for successful extraction. Also there is only one tile with Diamond and it is always placed in the middle of the board.
After placing the Diamond tile on the middle faced down, the other tiles goes randomly around that which will create a big square. Now the four entrances will be placed to the side of the fourth tile from each side.
Players decides on which color they want to play and throw dice to see who goes first, the first player puts his token on any entrance he likes, clockwise the other do the same, they could pick an entrance which already has occupied by another player.
The first play will start the game, he would have two actions each round which could be; removing the rubbles (+3 dice), moving on tile (two for two actions), mining the tile for the valuable minerals (dice varies) and destroying the tile which he is on (+3 dice).
The player could acquire the mineral depicted on the tile by a successful roll and take corresponding token from the pool, also after extraction a depleted sign is needed to be placed on the tile. Each mineral types has different winning score, whoever reaches 55 is the winner.
Another strategic action is to destroy the tile which will force the occupant on the tile and adjusting tiles (no diagonally) to escape. Anyone except the person who caused the cave-in will drop the last mineral they have mined on effected tile and they also have two moves to escape to safety (open tile), if they failed to move to safety with in two moves than they would die and they could re-spawn from any tile they like. The destroyed tile will flip to collapse side and the depleted signs will be removed from those tiles.
The game will proceeds until someone reaches 55 points by any means and he will be the winner.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Memory

name: Highwaymen
description:
Highwaymen is a 2-4 player tabletop game in which the Players take on the roles of a group of Highwaymen attempting to rob a coach travelling through a dangerous forest trail.

Players must work together to steal the gold from the coach but must be wary that at any moments their comrades could turn against them!

The game is played in 2 phases, firstly, the players take it in turn to take their actions, afterwards the Coach and Escorts will take their turn. A Player's turn can be taken in one of two ways, Players can either fire their pistols, or attempt to steal gold from another Player. If the player chooses to shoot, they shoot their pistols twice at the Escorts or the Coach, move up to 3D6 spaces, then shoot twice more. If the Player tries to steal, they roll 3D6 movement, and can attempt to steal from the first Player they come into contact with.

If an Escort takes damage it is removed from the board and if the Coach takes damage then it will drop coins. The Players can move over the Coins to add them to their collection, the winner of the game is the Player with the most coins at the end of the Game. The game ends when either the Coach leaves the woods (after 8 turns) or the Players destroy the Coach (when it has taken 20 hits).

name: Cinnamon Rolls
description:
In Cinnamon Rolls, players are Christmas Market traders, trying to make enough money over the Christmas Market season to buy their friends and family awesome Christmas presents.

The game plays over the course of three or four weeks (rounds). At the beginning of each week players buy stalls, and then take it in turns to roll for customers at the market. Each stall activates on a particular dice roll, giving the owner an income, and the player who rolls must select which particular stall that this customer buys from. If you're the only player with a stall that activates on a 10, then you might get a payout even on other players' turns!

Owning some stalls allows a player to re-roll or flip one of the dice, giving them much more of a chance to activate their high-profit jewelry or luxury watch stall... while some other stalls activate every time someone rolls their number, regardless of whose turn it is. Players must pick the best combination of stalls with their limited workforce to increase their chances of earning the most money by the end of market season.

Cinnamon Rolls is a single-sheet game that relies only on a few items most gamers will already have around the house, and is intended to be printed on the inside face of Christmas cards for gamers.

name: Rebonds
description:
Card game with a ball-sport theme.

At the beginning of the game, each player holds a hand of 5 cards and other cards cards put face down on the tables.
Three discard piles along with a 'referee' card are placed at the centre of the tables.

The cards feature a ball (i.e. football, rugby, volleyball or basketball) of one of four colours. The back of the card gives a clue on the face side, e.g. colours, shape...
The object of the game is to get rid of one's cards by playing them if the card colour doesn't mach the discard piles.

If a card matches both shape and colour, it bounces (hence the name) to another player's pile.

name: quizzone stories
description:
quizzone stories is a trivia game with 100 cards each containing 1 picture and 6 questions. The first question is based around the picture - the next is based on the answer to the first question and so on.

When the game ends can be freely decided and it is therefore a great game to bring on a road trip and the like... The winner is of course the one with the most correct answers.

name: White Lies
description:
White Lies is simple. Randomly pick a stone (don't show anyone the color).
White stone? You must lie.
Black stone? You must tell the truth.
Now take a card:
"Show the group your foot, then tell them your shoe size."
"Tell the group about a scar on your body and how you got it."
"What's the best trick you can currently perform on a trampoline?"
Who lies? Who tells the truth? Be the first to guess, and win.
Let the best lie detector win!

name: SCRATCH: a flea-bitten game
description:
Scratch is a dexterity/skill game with a hint of strategy, for 1 to 5 players.

The aim of the game is to score points by getting your fleas to jump onto Scratch the dog. You do this by skimming cards through the air to try to land on Scratch's card.

The fleas each have different abilities which can affect the points scored and there are other card types which also effect the game.

All the rules are on the cards themselves.

name: Pocket Sports GP Racing
description:
From the publisher:

Pocket Sports GP Racing is a light dice rolling game that simulates 1 - 4 cars/drivers competing on sections of 4 different tracks.

The game can be played solo or with 4 players. There are 4 international tracks and a Championship mode to earn victory points and carry over all tracks with the winner being the driver with most points awarded for position finishes.

Each driver/car has a card with varying abilities to use in race to thwart our opponents as well as hold off 'ghost' drivers.

The game contains 6 custom engraved dice, 4 team/driver cards, cubes, instructions and track sheet.

Full throttle, high octane dice rolling GP Racing. Take the wheel as one of 4 drivers competing in the grand championship across 4 International tracks. Overtake, swerve, bump and watch your fuel gauge!

name: Surviving Mars: The First Mission
description:
In the late 21st century, a coalition of wealthy governments, troubled by the continued destruction of earth's natural habitats, put together a team of elite astronauts to begin the first human settlement on Mars. Surviving Mars: The First Mission, is a game about those first few astronauts and how they managed to create the first settlement on Mars almost a century ago.

In this game, players must work together to construct a predesigned and prefabricated habitat consisting of a biosphere, a sustainable crop system and a number research laboratories. Additionally, players must complete a number of critical life supporting research tasks in order to ready the habitation system and the Martian terrain for the first wave of humans. The game can be played as a single experience, or series of episodes where player continue further the mission, and pick up where the last game left off.

This game is a cooperative (or solo) worker placement, dice rolling and deck building experience, that complement the push-your-luck feel of dice with the ever growing stability of deck building. Player cooperative choose teams of two astronauts (each with their won specialty) to complete missions over a series of episodes. Players take on the role of one of four characters; Biologist, Engineer, Researcher, or Commander. (An expansion is still in development that will allow a 5th character, the Medic.)

Each round players must cooperatively make both tactical and strategic decision with an overwhelming amount of unknowns. A successful Martian settlement means, players must strategically balance a number of risks: the natural risks of the Martian terrain and extreme Martian temperatures; solar radiation and sandstorms; the immediately fatal risks of damage to their life support systems or habitat; and, or course, starvation. All this while still maintaining the state of mental and physical health necessary to construct the full habitat before the next wave of humans arrives!

Can you survive the first mission to Mars?

description from the publisher:
categories: Adventure, City Building, Economic, Exploration, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Simulation, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Zen Squire
description:
Description from the publisher:

Zen Squire is a 2-4 player card game inspired by medieval marginalia, absurd illustrations found in the margins of medieval illuminated manuscripts. The first edition (released on Kickstarter) includes 72-cards, a 54-card main game plus an 18 card expansion. All illustrations and design elements were produced in pen and ink and hand-painted with watercolor.

The goal of Zen Squire is to collect 1,000 points. Each player begins the game with five cards, drawing one card and playing one card each turn. Cards are played into the area directly in front of each player, this area is your Castle, the total sum of which is your score. Diplomat cards contain positive or negative points. Any player can play Diplomat cards to any Castle. Once your Castle totals to 1,000 points, you win the game.

Challenger and Defender cards contain actions, which can be played to the Discard pile in order for their action to occur. Actions may allow players to draw additional cards, steal cards from opponents, or even swap Castles! Rulers are played to any Castle and pair with a Diplomat card already in that Castle. Rulers cannot be removed by Challenger or Defender cards. Multiple Ruler cards can be paired with the same Diplomat card. Once paired with a Diplomat, Rulers may double that card's points, change a negative value to a positive value, or make that card immune to all actions.

name: ROCKOMAN
description:
ROCKOMAN is a bigger and better version of the famous game ROCK–PAPER–SCISSORS. Fight with ROCKOMAN's superheroes to get the most points.

GAME PLAY
The players take turns going clockwise. On your turn, draw one card from the draw pile and place it, face up, next to the draw pile, in the discard pile. If your card beats the one of top of the discard pile, place all the cards in the discard pile in your point pile (rock beats scissors, scissors beat paper and paper beats rock).

When you draw a super card, place it face up next to your point pile. The super card beat card on the top of the discard pile at any time (rock suoer card beat scissors, paper super card beat rock and scissors super card beat paper).

When you place gun card, good card, sick card, rock-paper-scissors card, ring card in the discard pile, does the specified action to the opponent (take or give 3 cards, take his super card, play the standard game and the winner takes 5 cards from the loser’s point pile).

The game ends when the draw pile runs out. The winner is the player with the most points at the end of the game. Each card in your point pile is worth 1 point.

name: Gigant Yatzy
description: This is a Yathzee variant played with 12 dice. There are 47 categories to fill.

name: Honey Bees
description:
Description Game Rules:

Look around and see the flowers on the field. Little bees are flying from one flower to another. They are very busy with the great job of collecting pollen and nectar. Bees are working hard, humming from dawn till sunset while mixing pollen from various flowers. This is a very important action for plants and is called pollination. Plants would remain fruitless without pollination. In their hairy feet bees are carrying pollen to the beehives, where they continue working to produce sweet honey. It is not an easy job, though! Let's help the bees and fly up!

The game helps children to develop counting skills up to 10, train attention, fine motory movements and coordination, promotes ecological education, teaches to distinguish colours and sizes of objects.

---

In the game you roll with a die to move your bee from flower to flower. If the color of your bee matches the color of the flower you can take 1 or 2 point chips depending on the size of the flower. The point chips are puzzle pieces you can attach to your hive. As soon as the hive of one of the players is finished the other players get 3 more tries and the game is over. Then turn over your hive and count the points on the back of the point chips. The player with the most points wins the game.

name: 2 Kings
description:
2 Kings is a 2 player card game played with 2 sided cards. Each card has 2 military icons (top and bottom of card) and 2 negotiation icons (left and right side of cards). The game is played in 2 phases: collecting your army, then the battle.

In part 1 of phase 1, players draw a card from the 15 card Nobles deck and place them into a diamond shaped grid to form the disputed land. In part 2, players will move their King card through the land to form allegiances with the nobles by matching icons on the sides of both cards. At the end of phase 1, each player will have their army of 5 to 7 nobles.

In phase 2, players will create 3 battle lines to battle each other. The winner is the player who wins at least 2 of the 3 battles.

2 Kings is played with 18 cards, no other components. The game is completely free of any text, no reading is required.

2 Kings is an entry in the Boardgamegeek 2016 18 card PnP Contest.

name: De Fil en Aiguille
description:
In this cooperative game, one player will play the role of Braincat, while the rest of the players will be her potential Family. Braincat will try to make the Family guess its "Mystery-Card", at least 2 times on 3 possible rounds.
Braincat will initially draw 5 cards, the first one will be its Mystery-Cards and others are wild good chases. The Mystery-Card and the 4 wild good chases are Braincat's "Mastercards".
The Family goal is to retrieve the 4 wild good chase without eliminating the Mystery-Card.

When the game starts, 2 random Mastercards will be revealed, as well as 2 random hint cards.
Braincat will use its foot to indicate the most relevant hint between the 2 hints. Afterwards, the Family will have to eliminate one of the 2 Mastercards or asking a new hint with another foot.
Each time Family asks a new hint, the new one is put next another one, and Braincat must compare the last 2 hints on table, and choose the more relevant relative to its Mystery-Card.
But Braincat can only play 4 foot on 1 round, and 10 foot for the 3 rounds.

If Family eliminate the Mystery-Card, the game is lost for everyone. Otherwise, 1 new Mastercard is revealed.

The game features several themed decks with 60 cards each, "dive bar philosophy", "jobs and small villages", "Dating classified", ...
categories: Animals, Deduction, Party Game, Word Game

name: Ninja All-Stars: Inu Clan Kaiken
description:
Inu Clan Kaiken is a mercenary ronin for Ninja All-Stars. Ronin bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. As mercenaries, ronin may be used by any player, on any team. This makes ronin invaluable assets for every team, regardless of clan, since they may be used to supplement a team’s weaknesses in battle or further augment their strengths.

While seldom seen, the Inu are far more widespread than the other minor clans and far more congenial. Inu are very protective of their lands and their neighbors that treat them well, always coming quickly to their aid and fighting fiercely in their defense. Though small and compact, Inu clan warriors are whirlwinds of frenetic energy, and many opponents have retreated from these warriors’ sheer enthusiasm.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Fully Assembled Model
Furry, Faithful Canine Mercenary Ronin
categories: Adventure, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Miniatures, Sports, Video Game Theme
publishers: Heidelberger Spieleverlag, Ninja Division, Soda Pop Miniatures, Ulisses Spiele

name: Dragoonies
description:
The main characters in Dragoonies have discovered a treasure chest and naturally each of them wants to take as much of the gold as possible for themselves — but to do that, they need to solve tasks more quickly than anyone else.

At the start of play, a circle of sixteen dragon cards is formed in the center of the table; each card is different from each other, whether due to color, horns, or small objects with which they're equipped. On a turn, the active player reveals 2-6 search cards — with more cards making for a tougher challenge — then all the players race to determine the characteristics that are most common on the search cards, e.g., the color blue, a key, or three horns. Multiple solutions might exist, and when you find one, you want to cover an unoccupied dragon card that corresponds to the answer. If you do so correctly, you earn a Drachentaler, and whoever collects the most money in the end wins!

name: Ritual
description:
Description from the publisher:

Ritual is a strategic tile-laying game of magical dominance for two to five players. In Ritual you take on the role of a powerful wizard joining with other wizards to perform an intricate ritual of magic. Being a wizard, you must take this opportunity to prove once and for all that YOU are the best wizard by having the most influence over the ritual at its completion.

At its heart Ritual is about three things: tiles, runes and influence. Being a tile-laying game, Ritual’s core mechanic revolves around drawing hexagonal tiles one at a time from a common pool known as the ley line and placing them onto the scroll that serves as the board.

Each tile has three parts know as rune pieces. Throughout the game players try to match up identical rune pieces in groups of three known as runes. Runes players create can be activated to cause powerful effects capable of reshaping the board, but such power comes at a cost: influence. Each player gets a set of colored cubes known as influence cubes. These cubes are not only used to activate runes, but also to determine where you can play on the scroll and to tally your final score. Clever use of tiles, runes and influence is essential to winning a game of Ritual.

Ritual’s simple gameplay, deep strategy and beautiful presentation make it a fun game for beginners and experienced board-gamers alike.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Super Unicorn
description:
In the year 1240 Princess Ikio proclaimed all men must find her the Super Unicorn. In order to lure the Super Unicorn, players will roll dice and vie for the special stars needed to complete their search.

In clockwise order, players take turns rolling all dice available, and must lock in dice on up to three different different stacks of cards available or on cards they have earned during the game. They may repeat this process until they want to pass. If they fail to roll a die or dice that can be used, their turn ends immediately. When the stack of cards on the highest rated card is is depleted, the player with the most stars on their face up cards wins the game.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Card Game, Dice, Mythology

name: Realm-Master: A Game of Dice, Domination and Magic
description:
Now live on Kickstarter: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/639064444/realm-master-...
A wizard, a dwarf, an elf, a warrior, a squire and a princess battle it out for control of "the realm", made up of 4 regions chosen randomly. Each adventurer has a special power. A round starts with a random event and then players take it in turns rolling 6 dice, hoping to collect gold (useful for buying weapons, equipment, banners or curses), swords (for attacking opponents), hearts (for healing the damage) and half-banners (basically two of these = one victory point but one on its own is useless) There is also a blank side and a wildcard side. Players have one chance to re-roll any dice they don't like. Control of the realm enables players to gather more resources but also makes them vulnerable to attack. There can only ever be one player in the realm. There are two versions of the game: an elimination version (win by collecting 10 banners or eliminating everyone else) and a points version (players who lose all their life lose half their resources and re-spawn).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Rubber Band Game
description:
From the back of the box:

12 blocks.
250 rubber bands.
20 ways to play.
1 crazy fun game.

Roll the dice, take aim and let the laughter and craziness begin. How good is your aim? Will your awesome rubber band skills win? Find out!

Take aim and knock down your numbered block to win. Or play a speed round for some real knock down fun. With over 20 different ways to play, Its a super fun game for family, friends,...everyone.

GAME ON!

name: Fais-moi un mime
description:
Throw the 12-sided die and mime the action with the matching number on the reference cards. For more fun, you can add the Constraint Die to either mime on one leg, with your feet crossed, with one arm raised or while jumping. The player who guesses the most mimes correctly wins!
---
Lancez le dé de couleurs, il indiquera l'image que vous devez mimer. Pour encore plus de rires, ajoutez le dé de contraintes et mimez sur une jambe, les pieds croisés, un bras en l'air ou encore mimez en sautillant. Le joueur qui devine le plus grand nombre d'images gagne la partie.

name: Het Huis Anubis: Pecunia
description:
A game produced in collaboration with the Dutch bank Rabobank.
Extra bonus cards and components were available for saving enough money at said bank.

Translated from Dutch: Go prowling around The House Anubis and steal the mysterious items that Victor is trying to find. Buy those items that get you the most cash, save the money on your account or tempt fate by taking an Anubis-card. But, watch out for Victor. When he lands on your space he will take something from you. The person that plays smart and saves the most wins Het Huis Anubis - Pecunia!
categories: Children's Game, Economic, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Agents of Shield
description:
A card game for 2-4+ players based on the TV show Agents of Shield.

There are 2 decks: the SHIELD Deck and the PLOT Deck. All cards have a numerical level and most cards have one or more traits (Combat, Leadership, Support, Espionage, Computers, Engineering, Biochem).

Flip over the top 5 cards of the PLOT Deck. These are called the revealed plots.

Players take turns with each turn comprising 4 phases:

1. Recruit Phase
- A player fills his hand to 7 cards from the SHIELD deck.

2. Action Phase
- A player may reveal one card from his hand (do not discard it) and get one special benefit from it dependant on its trait (e.g. If it is a Spy card, look at an opponent’s hand and steal any 1 card)

3. Investigation Phase
- Play (discard) SHIELD cards from your hand with a total level matching or exceeding the level of a target revealed PLOT card. The SHIELD cards must also have traits that at minimum match the traits of the target PLOT card. If this is done the PLOT card is captured and put into the player’s victory pile. If possible, you may capture multiple revealed PLOT cards in a single turn. Every time a revealed PLOT card is captured immediately flip over another one from the top of the PLOT Deck so that there are always 5 revealed PLOT cards available.

4. Recovery Phase
- You may discard up to 2 SHIELD cards from your hand.

The game ends when all PLOT cards have been captured. The winner is the player who has the greatest number of PLOT cards in his victory pile when the game ends. If tied the player with the most levels worth of PLOT cards wins.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Last Full Measure: The Battle of Second Manassas
description:
Description from the publisher:

Last Full Measure is a free print-and-play game of the Battle of Second Manassas, the second game in the LFM series.

A brigade scale game that uses regiment counters, as opposed to generic line markers, to spread the brigade over multiple hexes according to it's size. Ranged artillery fire, cavalry charges, command and control, all in only eight pages of rules. Play aids include Player-aid card with CRT and other charts and table; Eliminated Units card, Order of Arrival card, and 634 2-sided counters.

The Battle Book includes two Scenarios; Groveton, August 28th: The Full Battle and Longstreet Arrives, August 29th and an initial strength chart.

The map measures 39" x 35" at a scale of 250 yard per 3/4" hex.
AND just added (July 25, 2018), a 21" x 35" map extension to the west with a new Order of Arrival card to accommodate the new map.
A new ZunTzu box also incorporates the new map extension.

The full game is available for download at: http://UhlanGames.us
as are Zun Tzu gameboxes for all LFM games
categories: American Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Goat Lords: Celebrity Expansion
description:
Expansion for the Goat Lords what add celebrity goats to the game.

The goal of Goat Lords is to gather the biggest goat herd. You do so by stacking pairs of matching goat cards in front of you and stealing opponent's goats before the draw pile runs out.

Knowing how to play your cards, when to hold 'em, and who to attack greatly affect how many points you end up when the last goat is played.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Confabula Rasa
description:
Confabula Rasa is a cooperative word construction and storytelling game for two to six players featuring a deck of non-linear word fragment cards. You play as ghosts possessing a group of kids in a cabin in the woods, trying to figure out how you died by piecing together your fragmented memories.

Play is started by shuffling the 26 double-sided word fragment cards (Fewer cards can be used for a faster game). Each player is dealt one card (they can flip the card to the other side at any time). One card is placed in the middle of the table. Any player may start play. The first player places the card from their hand onto the tableau so that it forms a word using one or more letters from the card already in the tableau. The player may put the card on top of the card already on the table, or slide the card underneath, as long as the card on the table is not shuffled around. When the first player has formed a word, they draw a word fragment card from the pile and point to another player. The player pointed to must start to tell the story of the death of the ghosts from the ghosts’ point of view, incorporating the word that was just made. For example, if the first player formed the word “angst,” the player they pointed to could say: “The last thing I remember is a feeling of angst as I slumped through the halls.”

Any player may go next by adding their card to the growing tableau to make a new word and pointing to a player to continue the story (as long as a player does not make a word twice in a row). Play continues until all the cards in the deck and players' hands are gone. The last person to make a word points to the player who will bring the story to a satisfactory close in which "Everyone dies!"

The inspiration behind the game is "anyone can be a storyteller!"

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Real-time

name: Evolve: Lights of the Deep
description:
Evolve: Lights of the Deep is a fast-playing card game for 2-4 players, set in the abyssal depths of the ocean. Within the all-consuming darkness of the sea, each player begins life as a single-celled organism and must go through evolutionary progressions to become the most complex life form. Evolve is a competitive game that involves aspects of hand management, tactical decision making and a take-that style of sabotage.

In the game, players need to establish evolutionary links to their current life form, before being able to progress to the subsequent level of organism. Many organisms and evolutionary links have additional bonuses or dual uses, so players are often required to make decisions about when to play cards, or when to keep them in hand. Additionally, ‘adaptation’ cards can also be used to increase the development of your organism, or to hinder players.

During each turn, players perform 6 moves, where they can choose to pick-up, discard or play cards (each action costs 1 move). Evolve gameplay is intuitive yet simple (this is a family-friendly game), while also allowing for various strategies and play styles.

—description from the designer

name: Monopoly: Málaga-Costa del Sol
description:
An exclusive edition of Monopoly: Malaga-Costa del Sol

An extract from the back of the box :- "With the Sun of Andalusia in the background, the Malaga-Costa del Sol edition of MONOPOLY combines some of the most beautiful and emblematic places of this land. "
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Naughty or Nice Special Play Promo Card
description: A promotional Special Play card included in the December 2017 issue of White Dwarf.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Who Dares Wins
description:
Could you name the UK’s 10 longest rivers or 10 most popular brands of chocolate? If not all 10, then how many do you think you could name?

Based on the hit UK TV show presented by Nick Knowles, this is a game of lists, bidding, dares and steals.

This highly entertaining, family game will have teams bidding and challenging on how many items they can name from a particular category list but which team will have the courage to hold their nerve and win the valuable places! Test your knowledge and skill and see how many of the ten answers you can name from each list.

Be careful though, get an answer wrong and the other players will get a chance to steal! There are also dare cards to be collected along the way that may just help you out but how brave will you be?
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: IMO
description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



This appears to be an unauthorized version of Bazaar.




Strategy game that includes die rolling, resource management, and order fulfillment.

The object of the game is to get the most points. Players do this by collecting ‘dot cards’. To collect the ‘dot cards’ players need to hand in the correct number of matching coloured dots Players get chips by rolling a die to collect chips of different colour or trading chips to acquire different colours (trade values are determined on a track). Three piles of five dot cards are available for acquisition by players during the game.

The endgame value of the ‘dot cards’ depends on two factors:
The number of stars on cards (0-3) and the number chips a player has left over at the end of the game (points diminish with each left over chip, but maxing out at ‘3 or more chip’ penalty).

After the first ‘dot card’ stack runs out, the other cards all increase in one ‘star value.’ Once the last ‘dot card’ is taken, players calculate final scores and the highest score wins. In the case of a tie, the player with the fewest ‘dot cards’ wins.

—user summary

name: 商会都市の商人たち (Shoukai Toshi no Shounin Tachi)
description:
User summary
商会都市の商人たち (Shoukai Toshi no Shounin Tachi) is about the 'Merchants in the Syndicate City'.

You have to draft and collect area and product cards. You will obtain points according to the cards you get: for the areas where you have a majority, for the connected areas you control, and points for the products. After 3 rounds, the player who has collected the most VP will become the winner.

Publisher's summary
エリアと商品が書かれたカードをドラフトして集めます。
集めたカードによって「エリアマジョリティによるエリアごとの得点」「自分が支配するエリアの連結による得点」「商品ごとの得点」を獲得します。
３ラウンド行い、最も得点の高い人が勝者となります。
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Dirty Squad
description:
What’s the Dirty Squad?
The Dirty Squad is a bunch of dirty cops within the precinct, recruited by the Mafia.

What is the purpose of their recruitment?
A number of killers have been brought to the station for questioning, whom they must covertly help escape.

How do they do this?
The victim’s friends and family members, innocent bystanders, witnesses, and accomplices have been summoned to the station as well. Using them as cover, the cops must bluff the killers out. They’ll do whatever it takes to get the job done, even if it means using every dirty move in the book to do so.

What do they get for this work they're doing?
The dirtiest cop — the one who lets the most number of killers escape, wins the game by becoming the Squad’s undisputed leader and the Mafia’s highest-paid Inside Man. A reputed spot that can only be won by playing dirty!

Test your skills in this underhanded bluffing card game and find out if you've got what it takes to out-bluff and outsmart the others and become the undisputed leader of your Squad!

What's in the box:
There are 122 cards — a mix of Character Cards and Power Cards:
25 Killers, 12 Accomplices, 12 Family Members, 12 Witnesses, 12 Victim’s Friends, 12 Innocent Bystanders, 2 Character Impersonators + 35 Power Cards + 70 medal tokens. 

The aim of the game:
To release the most number of killers from your hand. 

How to Play:
You start by shuffling the deck of cards thoroughly and dealing 7 cards to each player, along with 3 medal tokens. 

You have to bluff the killers out of your hand, so when you want to let go of killers, they must be disguised as any of the other characters. You must never announce the fact that you are releasing a killer. 

Hand Example: you have 2 killers, 2 family members, 1 innocent bystander and 2 power cards in your hand, and in your first turn you want to release killers:
Place one or both of the Killer Cards face down and announce ANY OTHER character. (Say: 2 Family Members)
Only you know that the two cards are NOT Family Members but the others have to gauge whether you are bluffing or telling the truth
The player to your immediate left gets to decide whether he would like to open the cards and check them, or trust you and let them pass. If he passes it goes to the next player and the decision falls upon him. If no one checks your cards they go face down in your Released Pile. No one knows what cards have gone except you

If a player decides to check your cards: in this case, since you did bluff, you have to give 3 medal tokens to that player. That player ‘catches’ the killers you were trying to help escape and keeps them in his custody.

Custody: is when a player catches another player’s killers and keeps them face UP in front of them. This does not bode well for you, since, all the dirty cops are looking to help escape the most number of players. And when you get caught, it costs you more than just your pride

But: if you haven’t bluffed and a player checks your cards, then, they must give you 3 medal tokens for wrongful doubt, and those cards go face down in your Released Pile. Draw back to 7 cards in hand at the end of your turn. 

Securing Killers: Coming back to caught killers. These killers can be stolen by any of the players, so they must be secured. You can do so by placing up to 4 medal tokens on them. To steal a killer is harder now because the player will have to match the number of tokens on the killer to be able to steal it unless he has a Power Card that allows him to steal without having to give to give tokens. 

To release killers from your custody, you can do 1 of 2 things: 
Give 5 medal tokens and close the killer, or, use the Power Card that allows you to release the killer without having to give any tokens at all 

The Power Cards play an important role in the game too. Each Power Card has its description on the card itself. Please read through the cards to understand them better. But, with those in play, the game keeps changing until the very end. 

So, on your turn, you do one of the following:
Take 3 medal tokens (caps at 8. If you have 8 in hand you cannot take more)
Play character cards 
Play action cards 
Release killers 

The game ends when: 
When there are no playable cards in any player’s hands. 

Scoring:
The player to have the most number of killers in their released pile is the winner. 
But know this, any killers left in hand cancel out 1 killer from the closed pile. So make sure you let go of all the killer from your hand. 

If there’s a tie, then if any player has open killers in their custody wins

name: Coffee House
description:
In late 17th-century London, people from all walks of life gathered at coffee houses to hear the latest news and exchange information.

In Coffee House, you are a newspaper publisher. Gather news at various coffee houses and periodically publish papers in order to establish yourself as the most reputable newspaper in London. Expand your understanding of various fields of study and keep track of publication trends. By covering topics as they reach the peak of public interest, you will gain great fame and renown.

•••

17世紀末のイギリスでは
多くの人が集まるコーヒーハウスは、情報交換の場として発展しました。

あなたは新聞発行人となり
コーヒーハウスでニュースを集め、定期的に新聞を発行し、
新聞発行人としての地位を確立することを目指します。

各分野の専門知識を深めながら、
世間の関心に応えた新聞を発行し、多くの名声を獲得しましょう。
publishers: analog lunchbox (アナログランチボックス)

name: Inkarumi
description:
Inkarumi ("Stone of the king") is a roll and write game in which the players aim to be the first to fill their entire pyramid of 21 fields. Six sixes are needed for the bottom row, five fives for the next, etc., with one one topping off the pyramid.
On a turn, a player rolls six dice only once and can check off all fields that are supported by two fields in the row below. However, if they roll more of a number than the row supports, they cannot fill that row. When a player rolls the exact dice to finish their pyramid, they have to yell "Inkarumi". If another players yells first, they roll is forfeit. Anyone who calls out "Inkarumi" in error has to delete some previously filled fields. The first player to completely fill their pyramid is the winner.

name: Tabu
description:
Gaming. Easy to learn but particularly captivating, previously known in Belgium under the name of "Anchor and Sun", banned in public in that country. The board consists of 6 squares, illustrated with the sign of the clover, hearts, diamond, spades, anchor and sun.

Three dice are provided with these same symbols. Players can bet game money in one or more squares of the board.

The player who plays the "banker" in each turn rolls the dice, and depending on what the players have bet and what the dice indicate on the table, the players can win 1 to 3 times the bet amount or lose it between 1 and 2 times.

name: Bones of the Caribbean
description:
Bones of the Caribbean is a small format, competitive game for 2-5 players in which you play as pirates vying for the most reputation by raiding islands, burying treasure, stealing plunder, navigating storms, and attacking rivals. The ultimate scourge takes the prize of the seas.

The game uses "take that" and press-your-luck mechanisms. You roll to take actions, but pressing your luck might cause you to get scurvy. Every result allows you to interact with another player in some fashion, whether you're digging up a rival's treasure, attacking their ship or island, plundering the sea, causing storms to damage other ships, or creating a mutiny on someone's ship. Along the way, you'll score points for building ships, hiring a crew, taking plunder, burying treasure, and winning combat.

name: Tuscany & Euphoria Crossover Structures
description:
The Euphoria crossover promo deck is cards that all have a negative passive effect, but they also all have a useful residual effect that triggers at the end of every year. You build them for yourself just like any other structure. Whether the negative is worth the positive effect depends on your strategy for the game.

Never released separately

name: Lepanto
description:
The table is used as a game board. Both parties begin with their 15 ships on opposite sides on the table (harbors) and try to reach the enemy harbor to land troops. The ships may shell and sink each other. Movement is 4 movement units per turn, while shelling is 6 shots per turn. Shelling is done by snipping plastic discs from the felt pads on the ships. Each class of ships may transport a certain number of troops and can withstand a certain number of hits till it is sunk. Sunk ships are removed from the game.

The first player to land 400 troops at the enemy harbor wins the game.

name: Hail Hydra: Agent Coulson Promo Card
description:
Originally available at GenCon 2018

Hail Hydra - Agent Coulson

Player Card

Special ops:
Before votes are started, once per game (if you have not revealed yourself as a hydra) you may pick a hero other than yourself to draw 4 attack cards.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Last Full Measure: The Battles of Aldie, Middleburg, and Upperville
description:
Alfred Plesanton battles with J. E. B. Stuart's cavalry along the Ashby's Gap Turnpike, trying to determine where Lee's Army of Northern Virginia is going.

The game, now retitled: Last Full Measure: Plesanton's Reconnaissance is a free print-and-play game of the battles of Aldie, Middleburg, and Upperville, June 17th-21st, 1863; the fifth game in the LFM series of battles of the American Civil War.

A brigade scale game that uses regiment counters, as opposed to generic line markers, to spread the brigade over multiple hexes according to it's size. Ranged artillery fire, cavalry charges, command and control, all in only eight pages of rules. Play aids include Player-aid card with CRT and other charts and table; Eliminated Units card, Order of Arrival card, and 240 2-sided counters.

This map measures a long 82" x 24" at a scale of 250 yard per 3/4" hex. Printed at a reduced scale and 5/8" hexes will make it about 69" long.

All print-and-play files are downloadable at: Uhlan Games

-description from designer
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Coma Ward: Cataclysmic Abominations Expansion
description:
Cataclysmic Abominations contains 12 new Phenomena for Coma Ward dealing with supernatural themes. The Phenomena include:


The Doctor, the Dinosaur, and the Cerebral Digitizer
Alien Ant Farm
If Hell Were Only Pain, This Place Would Be Paradise
If I Kill a Rich One
As Time and Reality Dissolve
To Hell and Back
Messiah Complex
Ghost of a Chance
What Wicked Dreams We Weave
Are Gods Born or Made?
Sanctuary, Part 1
Sanctuary, Part 2
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror, Mature / Adult
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Don't Get Got!: Essen Edition
description:
Extra pack of challenges given away at the 2018 Essen Spiel fair.

This game is all about completing secret missions, so when you open the pack, make sure that you read the rules and don't look at all the cards. Otherwise, you won't be able to play - which would be very sad indeed.

name: Jeu du loup: Le loup qui voulait changer de couleur
description:
Based on the children book "The Wolf Who Wanted to Change His Color" by Orianne Lallemand.

Two players race to identify the wolf cards with both colors of these two players, while the color of the player is defined by the back side of the last card he took.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Novel-based

name: 1812: Scorched Earth
description:
1812 is the third game of Conflict Simulations LLC's 2140 series, small-footprint wargames that play within 2 hours and no more than 140 counters. It covers the French invasion of Russia in 1812 and their attempt to force a political collapse against the Tsar.

Units are infantry corps and cavalry divisions, who each belong to one of their nation's Army Groups. Army groups are led by leaders who generate Command Points each turn, used to order units under their command.

French supply is limited, the player must manage this limited resource throughout the whole campaign in order to succeed. The Russian player must carefully manage a defensive campaign while keeping the pressure on Poland and Prussia. The Russian player must also manage national morale as to not demoralize the population by burning down cities and the countryside, as was done historically.

Combat has players rolling 1-3d6 depending on the number of Strength Points being used in combat. Both sides must manage Attrition as to make sure not to whittle away their forces needlessly. The game covers the drive on Moscow from late June through the end of December of 1812. Prussian and Austrian units are included as they were present historically.

Each hex is approximately 25 miles. Each turn covers 2 weeks and each Strength Point is the equivalent of 10,000 men and their accompanying artillery batteries.

WEIGHT: 4/10
SOLITAIRE: 7/10
PLAYERS: 1-2

—description from the publisher

name: DoppioGioco a Berlino
description:
In DoppioGioco a Berlino, every place (café, museum, street or building) can be the perfect stage to meet other spies. Players are secret agents of the two main opposing agencies: CIA and KGB. In every turn, someone will have to secretly contact another spy, making a gesture but trying not to be yielded by the others, and give them a precious top secret Dossier.

In this game of stealthy looks, interceptions, paranoia and deductions, you will need to understand who your teammates are and collect with them the 4 Dossiers necessary to win. But watch out for to the mole: there might be a double-agent among your allies!
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Party Game, Real-time, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Variable Phase Order

name: Warhammer Armies (Fourth Edition): Dark Elves
description:
Warhammer Armies: Dark Elves is an expansion to the 4th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Dark Elves faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Das kunterbunte Igelrennen
description: On the berries, get set, go! Who is the fastest hedgehog at the annual hedgehog race? In this original color cube running game, the colorful berries set the pace ... Since it may happen that one or the other berry is lost or stolen by another hedgehog. Squirrel and mouse are waiting for the festive Beerenschmaus at the finish. An exciting race for the berries! For children from 4 years.

name: Make a MOOO've
description:
A fast-paced fun game in which players compete to be the first to make the sound of an animal or call the name of a fruit.
The player who wins the most cards wins!

Place all cards in a pile face down.
One of the players rolls the dice and a card from the pile is flipped over.
There are 3 possible ways to win a card. The player with the most cards by the end of the game – wins!


—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Party Game

name: Koty i Myszy
description:
In a certain old house, mice began to love. These little creatures, although friendly-looking, cause a lot of damage to a household storeroom. Guarding it are two fat, fluffy cats who keep the food secure and try to catch as many mice as they can.
—description from the rulebook (translated)

One player plays as the Mice (12) and one player plays as the cats (2). Mice tries to get to the Yellow spaces near the cat player's base (purple spaces are mouse traps): Mice can not move backwards and can also not jump over another pawn. The cats capture mice by jumping over it like in checkers or halma, and can capture multiple mice provided there is an empty space between them to land on.

The game ends when there are no mice on white, blue or orange spaces, and the winner is the player with most points:
1 point for the Mouse player for each mouse who entered the Storeroom (yellow spaces)
1 point for the Cat player for each captured mouse
—user summary

name: Charley Harper's Spot the Birds
description:
Grab your binoculars and keep an eagle eye to the sky with Charley Harper’s Spot the Birds. It’ll be a hoot! Peregrinate through the board’s five habitats—the Backyard, the Desert, the Woodland, the Wetland, and the Shores—and track each bird you spot by collecting the tokens for each space you land on and placing the token on your birder's journal. Roll the die to see how many spaces you move along the outer loop (the habitat loop).

Along the way, you’ll discover how to be a good bird steward. But watch out—you’ll need to dodge storms, avoid falling in a river, and beware of birds that poop on your head (it happens). All of these will negatively impact your turn, in some cases sending you backward or in other cases making you put a token back, and some will have a global impact on all players.

The game has three different levels to play at, from standard to more difficult. Once you spot the required number of birds, which is determined at the beginning of the game, then the game becomes a race to the finish. Turn up one of the four trails to the Bird Sanctuary and be the first to reach the end and you’ll rule the roost!
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental, Humor

name: Marvel Spider-Sense Spider-man Battle Game
description:
Each player assumes the role of one of six possible Marvel characters, Spider-man, Black Cat, Lizard, Green Goblin, Rhino and Sandman. The object of the game is to eliminate your opponents. You do this by taking away their powers. The player who is able to defeat all of his or her opponents wins the game.

—user summary

name: Worge
description:
Worge is a multi-player card game for 2 or more players (although we recommend a group of 4+ for maximum fun) based on creating words that combine the sound / meaning of two different words (aka portmanteaus). Think hangry which combines “hungry” and “angry” or brunch which combines “breakfast” and “lunch”. Worge combines the words “word” and “merge”, it’s our fun way of describing a portmanteau!

The really fun thing is, something you come up with during a round of Worge could become part of your group’s vocabulary for years to come. It's the game that keeps on giving!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Tower Beast Slayers: Catacombs Expansion
description:
After the Guardians saved the Kingdom from the Dragon, they realized the real evil was below...

With the threat of the Werewolf, 4 new Guardians emerge to save the Kingdom! Play as the Ogre, Rogue, Blood Mage, and Necromancer.

Now you can go head to head with other Guardians to see who the true heroes are!

This is an expansion as you need components from the base game.

name: The Awful Orphanage: Stragglers Pack
description: An expansion pack for The Awful Orphanage that contains miniatures for Weasel and Genius and their Orphan Cards.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Miniatures, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement

name: atommix
description:
atommix is a card game visually portraying the 118 elements of the periodic table, allowing players to experience true chemistry through visual storytelling.

The art was created by Extra Crunchy and guest artists from different fields around the world, from street artists to visionary artists.

Each element is described by it's unique properties (or effects) by simple icons and artwork that tell the story of the element.
This makes it quick and easy to learn and remember true chemistry.

The game has 5 levels of play.
Each level adds complexity and strategy to the game.

Explore the elements by creating a "chain reaction".
Use the Action Cards: Alchemist, Atom Smasher and Nuclear fusion to manipulate and challenge the other players.

The winner is the first player to discard their last card.
If you love art and science this game is just for you.

—description from the designer

name: GameDay Football
description:
GameDay Football is a roll and write press your luck game. Your goal is to score a touchdown before defenders box you in and time runs out. Do you have what it takes to lead your team to victory? Your fans are about to find out because it is GameDay.

—description from the designer

name: Gold Mine
description:
This simple push-your-luck game is basically an adaptation of Diamant/Incan Gold for play with the Green Box of Games game system.

Play:
Each turn, a new card is turned up on the table. The number on the card denotes how many gold nuggets are to be found. Now each player must decide whether to continue or flee, before the next card is turned up.

Players that run away get to collect and divide all the treasure left on the cards. They are then out of the game for the rest of the round.

Play continues until all players have left, or until three cards with identical symbols have been placed on the table. Then the cavern collapses, and any players remaining inside will lose all the treasure they collected this round.

Winner:
After 4 rounds, count the total gemstones each player has collected. The winner is the player with the most gold.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Doodle Doo
description:
Do you have the guts to digest your way through the animal maze? Place your pen on the game board, cover your eyes with the mask and draw! If your pen touches the side of the intestine maze, one of the other players will let you know with the squeeze of the included fart cushion. The first player to successfully create a path through the bowels, and reach the finish line, wins!

Contains mazes with two difficulty levels!
Hilarious gameplay is sure to entertain players of all ages.
Comes with wipe-clean boards, an eye mask and a fart cushion!


-description from publisher

name: Wissen & Quizzen: Gefährliche Raubtiere
description:
In this card game 3 assistants "Käpt'n Quizzo" (KQ), "Tina Tiger" (TT) and "Maja Mau-Mau" (MM) guide through one of 3 different game modes.


Knowledge: Learn about the animals specified on 26 different cards with TT.
Trivia game: All players answer KQs questions and score victory points. KQ announces the winner at the end of the game.
Card Game with MM


For all games the Tiptoi pen is required.
The Cards can be combined with any of other Game of Wissen & Quizzen Series for more variety of trivia themes.

name: Hatchimals Hatchtopia Game
description:
The Hatchimals are back with a brand new game, featuring five exclusive figures for Season Two, including two surprise figures in their own Hatchimals eggs. Travel around the gameboard hatching eggs and bringing your character home. An EGGcellent time is sure to be had by all!
—description from the publisher

Roll the die, move along the track, and when you get to a location, you can reveal one unhatched egg on the board. If you have the Hatchimal that matches one on the board, you get to keep it; otherwise, it goes back into its egg to be found another time. Be the first player to match five egg tokens and five egg cards to win!
—user summary
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Monopoly: NASCAR NEXTEL Cup Series
description:
The Championship is yours for the taking! Win the "NASCAR NEXTEL Cup Series trophy" in this fast-paced, thrill-seeking Monopoly game. Chase drivers like Kurt Busch, Jeff Gordon, Ryan Newman; racing legends like Rusty Wallace, Sterling Marlin, Tony Stewart and the hottest rookie drivers like Jamie McMurray, Kasey Kahne and Greg Biffle. Grab pole position and enjoy the classic game play of Monopoly with a NASCAR NEXTEL Cup Series twist.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Schatzsuche in der Buchstaben-Burg
description: Using the Tip-Toi system, hunt for missing animal tiles by playing a variety of minigames put forward by the dragon.

name: Green EGO
description:
EGO, but with the questions being more personal, about the active player. Integrates well with original EGO and the other variants.

—user summary

name: Smart Ass Geek Chic
description:
If you’re a little geeky, you know tech hot spots and your bits from your bytes. Your heroes might even be scientists. Don’t wait—yell out the answer as soon as you know it! Get your geek on! Geek Chic works great as a standalone card game, or as an expansion pack for the Smart Ass board game.

Players take turns asking trivia questions from the deck of Question Cards. Question Cards come in three categories: What Am I?, Where Am I?, and Who Am I? The starting player begins to read the eight clues on the Question Card aloud while all other players yell out their answers (they each get one shot at the correct answer). The player who answers the question correctly keeps that Question Card. If no player answers correctly, the reader keeps the Question Card. Play passes to the left. The first player to collect four Question Cards wins.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Trivia

name: The Game of Life: The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel Edition
description:
Inspired by Midge Maisel's life in the Amazon Original Series, The Game of Life: The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel Edition board game has players seeking fame and fortune during 1950s New York City. Maybe you'll get married, have kids, buy a dream home, go on vacation in the Catskills, and make it as a stand-up comic. Then again, maybe you won't. You could get divorced, bomb at the jokes, and end up in a dumpy apartment. Choose a path and find out what life has in store for you. The player with the most money at the end of the game wins — unless someone hits it big time in comedy!

—description from the publisher

name: Diceborn Heroes: Campaign Treasure Pack
description:
A fan funded treasure pack of heroes and Quests. Includes new challenges, haunted manors, monstrous caverns and labyrinths. With these new quests heroes have new skills and items to help them protect those in need...

44 Hero cards [some extra of existing or alt versions; and a few new classes)

6 Questlines made up of -
12 attack cards
12 legendary items
20 boss/quest specific cards
20 quest cards
6 boss cards
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: 理の理 (Ri no ri, Logic and Psychology)
description:
理の理' (Ri no ri, Logic and Psychology) is a card-drafting game for two players. The title is derived from two kanji words: 論理 (logic) which means in this game you can win by precise deduction, and 心理 (psychology) which means in this game you can win by bluffing as well. So the title implies this is a game of deduction vs. bluffing.

A round consists of two phases: mustering phase and battle phase.

During the mustering phase, players draft revealed soldier cards to form their hand of five cards each.

A battle phase consists of five battles. During a battle, the attacker places a card face-down from their hand. The backside of the placed card has partial information about the soldier's identity. The defender looks at it, and places a card from their hand. Then they reveal both cards.

A soldier card has its soldier type and power value printed on it. If both players have played a soldier of the same type, the soldier with the lower value wins the battle. Otherwise one with the higher value wins the battle, but some types get a bonus power against a certain type.

A new round begins after the fifth battle. When a plyer has won total of six battles, that player immediately wins the game.

Players know the identity of some cards their opponent has drafted, and the partial information is printed on backside of each card, which means defender can predict which card attacker has played. But there's some chance of attacker's bluff if carefully drafted. You should consider your opponent's intention to win the game.
user summary

ラウンドの前半では場に公開されているカードを順番に獲得して自分の手札を構築し、後半では１枚ずつ使用することで相手と勝負を行います。
各ラウンド５回勝負を行い、先に一定数の勝利をおさめることでゲームに勝利します。
カードごとの相性による修正や同種衝突による強弱逆転によりどのカードをいつ使うかの判断が、またカードウラ面により一部情報がわかるのでそれを元に最適解を見つける要素があります。
publisher's summary
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Open Drafting, Race, Stat Check Resolution

name: Reality Check
description:
A who-fits-this-description-best game with a taser.

In each round a player is the executioner and reads this round's statement card. Each other player votes on who the statement fits best, and that person gets the card. Some cards are zap cards, and if you win a zap card, the executioner will zap you with the taser.

At the end of the game the points from the won cards are added, and the player with most points wins.

name: Taboo Speak Out
description:
It's a Game Mashup: Two favorite brands come together to create one awesome game. This Taboo game has a Speak Out twist. The timer counts down as players try to get teammates to guess the forbidden word without saying the 5 other words on the Word card. But players have to do this wearing a mouthpiece that makes it really hard to understand what they're saying. Challenge cards mix things up and add to the funny, tongue-tying gameplay. Sometimes everyone on the team has to wear a mouthpiece, making for even more laughs! The Game Mashup Taboo Speak Out game is a great idea for family game night, parties, and get-togethers for teens and tweens ages 13 and up.

—description from the publisher

name: MindMaze: Bits and Bobs
description:
In Mind Maze players will be told a story and must figure out why and how the story happened by asking questions that can be answered with "Yes" or "No". The person telling the story can also choose to answer with “Not Important” if players start getting too far off track.

Mind Maze allows players to test their skills of deduction and investigation, and to get to the bottom of the mystery with as few questions as possible. Players take turns asking questions, and lose a point for every question they ask. Points can be gained by asking specific key questions which also help players to figure out the true version of the story. This encourages players to think carefully about the questions they ask and to work together.

name: 銀河大国 (Regional Colonialism Wars)
description:
銀河大国 (ギャラクティックパワーズ) (Regional Colonialism Wars) is a Japanese game of strategic conquest in space. The Japanese title translates more closely as 'Galactic Powers' and the designer uses 'Galapa' for short.

Players develop planets by constructing facilities, improving technology, and developing spacecraft. Victory points can be earned through construction of the orbit elevator, the status of spacecraft development, and the population settled.

The game of space exploration wars uses worker placement with an rondel action track. When the game starts, players focus on infrastructure development, such as building facilities on the home planet and developing and strengthening spacecraft while advancing technology. Then, players build a subspace transfer device and move to an unexplored planet to pursue exploration. However, this involves the dangers of space pirates.

Discovering planets and building orbital elevators can also give you victory points, but the most points come from the population of settlers on exoplanets. The most settlers on the planet will be awarded the total number of facilities built on the planet as victory points.

But runners-up will be given the final total population of that planet as victory points. This means players must balance the development of facilities with the growth of the settlements. Produce too many settlers against facilities and the other players gain. Judging this expansion is important and the designer says it gives the game high replayability.

The game was released at Game Market in Spring 2019. The designer found some errata in the rulebook, and gave out a free card to fix an error on one card.
user summary
categories: Pirates, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Transportation
