mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Rondel, Worker Placement

name: Connect 4: Blast!
description: Reimplementation of the classic game of Connect 4 with players using a pre-loaded board and to trying to create a Connect 4 by knocking out discs by launching Nerf foam darts from Nerf blasters.

name: Belona
description:
Belona is a fictional city inspired by all aspects of the Cyberpunk style. In this strategical 9 cards game, you will experience the rivalry between factions in the quest for domination of the city. In a simple game system, you can control a faction and take to the streets with groups under your command, seeking to dominate areas to gain skills, gain respect and influence, increase your resources and show rival factions that you are here to stay!

Each player controls a faction that is made up of groups. Each group moves around the board and can purchase items to increase their strength and then challenge opponents to combat. Each fight is resolved usually by rolling dice.

The winning faction is the one that dominates the most areas or defeats all groups of the enemy faction.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Events, Multiple Maps, Zone of Control

name: Pantomima
description:
Party game in which you must pass the password to your team without using words. The only tools we have are gestures and
body language - your ... or your opponent's body. Getting to the finish is seemingly easy, but the UNIQUE BOARD is on the road to victory. participants
they constantly modify the appearance of the path and influence their position on the opponent's pawn. You can be sure of one thing - to win
only the big three lead you:
BOLD, IMAGINATION AND TACTICS!

name: We Didn't Playtest This Either with Blue Cards and What's the Point? expansions
description:
The objective of the game is to win! If you lose, you have not won, and you are in fact out of the game. If everyone except you has lost, you win!

To begin the game, shuffle all the cards together and deal two to each player. Pick someone to go first, as randomly as possible!

On your turn, draw one card from the deck, and then play one card from your hand. Just follow the instructions on the card! After you’re done, play passes to the player on your left.

Blue Cards: Instead of your turn, you may draw and play a Blue Card. You may only do this if you have already taken a turn and do not have a Blue Card in front of you. Do not look at the Blue Card as you draw it, and flip it face up tp any of the four sides. Read the part of it that is facing you.

What's the Point?: Instead of playing a card on your turn, you may discard four cards from your hand and say "What's the point?" After a count of three, each player must point at another player. Then draw and read a card from this deck.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Advantage Token, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Interrupts, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Take That

name: Gierki Małżeńskie: Między słowami
description: Here is the perfect proposition for couples craving for intelligent entertainment. Test your own word-formation skills, push the limits of imagination and develop above-average knowledge of interesting interesting words. Full of twists and turns of the game is completed by an impressive finale that unexpectedly applies inside a dark bag.

name: Tick-Tock Orders
description:
Tick-Tock Orders is a real-time cooperative game where the players are skilled artisans who have gathered in a workshop trying to complete many, many urgent orders.

Orders may require basic ingredients or products which need to be crafted. To begin the game, all ingredients are placed face down, and will also include a few mice which have been chewing on things.

During the game, players are turning tiles face up to look for what they need to complete the orders, or place on the crafting boards to make certain products. Once used, tiles are placed in the box lid, and when the players need a refill of ingredients, the box lid is dumped onto the table such that most of the tiles will be face down.

After around 5 minutes, the players calculate their score based upon how many orders were completed, with bonus points available for orders that have the same background colors.

name: Body Count in Laos, 1971
description:
This game simulates Operation Lam Son 719, the ARVN incursion into Laos in 1971. An armored brigade drove up Route 9 from near Khe Sanh and was supported by troops airlifted to six landing zones.

The map (assembled from four sections) covers the region along Route 9 from the Ho Chi Minh trail in the northwest to some way east of Aloui in the southeast. The scale is approximately 800 yards per hex. There are 369 uncut counters.

There are 16 three-day turns. The main ARVN objectives are Aloui and Tchepone.

One feature of the game is the initiative roll beginning each turn, which is weighed by modifiers such as the ARVN body count. Only the side winning the roll gets a combat phase. In addition, if the ARVN wins the roll they get to conduct air strikes, and if the NVA wins they get to conduct an artillery barrage. The air strikes need to be planned and then are affected by weather.

A wrinkle in the combat system is the use of attack points; the NVA starts the game with 70 and the ARVN with only 40, though the NVA needs to spend theirs for artillery barrages and the air strikes are free.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Gnome Elf Troll
description:
Create and cultivate your own magical garden. Each turn, you will be placing tiles to produce crops and harvest magic beans, enchanted apples and cursed pumpkins. Hire and place gnomes, elves and trolls to harvest even more crops or to spoil your opponents production. The first player to harvest 10 crops of the same type wins the game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Map Addition, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Quatorze
description:
The magic number "7" conjures up meanings, powers, and coincidences dating back to the dawn of time. In Quatorze, you establish seven columns that utilize the powers of these powerful 7s. Players take turns adding cards to these columns, while trying to retain high-value cards in their hand. When the game ends, the highest combined value of cards in hand wins.

However, the powers of cards played to the columns during the game can drastically change the way cards are scored, and each player is trying to maneuver these powers to their advantage! Can you best harness and use these powerful 7s?

Quatorze is a sequel to Jason Tagmire's Seven7s and includes the original game within it as well. Thus, instead of seven suits, the game now includes fourteen!

—description from the publisher

name: Cosmos: 20 07 1969
description:
Cosmos is a game about space. 48 cards with planets, satellites and constellations, 4 wooden spaceships to travel in the Solar System, 1 die to move around… all of this for 2 games that are out of this world: the Solar System and the Constellations. Travel between planets, but try to avoid the satellites that will slow you down and fly through the constellations to get to the moon… a small step for man and a giant leap for mankind.
Roll the die and move your spaceship to get to the moon: you can move closer, farther or you have to pass a test. Challenge your friends with planets, satellites and constellations and be the first to land on the Moon.

name: 8 Bit Attack: Apocalypse
description:
Vanquish the evil demons of the very apocalypse in this expansion to 8-Bit Attack!

The Apocalypse expansions adds 9 new heroes, 55 new enemies, 20 new champions, and a new final boss – The Spider Mastermind!

name: 8 Bit Attack: Hyperspeed
description:
Blast through hyperspace as a star faring hero and battle aliens from across the cosmos in this expansion to 8-Bit Attack!

The Hyperspeed expansion adds 11 new heroes, 55 new enemies, 20 new champions, and a new final boss – The Galaxy Eel
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: 8 Bit Attack: Mythic Legends
description:
Become a mighty hero of myth and then battle the monsters of myth and legends in this expansion to 8-Bit Attack!

The Mythic Legends expansion adds 12 new heroes, 55 new enemies, 20 new champions, and a new final boss – The Mad God!

name: 8 Bit Attack: Yog-Sothothery
description:
Battle the evil cultists and monsters of the Cthulhu Mythos in this expansion to 8-Bit Attack!

The Yog-Sothothery expansion adds 9 new heroes, 55 new enemies, 20 new champions, and a new final boss – Azathoth!

name: Good Night, Bunnies!
description: Good Night, Bunnies! is a cooperative game: In the evening, players have to catch the little bunnies on the meadow and close their hutches. But this is not so easy as long as there are new pairs of bunny ears constantly coming up from one of the numerous holes in the ground. The more hutches you can close by the end of the game, the better you are as bunny keepers.

name: Dungeons & Co.
description:
Welcome to Dungeons & Co. a tile placing board game for 2-4 players.

Players have been hired by evil empress Hornspike to create the best dungeon in all of the land. As a Dungeon Contractor, players will take turns drafting tiles and placing them in their dungeon. They'll keep in mind damage, weapon range and overall synergy to create the best dungeon possible.

After tiles have been placed, players will take turns fending off adventurers wandering in to steal your gems. Players will gain/lose gems based on if they can defeat their adventurers.

The player at the end of 12 turns with the most Gems wins.

-description from designer

name: Mooncake Master: Limited Edition Customer Cards
description: Mooncake Master: Limited Edition Customer Cards is a set of three new customer cards for use with the Mooncake Master base game. It was included as a promotional item with some copies of Mooncake Master.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Bruise Cruise
description:
The year is 2042. Due to The Unfathomable Events of 2037, madness reigns across the cruise industry. The four remaining cruise lines now pursue market share through warfare. As a result, cruises are more popular than ever, because everyone is nuts (also due to The Unfathomable Events of 2037).

The "cruise" part: as the Admiral (formerly CEO) of a cruise line, you must send out your fleet of ships to navigate the treacherous waters of the Caribbean, dock at various tourist traps, and return to your home port. The "bruise" part: rival cruise lines are out to destroy your fleet via missiles, torpedoes, and maniacal passengers that live to raid other ships. The Admiral who finds the best balance between cruising and bruising will win.

Bruise Cruise is a hexagonal map-based, turn-taking strategy game with relatively simple rules that lead to complex outcomes.

2-4 players control a fleet of up to six ships using a hand of multi-use cards. 82 Action cards allow each player to sail, dock at ports, or acquire weapons or life preservers (the currency of 2042; they literally preserve your life). 18 “Unfathomable” cards allow players to do truly Unfathomable things, such as warping their ships to the Shady Offshore Bank or Warlord Island.

(Each Action card also features flavor text that teaches you strange and amusing facts about the ports and countries you’ll visit during game play.)

Victory points are scored for docking ships at ports, firing weapons at your competitors, and returning ships to their home port after they have completed their cruises. The game ends when the cards run out, though there are a few endgame rules that make the end particularly intriguing and encourage taking big risks.

A 2-player game between experienced players will take about 30 to 40 minutes. A 3- or 4-player game will take between 50 and 80 minutes. Recommended for players aged 14 and up, though 11-13 year-olds with board game familiarity will do just fine.

-description from publisher
categories: Educational, Humor, Nautical, Science Fiction, Transportation, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Ownership, Resource to Move, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Set-up, Zone of Control

name: Monster Park
description:
The king wants an animal park of unprecedented diversity, filled with spectacular mythical creatures. He asks several magicians to go on the hunt for suitable creatures in the steppe and forests, mountains and seas of his empire.

Monsterpark is a simple, fast paced card game. Each player slips into the role of a magician and tries to capture as many mythical creatures as possible that are popular with the people and desired by their ruler until the end of the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Errichte einen phantastischen Zoo voller unglaublicher Fabelwesen!

Der König möchte einen Tierpark von nie dagewesener Vielfalt, gefüllt mit spektakulären Fabelwesen. Gleich mehrere Zauberer bittet er, in Steppe und Wäldern, Bergen und Meeren seines Reiches auf die Jagd nach geeigneten Kreaturen zu gehen.

Monsterpark ist ein einfaches, schnelles Kartenspiel. Jeder Spieler schlüpft in die Rolle eines Zauberers und versucht, bis zum Ende des Spiels möglichst viele beim Volk beliebte und von seinem Herrscher gewünschte Fabelwesen einzufangen.

—description from the publisher

name: Elf on the Stealth
description:
Following in the tradition of "escape room in a box" games, Elf on the Stealth is an escape room in a Christmas card. Players attempt to track down the infamous mole that Big Plastic — an evil consortium of plastic-toy manufacturers — have placed within Santa's organization by solving puzzles, hunting down clues, and engaging in some lateral thinking.

The game comes in the form of a Christmas card that could be sent to friends or relatives with a cheery holiday message, which contains a link to a web app (written in simple JavaScript to be compatible with any smartphone, tablet, or PC) that mediates the game.
categories: Deduction, Maze, Print & Play, Puzzle, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Трикветр
description:
Nano game on one card (board on a side, rules on the other side) for two players. You need to provide four D6 dices.
It's a simple game with a math mechanic. The Players will do manipulations with dices and try to catch the opponent when he can’t do his move. On the player's turn, he can change the dice value downside or place another dice. But be careful, each field have a special number, so you can’t change a value lower than this number. A player who can't do his turn loses this game.
KOZAK Games Publishing shared this game as a gift for their customers in 2020 (COVID-19 Pandemic)

name: Werewolf!
description:
Two to six players will race to determine which house a hungry werewolf is in, who actually died to the fiend, and what the real human identity of the brute is! Will you play as Red Peepers, Scarlet O'Hare, Pinkie Claw, Cherry Pitts, The Scarlet Crimson (aka Crimson Pimpernel), or Ruby Lisp? Rush to one of 4 creepy houses and make your three dire accusations: "The Werewolf is X player, the victim is X player, and it was done in THIS house!" The other players will consult their cards and if they can disprove one of the accusations must show the card to the accuser.

Much like the classic game Clue, through a process of possibility elimination and logical deduction, a player's accusation will inevitably be correct and they will win the game.

Possibly the best part of the game (or even the only good part?) is the Warren Publishing empire's trippy 70's artwork, featuring a crimson wash of decaying mansions, madly capering denizens and some rather hard to read text. Well, what did you want from a horror magazine publisher anyway? Too bad Vampirella doesn't appear on this one - she's so... toothsome.

This is one of five somewhat tongue-in-cheek horror games from Warren magazines (publishers of Creepy, Eerie and Vampirella) featuring campy 70's horror boardgame fun. The Werewolf! game was created by Bill DuBay and appeared in Creepy magazine issue #57 (November 1973) and Eerie #52 (November 1973) inside the magazine covers to cut out and play, and separately as a bundle of "Warren Monster Madness" games by mail order (#2661 for $2.50). The bundle included Capture, Monster Match, Creepy-Crawley Castle (aka Creepy Castle), Werewolf! and Monster's Castle.

name: We're Doomed!: Alternative Facts Promo Card
description:
An event card.

Clandestine/Read Silently.

Text says:
This card does nothing.

At any time, instead of revealing this card, pretend to read it out loud, lying about what it says. Then place this card at the bottom of the deck without showing anyone.

If anyone catches you in this, lose 1 influence, but never acknowledge that this text blatantly contradicts you.

Keep this card face down until until you have come up with a good lie.

Originally available as part of the 2020 Man vs Meeple Kickstarter campaign.

name: Where's my luggage?
description:
You got off the plane, arrived to pick up your luggage and found out it was replaced? Whether you've arrived for a vacation, a business trip or a family visit, you probably have exciting plans for the next few days. But first - don't forget to collect your luggage before leaving the airport! Not as simple as it seems!
A visual memory game that will get you started planning your next destination.

How to Play?

On each turn, players turn over luggage cards and spin the


conveyor.

Whenever you find all the suitcases on the passenger tag - you get a passport stamp.
First player to get 4 passport stamps - wins!

name: Munchkin: Misch oder stirb!
description:
Four mini-expansions for popular Munchkin settings

You play all imaginable settings of Munchkin? Here you get supplies: 30 cards each for four of the most popular. A colorful mix awaits you:


As any true Munchkin knows, rules are meant to be broken. And Munchkin: Cheats! (for Munchkin) has been created for exactly that purpose.



Time for a thorough investigation with Munchkin Cthulhu: Sanity Check (for Munchkin Cthulhu)! Because being a cultist is a lot harder than is commonly believed.



When the zombies are making the streets unsafe, no one would think of hiding in a graveyard, would they? Granted, it is innovative ... as you'll learn in Munchkin Zombies: Grave Mistake(for Munchkin Zombies)!



Life in a spaceship is boring. Going down to the planet, that's what shreds! But watch out in Star Munchkin: Landing Party (for Star Munchkin) that the reception doesn't get too hot!


You must own at least the corresponding base games, and you can add them to each set. Or maybe you want to throw all the setting games together because you like Cthulhu-Science Fiction-Kung-Fu-Space Pirate Dungeon Adventures with Zombies!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Back to Back
description:
Draw on the back of your teammate for them to pass your drawing on to the next player! What will the picture eventually evolve into?

Back to Back is a cooperative drawing game for 3-6 players, where your drawings can create laughter that fills the house!

To start the game, players put on special shoulder capes and line up. The player at the back of the line selects a question card and starts drawing on the cape of the player in front of him. That player will then try to recreate that drawing on the player in front of them and so on.

The final player at the front of the line guesses the answer. With a correct guess, the players win the game together.

Game contents:

4 shoulder capes
1 palette drawing board
5 dry-erase markers
50 question cards
1 die
Game guide
publishers: Broadway Toys LTD, cosaic, Group SNE, TWOPLUS Games

name: Neuroshima Hex! 3.0: Moloch the Beginning
description:
Moloch the Beginning Campaign is a two-player expansion for Neuroshima Hex! 3.0. It depicts the beginning of humanity’s fight with the rebellious artificial intelligence, Moloch. The first months on the battlefield are pure madness, which means that even one insignificant soldier or bad day could lead to mission failure!

The campaign is a two-player game consisting of five consecutive missions. At the beginning, players must choose a Faction — Moloch or Outpost — that they will lead through the entire campaign. Each mission consists of special rules that change the gameplay of the Mission.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Puzzle, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Connections, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Die Schule der magischen Tiere: ermittelt – Klarer Fall, Murphy!
description:
There is a lot of excitement in the magical pet shop! Several animals have disappeared without a trace overnight. No question that polar bear Murphy immediately starts investigating. But the master detective needs the help of the players.

In this cooperative game, players work closely together to track down the culprits. Only if the detectives cleverly combine Murphy's clues will they save the magical animals. Thus begins an exciting adventure in which each player plays his part in solving the case.

name: Petronella Apfelmus: Zauberspaß im Mühlengarten
description:
The little witch Petronella Apfelmus and the twins Lea and Luis experience a new adventure in this game. This time Petronella accidentally turns caterpillar Amanda, the apple men, gnome Nisse and mouse Hilda into a colorful flower bed with weird magic spells. The players must help her out of this predicament!

The magic garden cards lie face down in the center of the table and resemble a vegetable patch. Who can best remember where the enchanted garden friends are hidden in this party game? Petronella must find the right way to turn them back.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Sushi-Trick
description: This is a trick-taking game with the theme of sushi competition ((The mini-game called trick is repeated until the cards are exhausted, and the winner is determined for each mini-game. The person with the most winning tricks wins).

name: Shroom Shroom!
description:
Buy, sell, and trade all kinds of crazy mushrooms on your way to victory in this exciting, strategic, and family-friendly card game.

—user summary

Shroom Shroom is a super fun and strategic card game about collecting and trading all kinds of crazy mushrooms. Players take turns selling, buying, and trading mushrooms to add to their collections. Try and collect different combinations and families of mushrooms to earn points.

Choose your cards wisely because you can only have up to ten shrooms in your collection at a time. Some cards have special powers that allow you to develop fun or cruel strategies against each other. The thing that makes Shroom Shroom even more awesome is trading. You can trade anything with anyone at any time during the game. While you're waiting for your turn, make some trades with other players to help build up your collection.

When the cards run out, everyone adds up their points and the person with the best shroom collection wins.

—description from the designer

name: 18: 10 rounds of rock-paper-scissors with 18 fingers
description:
This game is a simple two player game where you play rock-paper-scissors 10 times, but only 18 fingers can be used in total across all 10 games. Each player starts with 18 sticks to represent the number of fingers available to play. You lose 5 sticks for paper (paa) and 2 sticks for scissors (choki). Rock (guu) doesn't reduce any sticks.

If you win a round, you will get 1 point, but you get 2 points in the 6th and 10th rounds. Draws (aiko) don't score points either. Try to use up as many of your sticks as possible, because the remaining sticks will be deducted from your score. Calculate your score after 10 rock-paper-scissors games. The one with the most points wins. If the numbers are the same, it is a draw. If you wise, you can play "18" all over again as the tie-breaker.
publishers: Daiso (ダイソー), KUDARANAIMONO factory (くだらないもの工房)

name: The Lion King: Pumbaa Pass
description:
Any Lion King fan will love this new, exciting, and fun family game featuring a very hungry Pumbaa! Pumbaa’s ready for some tasty grub—icky bugs to you and me! Players take turns feeding him the colorful critters until, well, he tosses his cookies, loses his lunch—you know, pukes. Then it’s time to scramble to find the bugs you need to win! To win be the first player to match all three bugs on three different leaf cards.

—description from the publisher

name: Martyr: Bloody Theater 1528
description:
Those criminals are being called “Heretics!” “Enemies of the Government!” “Messengers of the Antichrist!” And you're compelled to join them.

Europe, early 1500s. Now, the State Church has determined that you, too, deserve a terminal sentence for committing multiple crimes – that is, what they have decided are crimes.

But you are scheming to seize a rare opportunity: To use your final act to subvert the State Church’s effort towards full governmental supremacy. Armed only with a message and your final breaths, can you use them shrewdly in the ultimate performance of your life?

In Martyr: Bloody Theater 1528, you will push your luck with your dwindling breaths to shape public opinion through action selection, while controlling the advantage, or disadvantage, of player turn order. But stay focused, because as you incentivize other players to aid your cause, you may also be delivering them to victory…

Contend valiantly!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Drafting, Push Your Luck, Turn Order: Claim Action, Worker Placement

name: Lanista
description:
You are a lanista, a gladiator school manager and trainer, aiming to become the most prestigious of Rome.

The game turn plays in four phases: Recruitment, during which you buy gladiator slaves from the market; Contract Negotiation, during which you try to place your gladiators in spectacles; Combat, during which you have your gladiators fight each other; and Healing and Resting, during which prestige may be earned from happy accidents.

The game is based on extensive historical research. The gladiator names are authentic, as well as the equipment sets and pairings.

Recruitment: On the market are gladiators. Each has a cost in gold and an equipment set (provocator, thrace, retiary, etc.). Some have special abilities.
Contract Negotiations: Various cities have gladiatorial games for tender. They rake in a certain amount of money and fame but require specific gladiator teams.
Combat: Each lanista organizes one or more fights between their own gladiators. Random draws determine the outcomes. Players can manipulate the odds in various ways.
Healing & Resting: If a gladiator physical integrity is compromised, he must be healed...or there can be an accident that yields prestige.

Random draws use a bag loaded with tokens of various colours. Players manipulate the token counts to influence the odds. This matches electoral systems used in Antiquity.

Lanista is accessible and educational; it will please newbies and grognards, be they inclined to compete or to manage.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Negotiation, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: El Gran Asado
description:
El Gran Asado (The Big Barbecue) is a 2-4 player game where players must bet cards to get resource tokens, and then they must exchange those tokens to get more elaborate resource tokens. They can also play action cards to get money or harm other players. The first player to get a Bread, Steak and Wine token and have more than $ 1,000 wins the game.

Each player starts with 5 cards in hand, $ 250 and a resource board. Put the betting board on the center of the table, along with the Asado card.

Each round is played in two phases:

Card Play Phase
During their turn, each player can trade tokens, sell resources to the bank, and play action cards.

Betting Phase
When all players played their cards, the resource betting phase starts. Each player will bet their resource cards (Wheat, Calf, Vineyard and Producer) in the betting board. After betting their cards and throwing the die, the player will claim the corresponding prizes in tokens, and place them in their resource board.

Before ending their turn, they can trade again tokens for more elaborated resources using the cards in their hands, or sell tokens to the bank to get more money.

Once all players have finished betting, all cards are returned to the deck. The obtained tokens remain in their resource boards. A new round starts and 5 cards are dealed to each player.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That

name: The American Bible Challenge
description:
What do you Noah about the Bible? Inspired by the award winning Game Show Network program, The American Bible Challenge Board Game is sure to bring plenty of fun to you and your friends! As in the TV show, teams must first come up with a Team Name which they write in the Bible podium area directly on the game board.

Players roll dice to advance around the board by answering trivia questions, spelling biblical words, organizing the books of the Bible and more linked to the color spot they land on. The player/team that answers one question in every color category first is the winner.

With over 1,000 unique questions and multiple levels of play, its a game you will love to play over and over again.
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Meme vs 100cia: CEO Ludoty promo card
description:
A promotional Scientist card delivered in the November 2021 Ludoty Box.

Alba (CEO Ludoty)

This is fine: You can't lose if you're waiting for your Ludoty.
Dream Team: Take 1 Troll for each Ludoty you have received.

name: Cookie Crash
description:
Cookie Crash you play simultaneously and must recognize color and shape as quickly as possible. In the middle of the table there are drums containing different types of cookies. If you manage to place the correct cookies next to the drum as quickly as possible, you claim the drum.

Each player receives the same number of cookie cards. These are placed under the cookie drum. If cookies do not fit, they go to the discard pile. Each player also has a rolling pin to crush the other player's cookies, a lid to close a drum and a joker cookie to fit each cookie. To win, you must collect as many cookie drum cards as possible. The player with the most cookies in all the drums is the winner.

To make the game a little more difficult, there are 2 upgrades available.

Secret mission cards
Forbidden cards.


—description from the designer

name: Fruddel Muddel
description:
Do red bananas feel as blue as yellow strawberries?! Anyone who plays Fruddel Muddel must overlook the muddle of colors in front of them to grab the right fruit.

To set up, deal cards are evenly as possible to all players, then place the four fabric fruits — strawberry, banana, pear, and grapes — in the center of the playing area so that everyone can grab them easily.

Everyone then reveals a card simultaneously, and each card shows the silhouette of one of these four fruits, with an outline in the color of one of these four fruits on a colored background that matches one of these four fruits — which means that each card has elements of three different fruits or two elements of one fruit and one element of a second fruit. Your challenge is to figure out which fruit appears most frequently among all the signals given, then grab it from the center. Alternatively, if you don't want to grab something, place your hand on your deck of cards.

If you grabbed the proper fruit — and more than one might exist! — then you place your revealed card on the bottom of your deck. If you didn't grab a fruit, you discard your card, and if you grabbed the wrong fruit, discard your card and one additional card from your deck. Keep playing rounds until someone discards their final card, at which point whoever has the most cards left wins.

name: Inflatable Antler Ring Toss Game
description:
Enjoy this hilarious game at all your holiday parties. Your friends and family will love tossing the rings onto these inflatable antlers All ages will have a blast using this as an excuse to throw things at your head! Easily inflate the antlers and you are ready to play the game.

One person wears antlers that are inflated and the other players/teams toss inflatable red and green rings, trying to hook the rings over the antlers. Play until a certain score is reached (5 points for a short game, 20 for a long one).

name: Warszawa 1920
description:
The Battle of Warsaw is the largest Polish-Russian battle of 1920. The goal of Soviet Russia was to rekindle the flame of the revolution throughout Europe. The Polish counterattack from the Wieprz River completely changed the fate of the war. From that moment, the Soviets were in constant retreat and suffered many defeats in subsequent battles.

—description from the publisher

Warszawa 1920 is a game using WB-95 rule system. It contains three scenarios and 286 unit counters. Additional scenario was printed in TiS magazine nr.43.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Zone of Control

name: Squadron Dice
description:
Take to the sky commanding a squadron of bi-planes in this exciting, fast-paced dice game! Sharpen your aim as your competitors dodge your attack. Call up your flying Aces to take down your opponent’s planes and claim victory!

Game Overview
2 to 4 players
There are 2 ways to play Squadron Dice.

Dog Fight - A fast-moving dice game where all players roll dice to gain “position” over other players. The highest positioned player rolls the Hit dice and the lowest positioned player rolls the Evade dice. Remove Rookie die and add in an Aces Die as you fail Evade rolls, then everyone starts the round over. Use Decision dice to alter your hits, evades, and number of bi-planes. Continue playing until all of your opponents are eliminated from the game and you remain. ~20 minutes


Bombing Raid – In this game, players roll all eight of their dice (Rookie and Aces Dice together). Players have to choose which dice to keep and which dice to re-roll again. After the second roll, the player with the greatest number of bi-plane wins that turn and retires one Aces Die then play starts again. Aces Dice are removed from play to keep score. The first player to retire all of their Aces wins the game. ~15 minutes
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Baby Boomer Bingo
description:
A boomer comment is read and all players decide which of their cards is the best younger generation response -- as well as the one that will benefit their bingo card the most. When the best response is chosen, that becomes the bingo call! Cross off the matching boomer/color combo on your bingo board if you have it. First to get a bingo wins -- but doesn't everyone win when you have a good laugh?

—description from the designer

name: 2000's A Decade of Trivia
description: 2000s A Decade of Trivia is a turn of the century game! A fun card game to play at a BBQ, take to the beach, or on game night with friends. You'll enjoy this sweet deck of trivia fit for millennials and more.
categories: Card Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Sports, Trivia

name: Hush: Mellowvalley
description:
April 2022 episode for Hush.

Includes:

Map postcard: Mellowvalley
Character card: Otto Copperbelly
Nocturnal Creature card: Cole Wakefield
Spirit card: Snake Spirit
Structures card: Tent / Scarecrow

name: Magic: The Gathering – Challenger Deck: Allied Fires
description: Allied Fires is a planeswalker control deck. Keep the board clear with cards like Deafening Clarion and Time Wipe, play a bunch of planeswalkers that generate card advantage, and overwhelm the opponent with planeswalker value and even planeswalker attacks with the help of Sarkhan the Masterless.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Das kleine böse Kartenspiel
description:
The Little Bad Book gets a companion: The Little Evil Card Game! All the evil monsters and characters from the Little Bad Books have sneaked out of the books and are now up to mischief! Only you can banish them back into the books by defeating the Little Evil Card Game. But be careful: With wild changes of direction, nasty abandonment or the funny evil tasks of the curse cards, the game knows all the evil tricks to make it as hard as possible for you!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Das kleine Böse Buch bekommt einen Mitstreiter: Das kleine Böse Kartenspiel! Alle bösen Monster und Figuren aus den kleinen Bösen Büchern haben sich aus den Büchern geschlichen und treiben nun ihr Unwesen! Nur du kannst sie wieder zurück in die Bücher bannen, in dem du das kleine Böse Kartenspiel besiegst. Aber Vorsicht: Mit wilden Richtungswechseln, fiesem Aussetzen oder den lustig-bösen Aufgaben der Fluchkarten kennt das Spiel alle bösen Tricks, um es dir so schwer wie möglich zu machen!

—description from the publisher

name: Good Cop Bad Cop: Zombies
description:
The Zombies expansion to Good Cop Bad Cop removes player elimination and adds an immediate and growing threat from a third team, the Zombie team.

When a non-Leader would previously be eliminated, they instead join the Zombie team. They win if they can Bite a wounded Agent or Kingpin.

The Honest and Crooked teams still have the same winning condition of eliminating the opposing leader, but they will have to do so while holding back the zombie horde.

The new equipment to this expansion, like Chainsaw, Shotgun, and Machete, are the most deadly we've ever added. Use it carefully or you might end up creating more zombies!

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Zombies
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Semi-Cooperative Game, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game

name: Monopoly: Star Wars – Boba Fett
description: Celebrate the legendary Bounty Hunter and the galaxy of characters he has encountered, with this Monopoly: Star Wars Boba Fett edition board game. Star Wars fans will love the gameboard spaces that depict iconic Star Wars characters, and the cardboard Boba Fett tokens showing him in a classic pose or one of his more recent looks. Add symbols from Boba Fett's armor to properties. When a player gets a color set they can start adding Sigils to their characters and then upgrade to Skulls. Players move around the board collecting characters, equipment, and Imperial Forces, and relive favorite Boba Fett moments from Episodes V and VI of the Star Wars movies, as well as action-packed scenes from The Mandalorian TV series.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Territory Building

name: Maltfriend's Journey
description:
Maltfriend's Journey is a roll-and-move game in which the players compete to build the most succesful whisky empire in Victorian Scotland (late 19th century). Players travel cross country along historical steam carriage, railway and ship routes to visit landmarks and famous destillery sites.

During the game players will need to gain enough licenses to start destilleries and gather resources to do so. While travelling the country, players can choose between the short routes where they risk paying a fee to their competitors, or the longer, scenic routes, which may cost them valuable time.

While Maltfriend's Journey is not a drinking game, it is a game with a mature theme, rich on history and information about historical Scotland.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: UNO: Sonic The Hedgehog
description: It's the UNO matching card game everyone knows and loves but featuring graphics from the video game Sonic the Hedgehog. Players still race to get rid of all their cards by matching color, number and symbol, but when someone plays a Wild Victory Lap Card, all other players must draw one card! And when a player is down to one card, they can't forget to shout, "UNO!"

name: Rubik's Capture
description:
Rubik’s Capture is a high intensity board game designed to get your brain and fingers racing at a fast pace. To play, start by searching the colorful gameboard. Find the colors and patterns. Then, capture it with your grid to win. The capture cards show colors and patterns. Flip the cards one at a time and then, it's a race to find the match on the gameboard! It sounds easy enough, but Rubik’s Capture is a board game of skill, speed, and dexterity. Every card has at least one match on both sides of the gameboard- the challenge is finding them! Make sure you find it fast and find it first.

This is a great hands-on board game for 2 people. Both adults and kids ages 7 and up will love this challenging game, so take on your friends or family wherever you are.

name: Rubico
description:
Do you have a passion for Roman history, is Julius Caesar your idol? Would you have liked to witness the glorious crossing of the Rubicon but your birth took place too many centuries later? With Rubico, Caesar versus Senatus, you will be able to take part in one of the key moments in Roman history. Or try to stop it from happening.

Rubico is a collaborative team game in which you will help your faction cross the river and reach Rome or try the opponent senators to stop the advance. Anticipate your opponents' moves and play your cards well. The fate of Rome is in your hands.


Choose a game faction. Are you a centurion or rather a senator?
Use Power cards or Senate cards wisely to achieve your goal.
Cross the Rubicon and reach Rome or do everything to prevent it!


A collaborative team-based game of diplomacy and politics.

—description from the publisher (adapted)

In turns each player becomes the active player and impersonates the Centurion who must blindly yet strategically choose a set of cards from the ones provided face-down by the other players, and then resolve their effects. The "other players" are basically of two rival factions, Julius Caesar and his legions VS Pompeius Magnus and his senators. These roles are kept secret. Each of the "other players" choose their cards as to best pursue their personal goals: Caesar's fans want Caesar to cross the Rubico river and reach Rome as fast as possible; Pompeo's fans try to slow down Caesar's march and reach majority in the Senate.

—user summary
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Team-Based Game

name: PuzzLegend: Merlin
description: Rediscover through a journal the story of a legendary character. Progress in the story by solving a series of puzzles, which become progressively more difficult.
publishers: Blue Orange (EU), Broadway Toys LTD, Lucky Duck Games

name: ぼくの構築 (Boku no Kōchiku)
description:
In ぼくの構築, roughly translated as "My Construction", the players draft building cards and then play a bag-building game which enables them to build these cards from their hand, use the cards once built, expand their buildings, and buy additional cubes.

The person with the most points wins.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Roll and Rock
description:
Road to fame is not a bed of roses. It is rather a bed of thorns and bumps. At the end of the road there is success (or not). Whether you are a rock musician or jazz band member, you want to play in the largest concert halls. Take this journey - from your parents' garage to the World Tour and be the most successful band.

What is Roll and Rock?

In Roll and Rock players take control over their own music band. The bands gain experience, improve their skill and equipment, hire new staff members, record albums, and give concerts. All of this brings you fame points.

Roll and Rock is a roll & write game. Using dice, players perform actions in the locations available. The game lasts 6 rounds. Players receive points for the concerts and records they made. The player with the most fame points after the last round is the winner.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Lightyear Seeker Squad
description:
Discover Disney and Pixar's Lightyear. Stranded on an uncharted planet, Buzz Lightyear and his crewmates will battle hostile plants, giant bugs and the ultimate threat, Zurg, to complete their mission and return home. In the exciting Seeker Squad board game, all players work as a TEAM in a race to find the Hyperspeed Crystals before Zurg strikes! Players cooperate to explore the board, leaving no stone unturned as they flip over pairs of tiles. If they match, take the tiles! If they don't, Zurg moves closer and his robots send the whole world spinning! Escape before Zurg reaches the end of the Danger Tracker and ATTACKS! The first side of the board provides a simple way to play that's perfect for Junior Patrols, and the second side delivers a more challenging experience for advanced Space Rangers.

-description from publisher's website

name: UL'GorRoth's Revenge
description:
UL'GorRoth's Revenge is a solo, dice-rolling game of mathematic thinking for ages 12+ that's played in 5-15 minutes on one poker-sized card.

UL'GorRoth has latched on to your vehicle. You'll need to roll three dice and add, subtract, divide and/or multiple any combination of the dice rolled to equal UL'GorRoth's current level. Succeed, and you'll loosen his grasp on you. Succeed enough, and you may escape with your life. However, failure, means you'll be devoured!

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Humor, Math, Number, Print & Play, Zombies

name: Solace
description: Solace is a traditional patience (solitaire) game played with a set of Black Ice pieces. It is more reminiscent of Carpet than Spider in that a single game lasts a very short time. The game starts with ten randomly created nests, and ends when no more monochromatic towers can be created. The score of a game is the number of full towers sitting directly on the playing surface.

name: Escape Quest: Achtung! Cthulhu – L'Armée des Profondeurs
description:
Escape Quest is a game book in which you must solve puzzles to advance in your adventure. Each page has its clues: combinations, labyrinths, word games, hidden images ... Your logic and your sense of observation will be put to the test!

In this issue:

February 1942.
The Nazis are developing a secret project called the Army of the Deep. Informed of their intentions, a determined adventurer risks his life and sanity to thwart their plans. He can count on the unwavering loyalty of Sergeant Red and the help of a scientist named Karen Baker. The little group travels through the world at war: Nazi Germany, England, the Black Sea coast, North Africa and all the way to the Philippines, where they find the entrance to a mysterious and frightening universe. The terrible truth comes to our friends: the Nazis and their Japanese allies have made an alliance with unspeakable aquatic creatures capable of invading any territory from the sea. If they succeed, England will fall, then America and the rest of the free world!

—description from the publisher's website (translated)
categories: Adventure, Book, Deduction, Horror, Puzzle, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game
publishers: Don't Panic Games, Hobby World, Ynnis Éditions

name: Trash Stash
description:
Trash Stash is a simple children’s game for 2-4 players. In the game you draw a card and get to return one of your pieces of trash matching the item and color on the card. You drop that item into the garbage truck’s garbage can and then pull a lever to load the trash into the back of the truck.

Occasionally the truck will spit all the trash out at the active player. That player adds all the trash to their pile. The first player to get rid of all their trash is the winner.

Contents: 1 Trash Truck, 24 Pieces of Trash, 16 Clean-Up Cards, 1 Sticker Sheet, and Instructions

name: Micro Midgard
description:
Travel the 9 realms of Norse mythology and be the champion to fulfil the Norn's prophecies before Ragnarok comes.

Players move meeples on a shared board to gain resources, craft relics, and complete quests to gain glory, as the wolves Skoll and Hati get ever closer to catching the sun (Sol) or the moon (Mani). When one of the wolves reach the end of the track, the current objective is scored and points are awarded to the winning player. The game ends when either a player reaches 9 points, or the final 5th objective has been scored.

—description from the designer

name: Bananya: The Card Game – The Sweet Expansion
description:
The Sweet Expansion contains 15 cards (Flower Bananya x 6, Ninja Bananya x 6, Sweet Treats x 2 and a reference card) that you can swap into the base game for different play!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Bananya: The Card Game – The Magic Expansion
description:
The Magic Expansion contains 19 cards (Rainbow Bananya x 6, Night Bananya x 6, Droopy-Eared Bananya x 6, and a reference card) that you can swap into the base game for different play!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Bananya: The Card Game – The Music Expansion
description:
The Music Expansion contains 19 cards (Vampire Bananya x 6, Emo Bananya x 6, Metal Bananya x 6, and a reference card) that you can swap into the base game for different play!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Bananya: The Card Game – Elder Wisdom Expansion
description:
The Elder Wisdom Expansion contains 16 cards (Elder Bananya x 6, Maid Bananya x 6, Wasabi x 2, and a reference card) that you can swap into the base game for different play!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: How Much Money?
description:
Everyne has a price. Can anyone guess your in this wagering party game?

Guess "how much money" it would take your friends to do some crazy stuff, then score points based on how close you get. Each round, one person is the Daredevil who reads a stunt from a card aloud and then writes down how much money it would take to get them to do the dare.

Players quiz the Daredevil on the specifics of the activity, but you can't ask how much they'd do it for, duh! Then Everyone else writes down their guess, then places bets.

Reveal the Daredevil's price, the closest bet, AND the closest guess win points!

A great party game or icebreaker with low downtime and lots of player interaction. Multiple ways to score points, even with wrong answers and a different game every time with unexpected and funny results.

NSFW edition coming soon!
—description from the publisher
mechanics: Bids As Wagers, Questions and Answers

name: Antibio'taktik
description:
Antibio'taktik is a cooperative game and is set in the future. Thanks to the peculiarity of building the deck together, you'll improve your cards and abilities to achieve a team goal. Your task is to save humanity before it is wiped out by bacteria that are multi-resistant to antibiotics.

It is the year 3000, and every 3 seconds a person dies in the world, and the main cause of this is the antibiotic resistance of bacteria. Because of the spread of these multiresistant bacteria, people had to leave the Earth. The survivors were evacuated to 6 space stations. But here, too, the bacteria are spreading again and infesting humanity once more.

You have just become a member of an interdisciplinary team of scientists.
Will you be able to find solutions and discover a new, safe and effective drug before the epidemic wipes out all of humanity?

Our survival is in your hands!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Variable Player Powers

name: Freehand
description:
Freehand is a creative party game where anyone can make a masterpiece!

Each round, image cards will be set up in the middle of the table, and each player will secretly choose one to be their inspiration. The goal is to paint something close enough to your inspiration that everyone can guess what image you picked.

The twist? You’re painting with cubes!

The players must use a wooden “artist’s pen” to push around mini cubes, and make an abstract masterpiece that evokes the image card they chose.

With a hundred different images to play through, there are endless artistic challenges to dive into! Will genius flow from the tip of your pen?

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game

name: Adventure Games: Books – Die Wölfe von Paris
description:
The second book in the successful Adventure Games series; one book with several possible outcomes and over 100 different options.

Jeanne Portefaix is on a dangerous mission in Paris, in 1789 and 2019. She was unable to complete her training as a timekeeper because her academy was destroyed. In the 21st century, Jeanne wants to solve and avenge her father's murder. A mysterious wolf eye artifact at an auction in the Louvre is her first clue, but then men wearing wolf masks attack. This is the start of a turbulent adventure in which many more secrets await.

Choose your own adventure in this book: investigate game locations, solve puzzles, find and combine items. An interactive reading experience!
mechanics: Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: We Love Cats
description:
A cloth bag, 30 cat tokens, two custom dice, and rules for adopting cats!

The purr-fect short game for cat lovers!

How many cats can you adopt? Every cat finds a home . . .

Components:
• A bag.
• 30 cat tokens – five each of
six different colors.
• Two identical dice.
• This rulesheet.

Setup
At the start of the game, draw three cat tokens from the bag. Put them in front of you.
The first player is the one with the most cats in real life.

On Your Turn
If you have NO cats at the start of your turn, you adopt two new ones – draw two tokens from the bag.
Then roll the dice, and resolve the results in any order:
Adopt – Draw one cat token from the bag.
R or L – Pass one of your cat tokens (your choice) to your
neighbor. (Direction indicated by the die result.) Special rule – if you pass (for instance) a yellow cat token, and
the player receiving it already has a yellow token, the cat
token moves in the same direction to the next player. And the
next, if necessary, and so on. If everyone has a yellow token, the cat token goes back into the bag.
Swap – Drop one cat token into the bag and then take one out.
Lose – Where’d that cat get to? Return one of your cat tokens (your choice) to the bag.

If no one has won (see below), the player to the current player’s left now takes their turn.

Ending the Game
The instant you have one cat token of each color, you win!
If the bag runs out of cats, then all cats have been adopted! The player with the most cat tokens at that moment wins.
Ties are possible.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Set Collection

name: Wildlife Dice
description:
Step into the shoes of a park ranger. Create a home for many wild animals. Plant various trees, place lakes and meadows, to create suitable environment for every species of wildlife to live in. Invite animals to habitats you created - the greater the diversity of your park, the higher your point total will be.

In the base game you will create Bialowieza National Park. It is the second oldest National Park in Poland. It is home to wisent, also known as European bison - the biggest European land mammal and the symbol of the park itself.

Wildlife Dice involves a lot of strategy. Planning ahead is crucial for perfect alignment of different habitats. There is a great sense of accomplishment when you create perfect place to live for your happy animals.

Wildlife Dice is a print and play game. All you need is a set of two standard six sided dice and 4 color pencils. Then you will give every player a gaming sheet with a writing tool, and you can start playing.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Print & Play

name: ...I should have known that! Yes or No
description:
Does an orange float in water? Can you be allergic to a hairless cat? Does Transylvania really exist? Is C the letter between V and N on a keyboard?

The trivia game ...I should have known that! Yes or No contains more than four hundred "yes or no" questions about things that you should know. Sound like a piece of cake? You'll be surprised how baffling even the easiest questions can be when you don't have Google at your fingertips! Instead of receiving positive points for correct answers, you are burdened with negative points for wrong answers — and the number of points you received depends on how easy the question is.

The player with the fewest negative points wins.

name: Trade and Triumph
description:
In this captivating card-based strategy game, you step into the role of a trader navigating ancient trade routes.
The essence of the game revolves around the strategic use of cards, each representing diverse resources and tactical decisions.
As a trader, your aim is to skillfully manage these resources, making strategic choices to outwit your competitors.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Card Game, Economic, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Drawing, Income, Investment, Pick-up and Deliver, Resource to Move

name: La dieta perfetta
description:
Perfect Diet aims to be a simple and fun support to make people understand how important daily nutrition is when it comes to taking care of your body. In this case "diet" is not intended as a diet with the sole purpose of making you lose weight, but as a tool for health. By "perfect diet" we mean the one identified by the WHO, which has published a list of advice to follow for a healthy and balanced diet.

In the game, these tips become the objectives to be achieved to collect points and win the game. The game is divided into 5 days and each day consists of 4 meals. Draw cards and create the most balanced meals; calculate daily and weekly points.
Respect the goal cards and discover how to eat best for your health.
mechanics: Drawing, End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting

name: Path of Civilization: Queen of Sheba Promo Card
description:
Level II Leader

Cost 4 Wisdom

Immediate Effect: Gain 4 Wisdom

Counts as a Spiritual Card

name: Path of Civilization: Bruxelles Promo Card
description:
Level II Wonder

Cost 4 Builders

2 VP and counts as a Spiritual Card

Immediate Effect: Gain 1 Population, 1 Military, I Wisdom

name: Micro Mutants: Les Terrains!
description:
Expansion for X-Bugs/Micro Mutants.

Contains:

Foam sheet with locations for bases (for 2-player games).
20 terrain tokens with special powers.
Rulebook

name: Boozle
description:
Boozle is a party game perfect for up to eight players. Boozles are party animals. They come in many colors and each have their own style of drinking. To win the game all you have to do is collect five Boozles of the same color by drawing them and stealing them from other players. Outmaneuver your friends and force them to drink while you steal their precious Boozles!

Each player has the same five actions available to them: Snatch, Nope, Drink, Draw and Repeat. At the beginning of each turn all players simultaneously choose two of their actions and play them in secret. Players then go around the table revealing and resolving their actions until everyone has used both of their actions. At this point the actions go back into your hand and the turn starts over.


Poozles (purple) are classy fellows. They drink like sirs.
Roozles (red) are angry drunks. If something wasn't destroyed, the night wasn't a success.
Yoozles (yellow) are the life of the party. Free rounds and high-fives for everyone.
Groozles (green) are a bit much. They always take things one step too far.
Bloozles (blue) are drama queens. If they aren't making a scene, they're crying in the corner.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Secret Unit Deployment, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Car Race
description:
A rip-roaring car race for 2-4 professional drivers. Ages 5 and up.

It's an easy game of car racing based in a simple roll and move mechanic. The circuit are made up with wood sticks placed in circle.

To move, the player rolls the die, if on the die appears one, two or three dots then he moves the car accordingly over one, two or three sticks. It the die shows a jerry can the player get a turbo counter but can not move. In a later turn the player can use the turbo counter to double the number of dots appearing on the die.

name: Dicey Curves
description:
Dicey Curves is a dice-driven car racing game, where the track is constructed from a deck of cards. To move around the track, you need to roll dice combinations: straightaways allow you to move for whatever combo you can make, advancing one space per die in the combo, while curves contain gateways that require specific combos of dice – from one to five – in order to pass.

Five-dice combos are tough when you have only five dice to roll, but thanks to "exploding dice" you'll have a chance. In game terms, every 6 you roll allows you to add another die to your roll. To balance the luck sometimes inherent to dice games, players have control chips that allow them to reroll dice, add additional dice, switch positions between cars, and even control other players' cars.

With the track deck, players can construct traditional pre-configured tracks or race along a "mystery rally" route.

name: Activity Countdown
description:
Countdown Activity introduces strengthened conditions for Activity game: The performer for his team starts a timer that counts down the time. If it is possible to guess the word, the timer is stopped and the team may move as many boxes with the character, are indicated on the card. If it becomes clear that the guessing team takes too long, the team can continue to call and stop the timer.
Each team will receive a time credit of three minutes per player, which is input to the timer. Sometimes it is better to give up in order not to waste time unnecessarily.
categories: Card Game, Electronic, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Line Drawing, Team-Based Game

name: Sz'Kwa
description:
A Chinese game related to Xi Gua Qi but different, although using a similar board.

From Wikipedia:

Sz'Kwa
From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Jump to: navigation, search
Sz'Kwa is a two-player abstract strategy game from Taiwan. It is a Go, Weiqi, or Baduk variant. The Sz'Kwa board is not an n x n square board like Go or Weiqi. Instead, the board is circular in design. The same board is used by Watermelon Chess and one of the ancient Roman Bear games.
Contents
[hide]
• 1 Goal
• 2 Equipment
• 3 Game Play and Rules
• 4 Related Games
• 5 External Links

[edit] Goal
To capture the most enemy pieces.
[edit] Equipment
The board is composed of a large circle with an inner middle circle. Four semi-circles form a North, South, East, and West arrangement in the interior of the larger circle. The large circle and the smaller middle circle are divided equally into four pie slices. This creates for twenty-one intersection points where the pieces are played upon.
Each player has 20 pieces. One plays the black pieces, and the other plays the white pieces, however, any two colors or distinguishable objects will do.
[edit] Game Play and Rules
1. The board is empty in the beginning.
2. Players decide what colors to play, and who starts first.
3. Players drop one of their pieces on any vacant intersection point on the board. Only one piece can be dropped per turn. Players alternate their turns.
4. Enemy piece(s) can be captured as long as the enemy piece(s) are surrounded completely by the player's pieces.
5. The game ends when there are no more vacant intersection points to drop a piece onto, or when one player has exhausted all their pieces.
[edit] Related Games
Go, Weiqi, Baduk, Watermelon Chess, Bear games
[edit] External Links
http://nrich.maths.org/public/viewer.php?obj_id=1196
http://totmon.com/index.php?main_page=product_info&;products_id=285
Retrieved from "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sz%27Kwa";"
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement

name: Morbid Curiosity
description:
Morbid Curiosity is a unique party game that creates a delightfully dark evening with friends.

Using trivia and conversation cards, players explore and ignite their curiosity about the greatest mystery of all – death. Contains 162 cards... all of them about death. Takes only minutes to learn to play, provides hours of curious, deep, and irreverent conversation.

Morbid Curiosity is not a harsh look at your own mortality, or some delicate, awkward conversation about the end of life. Rather, it is a unique, well crafted game that lets people look at death while having a good time. So kick off your shoes, sit down, and get to know Death a little better.

On their turn a player (the reader) draws a card from either the conversation deck or the trivia deck and reads it aloud for the group to answer. Trivia cards are awarded to the player who gives the correct answer, for conversation cards the reader chooses their favourite answer. The first person to collect 7 cards wins.

name: Klunker
description:
This game is a reimplementation of the earlier version of Klunker. Like the original, it shares features with the designer's earlier game, Bohnanza.

In Klunker, players are collecting jewelry (instead of planting beans). Instead of trading cards with each other, players put some of their jewels up for sale to the other players. In doing so, a player hopes to attract buyers by selling jewels their opponents might want - along with others that they might rather not get.

This new version differs from the original in the following ways:

A different mix of jewelry cards.
All jewel types are treated equally (in the original, converting necklaces to money was advantageous).
With 5 players, players start with more money but pay a per-round "luxury tax."
6-player rules are added in which players start with even more money but pay a higher tax.


—user summary

name: Guilty As Charged
description:
Perfect for parties big or small, this uproarious game will have everyone laughing as they learn what their fellow players think they're really capable of. Offbeat questions inspire hilarity, making it a great conversation starter for new and old friends alike. Who's the guilty party? The majority wins! Let the laughter (and good-natured outrage) ensue.

Players draw cards describing a potentially embarassing situation: streaking at a sporting event, or being pulled over for speeding. Each player uses their personal "voting disk" to point out the player they think is most likely to be the person described on the card, and players who vote with for the candidate with the most votes win points.

- For 3-8 players, ages 18 and up
- Includes 200 cards, 8 voting/scoring dials

name: Twenty One
description:
Based on the original (1956-58) scandal-riddled game show, one player acts as Quiz Master for two players or teams and chooses a random category for the round. In turn, each secretly chooses a question by number. There are eleven questions, numbered 1-11, and are of graduated difficulty with 11 being the hardest. A right answer adds that amount to their score, a wrong answer takes it away (but scores cannot go below zero).

Neither team knows the other's score, and either may stop the game at any time. The game ends when either 1) a team asks to stop the game or 2) one team has 21 at the end of the round, and the winners receive $500 for each point difference in the scores.

If the game ends in a tie, another game begins at zero with the cash award increased by $500 per point. The team with the most money at the end of gameplay (set by the players) wins.

name: Ninja Cats
description:
Game description from the publisher:
Samurai are fiercely guarding their secrets and daymyo does not forgive slightest offense. However not even that can stop ninjas from stealing mystical scrolls for their masters. Now thieves face most difficult task – escape from village surrounded by samurai!

Ninja Cats are fast tactical game for 2-4 players. Use your cards to maneuver your pawn in such manner so you will be not surrounded by enemies or angry samurai.

Game description from the publisher (Polish):
Samuraje zazdrośnie strzegą swoich sekretów, a daymyo nie wybacza najdrobniejszej zniewagi.
Lecz nawet to nie powstrzymało ninja przed wykradnięciem tajemnych zwojów w imieniu swoich panów.
Teraz przed złodziejami stoi najtrudniejsze zadanie – ucieczka z osady otoczonej przez samurajów...

NINJA KOTY to szybka taktyczna gra dla 2-4 osób. Przy użyciu kart manewrujemy swoim pionkiem w taki sposób, aby nie zostać otoczonym przez przeciwników oraz rozzłoszczonych samurajów.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Territory Building

name: Distance from Here
description:
In the game Distance from Here, you rank six location cards in order of what you think is nearest to you! However, the actual correct answer is irrelevant! What the players think is closest is most important, and this is what will actually earn you points!

With only two players, Distance from Here is played as a co-operative game instead of as a competitive one.

name: Post the Most
description:
From the publisher:

A fun posting game for all the family
Hurry around the island delivering your post, but be careful of the rickety bridge and flock of sheep stopping you getting back to the post office first and winning the game. Nothing is certain in this exciting, fun-packed game for all the family.

name: Panda!
description:
Panda! is a light and fun trick-taking game based on Cucumber (Agurk, Gurka).

The most important object is to not win the last trick, but if you can save the strongest and most interesting card (AMBASSADOR, FINANCIER, TIGER, MONKEY, CROCODILE, DRAGONS and PANDA) to the last trick, then it will be a great surprise for your opponent!

The combinations of these cards changes the end of the game and makes more fun and laugh!

2000 years ago, in the faraway land of China the imperial court got anxious: the beloved pets of the majestic Emperor Han has escaped, and started to play tricks with the servants of the Heavenly Empire, appearing at different spots of the court from time to time. Even though the emperor loved all of his pets, he summoned the Dragons of the Four Cardinal Directions to his court in his desperation, to have his little ones regulated.
However, he did not realize that his beloved animals, using their special powers, can easily outsmart even those enormous beasts… The offiials of the court, i.e. the players have to try collecting the FEWEST possible points after 12 turns of the game. While doing so, they can only rely on their luck and tactical skills.

name: Wildtastic Five
description:
Yawning emptiness in the wildlife parks? But not for long! Grab the dice and let's go!
With attractive offers and clever barter deals, you can quickly let the right animals move in with you. Who is wildtastic enough and fills their wildlife park the fastest?

Gameplay:
Choose a die and perform an action:
1) draw new face-down animal-tiles or
2) Turn over animal-tiles according to the result of the dice. Then
a) place an animal for free in your wildlife park and
b) offer the other animal-tiles to your opponents to get new tiles.

But be careful: There are 5 different animal species, in different quantities. Each animal prefers its own territory. So act with caution and overview!

The game ends as soon as the first person has completely filled their wildlife park with the correct animals.

name: Wing Spirits
description:
Wing Spirits (ウイングスピリッツ) is an action-packed tabletop game with five different rulesets for you to enjoy!

Burst ・・・・A real-time action game in which players compete to knock as many coins as possible into their opponent’s area within the given time limit.
Tower Battle・・・・A thrilling competition in which players battle to collect coins from the tower without destroying it.
Chicken・・A game of chicken in which players compete to see how far they can backspin a ping-pong ball within the boundaries of the game area.
Dare・・A party game spin-off of Chicken. Instead of competing for coins, players must complete dares.
Challenge・・・・A golf-like game in which players attempt to launch ping-pong balls into a set goal.

There are unlimited ways to spin a ping-pong ball. Come up with creative new ways to play this game in addition to the five rulesets described above!

Note: Do not throw the ping-pong balls while playing this game. There are many ways to shoot the ball, such as by placing your fingers on top of it and pressing down slightly to launch it forward.

---
↓First Edition text↓
Wing Spirits (ウイングスピリッツ) is a dexterity game of chicken in which players attempt to place backspin on a ping-pong ball so that they can shoot it across the table deep into their opponent's territory before having the ball return. The deeper a player goes, the more they can score — but hitting the back line could prove fatal!

name: Egalité
description: In this abstract strategy game, each player is given six hexagonal pieces each with six colors on top (corresponding to all six sides of the piece). The goal is to be the first to capture three opponents' pieces. On their turn, players either move one of their pieces to an adjacent box or rotate one of their pieces in place. An opponent's piece is captured when their piece and your piece share an edge of the same color.

name: 38th Parallel
description:
A two-player card game set in the Korean War. One player is the U.N., the other is the Communists. Each hand the players are dealt eight cards (Logistics Phase), after which they can discard and redraw up to four (Deployment Phase), and then the players reveal their offensive and defensive cards (Attack Phase). After resolving the interaction of the cards played in the Attack Phase, the hand is scored and the player with the highest card total wins the hand.

A player wins the war by winning three hands in a row. If neither player does so after ten hands, the war is a tie. However, there is an Atomic Bomb card which ends the game immediately when drawn, at which point victory is determined by the draw of a final card, unless the Communist player is able to negate the Atomic Bomb with a Limited War card.
categories: Card Game, Korean War, Print & Play

name: Rübenratz
description:
From the box: "The rabbits are hopping around in the garden. Each one tries to get to the card with the yellow border and the stalk on it first. If this is the case the corresponding player can take a carrot from the stock in the center as a reward. At once a new starting square has to be fixed: the "old" target card is simply turned over. The picture on the backside shows the new target square. Who can find the card which has the same picture? It marks the new square they must all aim for and the stalk is placed on it. Again the rabbits are zipping through the garden. Who will be lucky enough and clever enough to collect the largest amount of carrots? A surprising competition game with dice."

This is not just a roll and move game; choices must be made by the players on each turn.

Contents: 4 wooden rabbits, 1 wooden carrot stalk, 16 cards to mark the path, 15 little wooden carrots, 2 wooden dice (marked with 1 - 3 dots each)

name: Trivial Pursuit: Young Players Edition
description: A subsidiary card set for use with the master game. Contains 1000 cards, 6000 questions in six categories: Lands and Men, Shows, Past and Present, Arts and Letters, Sciences & Nature, Sports & Games.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: La Carga de la Brigada Ligera: Batalla de Balaclava
description:
Wargame published by NAC Española, "wargame Series", in little format. It represents the Battle of Balaclava in 1854. An expeditionary mixed force (French and British) with 56,000 men and 5,000 Turkish began the invasion of the Crimean Peninsula. Their main objective was Sevastopol.

- Board: 24 x 38 cms.
- 112 counters.
- Rule book (in Spanish).

Juego de simulacion belica publicado por NAC Española. Recrea la batalla de Balaclava, con la famosa carga de la Caballeria Ligera. El juego viene en una minicaja de 20 x 13 cms.

name: Hoppers
description:
Hoppers is a scaled-down version of Chinese Checkers, with two players each having fifteen tokens starting in opposite corners of a 10x10 board. On a turn, a player can either move one of their tokens to any adjacent empty space or jump one of their tokens over an adjacent opposing token to land in an empty space; if the player can jump again, they can do so immediately.

The first player to move all of their tokens to the opposing corner wins.

name: Iron Road
description:
Iron Road is the original printing of the game that would become TransAmerica.

Iron Road differs from TransAmerica in several ways though, for instance, the board is made up of squares rather than triangles, and the scoring system and game end conditions are altered as well.

Re-implemented by:

TransAmerica

name: Caverns Deep
description: "Caverns Deep" is the wargame of life-or-death combat between the Dwarves and their mortal enemies, the Goblins. The Dwarves are put to the ultimate test in a struggle deep within the earth, in subterranean pasageways and tunnels.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation

name: The Great Game Of Canada
description:
Players trek across a map of Canada trying to visit as many cities and landmarks as possible using air, rail, auto, and ferry. In addition, sketches of major landmarks and animals known to each area are printed in appropriate places on the map.

Play involves the use of different types of bilingually printed cardboard cards. These cards are:

Starting Cards: These 6 green cards with a white maple leaf on the face, indicate on the reverse the city from which a player starts a "trek" across Canada, i.e. - Toronto, Montreal, Vancouver, etc.

Adventure Cards: These 6 purple cards with a white maple leaf on the face indicate animals to be hunted on the tour.

Souvenir Cards: These 6 yellow cards with a white maple leaf on the face indicate a historic settlement or city to be visited on the tour.

Picture Cards: These 16 smaller orange cards with a white maple leaf on the face illustrate native animals and hunters. There are 2 cards in the set for each illustration.

Chance Cards: These 25 large red cards with the white maple leaf contain printed movement and playing instructions on the reverse side that a player must follow.
mechanics: Area Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: High Gear
description: High Gear features a large plastic housing with multiple, inter-locking gears in various colors.
