Werewolf In Town is partially derived from the original game called "Mafia" which was later given a Werewolf theme, and is being presented on The Game Crafter for the first time with all new, original 8-Bit style artwork and brand new rule variants for you and your group to enjoy. Also included on the cards is something missing from most productions of this game: explanations of the roles. No more running to the rulebook when you get a role you haven't had before or having to expose the fact that you have a unique role because you don't know how it works!

Also included are some Blank Cards for you to experiment with your own new roles to liven up the game play after you have mastered what is in the box!
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Lexico RUS-ENG
description:
From the publisher:
Lexico is a game and a dictionary combined in a unique and fun way. Beside its excellent game value, it also has a huge educational value and is of interest to anyone who wants to learn languages. Lexico features altogether 9000 commonly used words from five different categories: Human, Living environment, Nature and hobbies, Science and technology and Common words. The words are divided into 3 difficulty levels and the idea is that every player plays the difficulty level best suited for his/her language skills.

name: When the West Came East
description:
An LPS bonus mini-game, When the West Came East is a solitaire wargame about the First Crusade.

The player takes the role of the Crusader armies and his objective is to get control of as many areas of the map as possible and eventually to conquer Jerusalem. At the end of the game you get VP for areas controlled and substract VP for casualties.

While the game originally came out as a bonus, you can buy it, plus another Zimmerer design, in a low price “DoublePack.”
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Final Fantasy Monopoly
description:
This is a Monopoly game by every standard. The artwork and titles have all been replaced to match the theme of Final Fantasy. Places, names, and people, have been taken from Final Fantasy I to Final Fantasy XIII, also from Final Fantasy Tactics, Final Fantasy Unlimited, Final Fantasy Adventure.

The Monopoly games are the most commercially successful and one of the oldest game franchises in the US. The family of games are re-themed versions of the original Monopoly. The original game was released in 1935 and almost every year sees the launch of rethemed and rebranded editions. The games are published by Parker Brothers, a subsidiary of Hasbro. Gameplay consist of the players trying to acquire wealth through stylized economic system involving the buying, renting, and trading of properties using play money, the roll of the dice for movement a long the board. The object of the game is to own every piece of property and drive the other players into bankruptcy.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: A Farewell to Kings
description:
A Farewell to Kings is a solitaire card game played with a standard 52-card deck.

In the game, the cards connect two-dimensionally by matching either the suit or the rank of every adjacent card. Attaching four-of-a-kind in a square formation completes a "book" of cards.

Creating (and subsequently removing) all the books wins the game.

name: Stratak Wars: Der Auftakt / The Beginning
description:
Stratak Wars - Der Auftakt / The Beginning is a strategic- and tactical boardgame for 2-6 players. Stratak Wars is especially interesting for fans of easy wargames and for consim beginners. It offers rules for beginners and advanced players.

Stratak Wars has 6 different double sided mapboards to create variable playing fields. The counters represent tanks, fighters, bombers and landing ships of World War II of the nations USA, Japan, Great Britain, Italy, Russia and Germany. The objective is to conquer most of the cities within a playing time as agreed at the beginning of the game. So the playing time is flexible and can be decided by the players.

Each player starts with his own state on one of the gameboards and expands his state by conquering cities on the playing field. Depending on the units he chooses for combat, he has advantages against the units of other players which are influenced by the landscape as well concerning movement and combat. Supply points are gained for recently conquered cities only. So you have to move forward, if you want to expand your armies.

The rules include basic rules, advanced rules, alternative rules, a sequence of play description, a display section for the landscapes, cities and a counter description.
categories: Economic, Territory Building, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: I SPY Original
description:
I SPY Original is a memory game based on the I Spy line of classic children's books and the photographs of Walter Wick and Jean Marzollo. The catch is that the images aren't exact matches. Instead, one version may be a silhouette or from another angle. According to the instructions, recognizing an object in a different environment is a valuable pre-reading skill.

Several variants are included in I SPY Original.

name: Imagination: Party
description:
Do you think that you can explain in a minute what an old chestnut or a permafrost is? Will you be able to do it while standing on one leg or by using verbs only?

Воображарий: Вечеринка (Imagination: Party) is a fun game about guessing words based on the hit Russian game Воображарий. Each turn, a player is selected to describe a word or a short phrase. A special card dictates whether the player have to give an explanation, to act or to do a unique show! If you are active, creative and positive you'll get a chance to become the brightest star of your party!

Imagination: Party is a standalone game, but it can also be combined with Imagination.

name: Hearts and Armour
description:
For a long time there is a war, and opponents have decided to resolve it not through a big battle but a struggle between their best knights. But chivalry is able to integrate even the most irreconcilable enemies. Many soldiers from both sides united with different relations: friendship, lifesaving, vows of chivalry, and even love.
 
In Сердца и Доспехи ("Hearts and Armour") players are divided into two teams. The task of each team - to defeat the opposing team, and killing or wounding more fighters from the opposite side. However, each player draws a relation card of one of the opponents. He can not win if the opponent is killed.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game

name: Crime Lords of Knight City
description:
Crime Lords of Knight City is a cooperative card game in which players are detectives trying to put away a notorious crime lord. You'll do this by solving enough crimes to build a solid case against the crime lord. If too many cases go cold, the crime lord wins and takes over the city.

The basic steps in the game include drawing Badge Cards, using Assets and Solving Crimes.

The Badge cards feature icons that match icons on the crimes. Each turn, you are able to play one of your Badge Cards onto one, or more, of the crimes in your docket. If you are able to match all the icons on a crime, it is solved.

As the game progresses, more and more cases will be opened. If you ever have more than 3 crimes in your docket, you must allow one of those crimes to go cold. If too many crimes go cold, the crime lord wins and the players lose the game.

To win the game, players must solve and close enough cases to build a case against the Crime Lord. Each Crime Lord has its own special ability and a varying number of points required to win and/or lose the game. So, each time you play, the difficulty and challenges will change.

name: ヘッジホッグジレンマ (Hedgehog's Dilemma)
description:
In ヘッジホッグジレンマ (Hedgehog's Dilemma), you and your fellow players are hedgehog breeders who are trying to encourage the little critters to get closer to one another on a cold day, perhaps to form a hedgehog couple if all goes well, so they need to be close enough to meet but not too close.

User summary:
The deck has cards numbered 1 to 4. Players are dealt six cards to their hand and a number of cards are laid face-up matching the number of players. Everyone chooses a card from their hand and reveals it. Cards that match up go to the player, everything else is discarded. Repeat this until the players' hands are empty, then score. Total up the whole of the cards you collected, the player with the highest total wins a token. Shuffle the whole deck over, play another round. The game ends when the fifth token is given out, the most tokens wins.

Matching cards simply means matching the number on the card, so if the table shows 1,3,3,4 and you're the only one to lay a 4, you get both 4s. But if more than one player lays a 4, you all get nothing. If two players each laid a 3, they'd each get a 3 from the table. If one player laid a 3, they'd only get one 3.

But if a 1 is matched in a turn, then the highest value table card is discarded, and so any matches are also lost. This brings in double-think, what are they other players likely to do? Do you go for the 4, or try a safer 3? What looks like a simple game becomes more cunning and watching what cards have already been played matters.

The card art is lovely, showing a variety of spiny creatures, sea urchins, lizards, turtles, porcupines. The cards are quite thin but the game is well made.

name: Disturbed Friends: Booster Pack
description: The Booster Pack for Disturbed Friends was achieved as stretch reward through Kickstarter. It contains 12 Question cards, 3 #WINNING cards, and an additional 3 Kickstarter #WINNING cards.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Loża Szyderców: Adios Mother F*cker
description:
Adios Mother F*cker, first expansion for Loża Szyderców ("Lodge of Mockers").
This expansion adds:

14 question cards,
46 answer cards,
5 action cards,
joker,
2 blank cards.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Ghostbusters: The Board Game II – Get Real Pack
description:
Containing 23 minis inspired by the classic The Real Ghostbusters cartoon! And that’s not all: The pack comes with Ally Cards that introduce exciting new gameplay elements. The add-on is a CZE-exclusive.

Includes the Ghostbusters team—Peter, Ray, Egon, Winston, and even Janine—with the minis designed to resemble the characters from The Real Ghostbusters (RGB). They can be used as cosmetic swap-outs for the regular Ghostbusters in the game OR they can be used as Allies (a new rule).

Survey the city for paranormal hotspots with this 50mm vehicle. An autogyro that up to two Ghostbusters can ride, the Ecto-2 moves up to eight spaces uninhibited by map obstacles or other Entities. It has a fuel limit, though, and will become unusable if flown too many times.

The add-on pack includes Real Ghostbusters plastic minis that upgrade the cardboard tokens in the game: eight Goo Piles, five Gates, and four Traps. These minis can also double as figure stands for those of you who want to display your paranormal paint jobs.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: Comparity: USSR
description:
In Comparity: USSR, players must place their goods-cards on the table in a grid according to how many they think the cost of goods: the lower-left of the grid for lower-cost goods, and the upper-right of the grid for higher-cost goods.

On your turn, you can place a card in the grid or check if a previous player placed their card correctly. If you check and the placement is correct, you must draw a 2 card, but if it was placed incorrectly then the person who played it must draw 3 cards.

The player who manages to get rid of all their cards first is the winner.

name: Top 2000 Pop Quiz expert editie
description:
Everybody have one of those friends with more than normal knowledge of pop music. Now you have the change to test them.

Object of the game is to score more points which you can win by answering questions about pop music

The game contains 49 question cards, each containing 6 questions and an extra 5 cards with tie-breaker questions

The game is based on the annual Dutch radio and tv progam Top 2000, in which the public votes for the best pop songs of all time (usually Queen's Bohemian Rhapsody).
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Memory
publishers: Uitgeverij van der Meulen, United Soft Media (USM)

name: Six Sided Stout
description:
Six Sided Stout is a print and play, solo roll-and-write game that won an honourable mention in the 2017 GenCant Roll and Write contest.

You are a home brewer, preparing for the local home brew contest! Having decided to make your favourite type of beer, stout, you’ll spend up to 10 days, visiting the market, trying to find the best ingredients you can to make your the best beer you can. But you’ll never know how much will be available, as all the local brewers scramble for ingredients.
You have some help, but will it be enough?

Every day will you roast the malt you already have or go to the market to search out more ingredients? At the market will you buy malt, hops or yeast? Roll the dice to see how many of that ingredient you get, before adding them to your recipe!

Build your recipe by filling in the grid making sure the ingredients meet the requirements to score you the best points possible. Be careful though, you only have 10 days (turns) to make the best beer possible by scoring the highest points with the judges.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil

name: LUPO: The Space Adventure
description:
LUPO: The Space Adventure is a collaborative, storytelling card game in which your imagination is humanity's only hope!

Launch into a whole new galaxy of fun and imagination with your family and friends with "LUPO: The Space Adventure", a light-hearted storytelling card game, which takes you and your friends on a ridiculous sci-fi adventure. When planet Earth gets turned into a tiny raisin, it's up to you and your friends to blast off beyond the stars and create a new home for humanity. Get ready for a close encounter with fantastic new worlds and species, such as a world without gravity where social zombies live. Let your imagination run wild as you bring your ideas to life, from creating pen-and-paper designs to building your own spectacular spaceship.

LUPO: The Space Adventure is a cooperative game, so not competitive, no winners, not a lot of rules & making up own rules is just fine. It's a light-hearted creative storytelling card game about imagination, creativity and being ridiculous. Mainly a game which allows your imagination to flourish & for you to be social with friends.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Negotiation, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Justice League: Road Trip
description:
The earths most loathsome villains are at it again. Causing destruction and widespread panic on a level never before seen. As you attempt to make contact with the rest of the team, the WATCHTOWER is attacked.

Seconds before communications went dark, a partial message was intercepted from the plant APOKALIPS. The sourct of the message can mean only one thing - DARKSEID.
The details are vague, but the message was clear; DARKSEID calls for the destruction of the JLA. Cut off from the rest of the team, you rush out in search of the JLA's most nefarious villains in order to stop DARKSEID's evil plot.

Travel through the game board collecting information on DARKSEID's master plan. Carry out board actions, collect HIT TOKENS, and acquire TOLL PASSES while you dish out hard justice in HENCHMEN BATTLES. Gain access to the criminal underworld that lead to ENEMY STRONGHOLDS in your search of Earth's most loathsome villains. Return the villains to your BASE CAMP for information to help you foil DARKSEID's sinister plot. The first person to complete their SCORE CARD by Acquiring 4 unique VILLAIN TOKENS and return them to their BASE CAMP is the winner.
—description from the publisher

name: Snakes & Ladders: Unleashed
description:
Snakes and Ladders: Unleashed is a fast-paced dice game with a continuously evolving board layout and movable snakes and ladders.

Players try to improve their chances of gaining ground faster, whilst at the same time trying to block their opponents’ progress. This is done by placing their cards on the board and moving snakes and ladders around.

Two dice make the game more tactical, and the chain of potential events makes for a fun and sometimes chaotic game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Way of the Fighter: Blazing Soul Candy vs ND-2000 Fighter Pack
description:
Blazing Soul Candy and ND-2000 are Kickstarter exclusive characters included with all Card Fighter and Miniature Fighter level pledges.

This fighter pack includes a complete set of actions for Blazing Soul Candy and ND-2000, along with their fighter standees. In addition to the two new fighters, this pack includes a complete set of actions for the Cola style and the Components style. These styles are unique to each of these two fighters.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Run Fight or Die: Reloaded – Zombie Cosplayer Promo Card
description:
Dice Tower KS 2019.

Exclusive Zombie Cosplayer Follower Card.

Text says:
On any turn where you resolve 1 or more gun results, roll a die, on a zombie result, discard this follower.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Planet Apocalypse: Pack of the Crypt
description:
This expansion to Planet Apocalypse contains:

2 Lords (Belphegor and Herne the Hunter)
2 Heroes (Bruno Dawn and Carolyn Totenkopf)
3 Fourth Circle Demons (Cobold, Scurrilet, Fachan)

Maps:
2 Maps (Rome Catacombs and Paris Catacombs)

Cards:
3 Legion Cards (Cibaciba, Caleuche, Tuonela)
2 Region Cards (Poland and Italy)
3 Trooper Cards Types (Carabinieri, Swiss Guard, Territorials)
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Squelettos
description:
The objective of Squelettos is to collect a sequence of cards depicting skeletons and display them in ascending order and hopefully from the same family too, to gain bonus points.
Players take turns flipping over as many cards as they want from the central deck, to choose the one to keep.
But the player that turns over 2 cards of the same colour loses his turn and the chance to keep any card from that round at all.

—user summary

name: Lucky Cat
description: Collect a winning combination of Lucky Cats in this colourful, cat collecting card game from Ridley's Games! The aim of the game is to collect a winning combination of Lucky Cats before the other players to win a round. The first person to win two rounds wins the game! There are 2 winning combinations of cats: 7 of the same numbered cats in different colours or cats numbered 1-7 of the same colour. Contains instructions, 65 game cards, 4 reference cards, packaged in a novelty Lucky Cat shaped case.

name: OSIRIUM
description:
In Ancient Egypt, more than three millenia ago, men confronted each other in the Trial of Osirium under the eyes of the immortal Gods. Inspired by Osiris, the judge of souls who came back from the dead, the Osirium allowed to settle many conficts and to have the truth triumph. If honesty guides your actions, then you won’t be afraid of walking in the duat, and you will make your Deity proud.

Goal of the Game
Osirium is a trial. Your goal is to defeat your opponents to make the deity to whom you pledged allegiance proud. To do that, you need to collect as many points (or Ankhs) as possible, performing Rituals with various Amulets. 4 deities are available: Isis, Anubis, Bastet and Seth.
The Trial
The oldest player plays first, since it is assumed that they’ll join the gods sooner than the others… Then, the player on their left plays their turn, and so on.

On your turn,

You must play one of your 4 Amulet Cards. Place it on any free space of the board, choosing its orientation. Then, draw a new Amulet Card to have 4 Amulet Cards in your hand again. You can either take an Amulet Card from the Deities’ Market, or draw a random Amulet Card from the top of the draw pile. If you take a card from the Market, immediately replace it with a new card from the draw pile.
You may cast one of the Rituals of your Deity Board (see Cast a Ritual on p.7). You can do this before or after placing an Amulet on the board. You can cast as many Rituals as you like. Casting a Ritual is not mandatory.


Alternatively, you may decide to pass. This allows you to discard your entire hand of Amulet Cards to draw 4 new Amulet Cards instead. When you pass, ignore the two actions listed above.
The Trial ends once a player has cast 5 Rituals. Check if any player has completed their Exaltation Card (a secret secondary objective), then proceed to final scoring.

Cast a Ritual
There are two types of Rituals: Simple Rituals and Advanced Rituals. Players receive Simple Rituals at the beginning of the game. They are easy to cast but do not score many points. Players may draw Advanced Rituals during the game. These Rituals score more points. Each Ritual Card depicts the Amulets required to cast the Ritual.
To cast a Ritual, you must make sure that the depicted Amulets are correctly linked to each other: An Amulet is linked to the adjacent Amulet if both arrows are face to face. There must be no other Amulets between the arrows of the Amulets required to cast the Ritual. There can be more Amulets than required, of course. In that case, simply indicate the ones that you are using.
A Ritual allows you to gain Ankhs (as many as indicated on the card, in front of the matching symbol). However, casting a Ritual consumes the Amulets’ energy. For this reason, some of them need to be broken. Remove the Amulet(s) of your choice from the ones used for the Ritual and place them in front of you.
Rituals can be cast according to two principles: Order OR Chaos.
ORDER : Such Rituals score more points and break less Amulets – which means that more Amulets remain available for the other players.
CHAOS : The black symbols depict the Chaos Principle. Such Rituals score less points and break more Amulets.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Ancient, Card Game, Mythology
mechanics: Chaining, Connections, Contracts, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Race, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: EXIT Adventskalender: Die verlassene Fabrik
description:
EXIT - the mega trend now also as an Advent calendar! Day by day, room by room, time is running out ...

This Advent season will be just as exciting as an Escape Room! In each of the 24 compartments of the Exit Advent Calendar for ages 10 and up, a tricky puzzle challenges the player.
To find the right door for the following day, the puzzle must be solved in the room. To do this, clues can be found in the richly detailed illustrated compartments, on a total of 55 puzzle cards and on a wide variety of knob elements. If you combine cleverly, you will find the solution and thus the symbol of the following door.

This is the mission: On a ramble through an old industrial area, an abandoned factory is discovered. It seems to be a former toy factory where, among other things, small tin toy cars and nutcrackers were once produced. I wonder what secrets there are to discover in the empty building? It would be a great adventure to find a safe, for example.
The search for the mysterious safe is a challenge: Every day, a tricky riddle has to be solved to find out which room of the old building may be entered the following day. Clever powers of deduction, imagination and creativity are required.
But don't worry, if you get stuck, a table on the back of the pack with 2 hints per puzzle and a breakdown of the solution will help. Let the exciting discovery tour begin!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Catch the Vibe
description:
Think you have what it takes to beat the Vibe Master? Catch The Vibe is here to put that to the test. In this adult party card game, you'll battle to see who knows their friends best.

It starts with the Vibe Master, who draws a Topic Card (like "Talking in a Baby Voice to Your Partner," "The Smell of Gasoline," or "Open Casket Funerals") and 2 Range Cards (like "Yummy/Gross," "Wild/Tame," or "Brave/Cowardly") to set up the ranges of the board. The Vibe Master then secretly picks where they'd assign the topic on the board, and everybody else must guess.

Earn more points the closer you get to the truth! The perfect way to pump up the vibes at any game night, barbecue, or party.

name: Yummy Monsters
description:
Welcome to Yummy Monsters, the restaurant for each and every taste! Come as you are — we are open for every monster like me and you!

In Yummy Monsters, you are monster waiters in the restaurant who try to serve food to your guests' liking — and this gets weird at times because the customers are monsters!

In this dexterity flinging game, players try to throw foods into the mouths of four 3D monster heads. The game box acts as the tables where the monsters are sitting, and the customers have different quirks on how they like their food to be delivered, so you need to master multiple throwing techniques.

Each waiter is a different monster who has its own special gloves and mask that will make throwing the foods difficult!

name: Spite 'N' Malice
description: This is a 2-deck, 2-player version of Spite & Malice with cards Ace through King, rather than Ace through Queen. The jokers are also excluded. It is very similar to Skip-Bo.

name: Hourglass of Life
description:
There is a girl in a hospital with only seven days to live. Can you save her?

Hourglass of Life is a roll-and-move game cooperative game with a traitor, and variable board consisting of cards that start face down. As players land on cards, they pick up the card then put a card from their hand in its place, optionally activating the card placed. Every time the turn goes back around to the start player, the days remaining ticks down.

For the "good" players to win, one of them needs to make it to the end of the track before time runs out — but the traitor wins if he makes it to the end first, or if time runs out.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Cash or Crash
description:
Cash or Crash is a card-based bluffing game in the same vein as the classic Liar's Dice, but granting players a greater degree of control, and more strategic and tactical options.

Players start with identical hands of ten cards, each showing differing numbers and combinations of the game's three commodities: Gold, Wheat and Oil. Normally, each player "invests" two of these cards to begin the round, placing them face down in front of himself. Players use their own hidden information (the cards they've invested) and the other players' bids to make educated guesses about the true value of the market (i.e. the total quantities of each commodity present among all players' cards), while trying not to give too much away themselves.

One player kicks off the bidding, making a prediction about the minimum number of a given commodity present among all player's cards, for instance "Five Wheat." The next player must then either increase the bid, or "sell," thereby challenging the previous player's bid. When increasing the bid, however, players can choose between increasing the quantity (e.g. "Seven Wheat") or adding a commodity to make a combo bid (e.g. "Five Wheat and Gold," meaning that there are at least five of each). A player who is stuck, neither wanting to increase the bid nor challenge, has a third option available: investing an additional card (up to a maximum of 4) in order to change the bid to a new commodity (or combo) entirely, for instance, changing from "Five Wheat and Gold" to "Six Oil." The catch is that this additional card increases the player's potential losses should they be the eventual loser of the round.

When a player sells, all cards are revealed, and the loser of the challenge loses all the cards he had invested: his initial two, plus any additional cards he invested in order to change the bid. A player without cards is eliminated, and the last player standing is the winner.

Cash or Cash plays well in groups from two to eight (though with the usual caveats about player elimination when playing with a large group, i.e. make sure there's something to do for those out early), and features two additional game modes and an optional "doubling" rule to accommodate different groups' preferences.

In Endurance mode, only one card is invested by each player to start, and the bids can only be raised in single steps, for a more tactical game. In Blitz mode, on the other hand, players may bid and challenge out of turn, and there is no cap on the number of cards a player can invest; challenging successfully out of turn allows players to recover a card lost in an earlier round.

With the doubling rule, the bidder who is being challenged may "double" in response to the following player calling "sell." The challenger must then either withdraw her challenge and bid as usual, or else persist in the challenge, with the stakes now doubled (i.e. the loser will have to discard additional cards from their hand equal to the number lost normally).
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Push Your Luck

name: 20.000 Leghe Sotto i Mari
description:
A game inspired (as by the WD copyright notice at the end of the rules booklet) by the Walt Disney movie version of the Jules Verne famous book "20.000 Leagues Under the Sea".

From the rules (Translated from Italian):
"The goal of the Game is to take part in the fantastic voyages of the mysterious NAUTILUS submarine, and to win showing to be The Best Pilot and the Most Skilled and Intrepid Diver-Hunter of the Seas and the Surface. The Gameboard represent the Ocean: the light blue squares are the 'Medium Depths', the 'royal blue' ones the Ocean Depths. At the beginning of the game each Player receive a randomly choosen Objective card. The Players must then move across the Gameboard collecting hunting Trophies. The captured Trophies can be excanged for variable Gold Guineas amounts. At the end of the game (when the Depth Gauge in the center of the Gameboard indicate a depth of 20.000 Leagues) the Player with the most Gold Guineas win, and is declared to be 'CAPTAIN NEMO', true Master of the NAUTILUS!"

name: Weapons & Warriors: Weapon Pack 2
description:
Copyright 1995 by Pressman this box contains The Power Catapult, The Defense Shield, 13 Soldiers, 24 Battleballs, and a label sheet.

From the back of the box: This Weapons & Warriors Weapon Pack features one of the most popular weapons and one of the sturdiest defenses of the medieval era. The finely detailed Power Catapult hurls Battleballs at the enemy, which seeks refuge behind the Defense Shield.

This is an expansion the Weapons & Warriors: Castle Combat Set base game.

name: Überläufer
description:
Who can change sides with their whole team the quickest?

The crux of the matter: at the end of the game all figures should be standing in exactly the same position but at the other end of the board. Dark or light -- the players' figures intermingle, seemingly randomly on their journey across the board, and they are allowed to jump in any direction that will help them. Using clever tactics helps: the little moves could open up a broader and surprising new perspective. A tactical jumping game for two capricious strategists.

name: Bloemeneiland
description:
Bloemeneiland - the Island of Flowers - is a game for 2 or 3 players who are flower buyers for the King. Players must buy flowers from the local merchants and growers and send them by ship back to the Palace to gain favor at court. The player with the most favor after six rounds is the winner.

Playing the game:
Beginning with the round’s Starting Player, players take clockwise turns doing 2 actions in order.

Action 1: Players must move the Island Marker on the board in a clockwise direction from one Townsperson space to another (or to the Dock). They may move any number of spaces but only the first space moved is free. Each additional space costs 1 gold. If the marker stops in front of a Townsperson that player will receive a benefit if they choose. If the player stops at the Dock they
will cause all players to deliver flowers to the Ship.

Action 2: After the player visits a Townsperson they must move their numbered Player Marker to a Location which matches the Townsperson’s colored border. Locations occupied by another player may not be visited. You may then use the Location’s Special Action. If the Island Marker is at the Dock, no Locations may be used.

If the Island Marker is at the Dock, all players may now choose to deliver flowers to the Ship and gain Favor Points. Beginning with the round’s Starting Player and then continuing clockwise, each player may deliver one type of flower to the ship, but never more than the Palace currently demands as valued by the dice in play. After each delivery, adjust the corresponding die down by the number of flowers delivered. Anyone who delivers flowers receives Favor Points equal to what is currently shown on the Favor Point track above the Ship.

Game End: The game ends after the sixth Ship has sailed. In additional to the Favor Points earned during the game, each player receives an additional 1 Favor Point for every 3 flowers of each type they have in their possession. Gold is not worth any Favor Points. Whoever has collected the most Favor Points is the winner.

This game is an express version inspired by Santiago de Cuba by Michael Rieneck.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Bop It! XT
description:
Taken form the official product web site on Hasbro.com:

It’s time to get moving. Can you keep up? When you turn it on, this totally cool Bop It game calls out commands. It’s up to you to “pull it”, “bop it”, “twist it” — or “flick it”, “spin it”, “shake it”! Can you keep up as the tempo revs?

Play Bop It! XT in party mode or solo — you can even plug in your headphones to keep the game all to yourself. Get it right and you can keep going, but if you get the moves wrong, your turn is up. Think you’ve got what it takes to beat it? Then, start the action!

name: Main Battle Area
description:
From the rule booklet.

Main Battle Area is a realistic simulation of modern tactical combat that puts you in the role of a US battalion task force or Soviet regimental commander. Main Battle Area simulates combat in a playable, realistic manner. Units in Main Battle Area represent platoons and sections. Losses are expressed in individual vehicles and fire teams or squads. The scale of the map is 250 meters to a square. Game turns represent ten minutes of actual time.

Uses the same system as Desert Victory.

name: Rocket Hockey
description:
From the box: The ultimate game of speed and reaction! Send the puck zooming into your opponent's goal as he tries to block it! First player to score 10 goals wins.

The metal puck can get going pretty darn fast in this game. It is a game of pure reflex.
publishers: Action GT, Editrice Giochi, Mattel, Inc.

name: Kryomek
description:
from the backcover:
Kryomek is a furiously fast, hard fought tabletop skirmish game using a wide range of figures and accessories available from Fantasy Forge. This book is the first of a fully integrated Game System that will allow a sophisticated re-enactment of the Great Wars between the Nexus forces of Panhumanic Spacetime and the Swarms of the Kryomek Great Hive Hegemony.

Expanded by

Kryomek: Hivestone

name: Storyteller Cards
description:
Storyteller Cards are a playing card deck, designed to inspire creativity in gamers, role-players, writers, artists, teachers, parents and children. They were designed by Jason Tagmire and illustrated by Campbell Whyte.

Each card features an illustration with 4 unique elements. There is a character, holding an item, completing an action, in a location. Each of these elements can be used to create something new, get you out of a mid-project slump, or just to have some creative fun with family and friends.

The cards also feature additional icons in the corners to help you dig a little deeper into storytelling, creating, and gaming. The icons represent a rank, suit, mood, season, letter, and color.


The Storyteller Manual includes rules for 16 different ways to play. From strategic coloring to push-your-luck storytelling, there are game variations for everyone. Many variants are story based gaining points for each card played, best poker hands and matching card elements, but others include strategic coloring (where players must complete illustration quadrants to earn points), and endless possibilities (where the players create and change the rules in a race to 30 points).

name: Erzähl doch mal...
description:
Erzähl doch mal... is a story telling game in which the players try to use their picture cards to tell a story with the elements in the pictures. The game requires creativity, as players have to figure out a way to implement the new cards in the story. The game also requires concentration and memory, because the players have to remember the whole story in correct order, as they have to recite the whole thing from beginning to end, every time a card is added.

If a player makes a mistake - forgets something, tells things in wrong order - the card they drew is removed from the game. That element won't join the story. It also means a loss of a point, as the number of cards collected during the game determines the winner.

A little wooden cat moves forward on a track towards a castle which marks the end of the game. Some spaces on the track have special effects that remove cards from play or exchange them, changing the story. Some spaces let you draw a card, but the next player has to tell the story.
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling
publishers: Brain Games, Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, LOGIS

name: Rubberneckers
description:
"Make every road trip an unforgettable adventure. To play, passengers score points by locating objects on their cards and by engaging passengers in other cars. Rubberneckers will keep even the wiggliest backseat traveler entertained for hours . . ."

"It requires players to closely watch the road and surrounding areas. Players score points every time they sight an item or do something as directed on a Rubberneckers card. The first player to score 100 points wins."

name: Scriba Travel
description:
Scriba Travel is yet another Scrabble clone. Quite popular on Polish market due to much lower price.

It is called "Travel" only because of small box. The board does not have any enhancements towards playing while traveling thus playing in a vehicle is still difficult.

name: East Front Battles III: Drive on Dubno, 1941
description:
Drive on Dubno: is the third game in the East Front Battles Series by Decision Games.

During the opening days of Operation Barbarossa, the German First Panzer Group drove deep through the Ukraine with its ultimate objective the great city of Kiev. Leading the thrust was the 48th Panzer Corps. The Germans broke through the Soviet frontier defenses, but the Red Army quickly counterattacked with several mechanized corps. While the Germans were outnumbered, especially in tanks, they had superior command control and tactics, allowing them to defeat the Soviets piecemeal. Moreover, the Red Army at this stage of the war was in the midst of reorganization, and suffering from severe logistical shortfalls. Still, the Germans got a surprise when they ran up against T-34 and KV tanks which were far heavier than the German AFVs, and were largely impervious to their anti-tank fire, except for the infamous 88mm flak guns. Following several days of mobile battles, the Wehrmacht routed the Red Army. Yet, the Germans were delayed long enough to cost them a quick capture of Kiev, a failure which would have considerable ramifications in the next several months of the campaign.

Originally published in World at War magazine #31 (Aug-Sep 2013).

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 1 day
Hex: 2 miles / 3.5 kilometers
Units: Battalion to Army

Game Inventory:
One 22 x 34" full color map
One dual-side printed countersheet (276 9/16" counters)
One 16-page rulebook

Solitaire Playability: High
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 4-15 hours

Note: Players will need to provide one 6-sided die for game play.

name: The Mystery of Dattakamo
description:
This is a deduction through conversation game. Exercise your vivid imagination and infer the thing that comes into your opponent’s mind by using the sense of touch.
Due to the nature of the game, the visually impaired people can enjoy and play, too!

//story

In ancient times, when the mammoths and dinosaurs walked the land, or perhaps even before that, there was a civilization called “Dattakamo”. Its people excelled at making things out of clay, of which they made many: from what they found at the bottom of the ocean, to what they saw in the beyond the galaxy; from flowers and animals around them, to things from the imaginary future. They treasured what they had made, and lived happily. One day, however, a volcano suddenly erupted and the civilization perished.

Time flew by, and now in the present, the works of the “Dattakamo” people have been excavated and brought into the Academy. What are they? Some of the artifacts are broken; others, with strange and bizarre shapes. All of them were treasures of the “Dattakamo” people.

In the Academy, a renowned professor and his students sit around these artifacts. The professor wonders what the pieces are, while his students discuss his ideas earnestly.

// Game Progress

The purpose of this game is that the students guess right what the professor imagines. The students ask the professor three questions, one at a time, during their turns. This is called the “discussion”, and a discussion has 3 rounds. The professor has to answer correctly these questions. During this phase, students can freely touch the piece as many times as they want.
If a student manages to make a correct guess, he gets the piece from the professor.
When all the players have finished playing the role of the professor, the game ends and the player who acquires the most artifacts is the greatest professor ? and wins!

name: Island Project
description:
The last chance for humankind to survive! As the Earth's sea levels keep rising due to global warming, there are only few remaining habitable lands on the planet. The world's top scientists scramble to come up with a rescue plan but most have failed.

Until 2165, the Island Project is launched using a way to activate submarine volcanoes to erupt gently. The flowing lava meets the ocean, and cools and hardens into a new island. Although the project is effective, when a volcano erupts and detonates nearby, hidden volcanoes, it will endanger the ocean and mankind. The timing of eruptions is hard to predict, and the trigger effects are widespread.

In order to conserve the tribal community, you need wise strategies and resilience to lead your tribesmen to safe islands and plateaus! Lead your tribe from the Native Islands and search for Newly Formed Islands.

Island Project is a family, party game, for all ages. The theme and artwork of the game smartly gives a strong message to environmental awareness, and knowledge of how lands were form base on science.

During the game, players try their best to lead their own tribes to safe islands and plateaus, on the other hand avoiding the other players to receive points from doing the same, maybe it's a good idea that trying to create volcanoes next to the other tribes...and get to the safe places on your own since the space on the islands are limited...
categories: Adventure, Dice, Environmental, Party Game, Science Fiction, Travel
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Tile Placement

name: Simon's Cat: Lunch Time
description:
The card game “SIMONS CAT - LUNCH TIME” is a game for the whole family, for ages 5-105. It’s all about quick reactions and keeping your eyes on the prize.

Simon’s Cat and his friends are searching for hidden treats. Find out which pet is best at tracking them down. Be quick, score points and shout “Simon’s Cat!” when you see that greedy cat. The game continues until the last card has been taken from the pack.
This fast-paced card game for 2 to 8 players features adorable art taken directly from animator and illustrator Simon Tofield's YouTube series, Simon's Cat, which has hundreds of millions of views.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Monopoly Scrabble
description:
Monopoly Scrabble combines elements of both Monopoly and Scrabble, with players using letter tiles to build words, then moving around the game board based on their score. Build a word on a premium space, and you immediately claim a property. Custom Community Chest and Chance cards keep things moving at a fast pace.

When the final letter tile has been played, whoever has the highest total of cash and property value wins.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Set Collection, Spelling, Square Grid, Tile Placement, Trading

name: Explorium: A High Stakes Mining Extravaganza
description:
Explorium puts you in the hot seat of the world’s most risky and rewarding business...exploration and mining! Role-play as chairman and president of a junior exploration company. You must acquire un-tapped resources of copper, silver and GOLD— the king of metals and the metal of kings!

The fluctuations of the Metal Market Index will test your presidential ability to keep profits soaring. Meanwhile your competitors will be working feverishly to intimidate and threaten your projects by playing that elusive ace up their sleeve...the Global News Wire card.

In addition to staking claims all over the globe and expanding your influence in foreign nations, keep your drills to the ground for rumblings of possible joint-ventures and hostile takeover opportunities. Acquiring select properties allows you to expand your empire and not only produce profits from your mines, but also from playing the Metal Market Index to your advantage.
Do you have the savvy and grit to build your penny trading junior exploration company to a full grown mining powerhouse?

Selling Highlights
- Fun introduction to gold market
- Real-world events
- Anticipation of finds
- Classic bank/credit notes
Appeals to
- Budding geologists
- Investors, miners and entrepreneurs
- Stock speculators or risk-takers
- Negotiators, bidders and table-talkers


Explorium is the only official mining board game endorsed by publicly listed corporations.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Trading

name: Der kleine Drache Kokosnuss und das Geheimnis der Mumie
description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Der kleine Drache Kokosnuss und das Geheimnis der Mumie, players try to help the little dragon Kokosnuss and his friends save the golden mask of the pharaoh from greedy grave robbers. To do this, the players must collect as many rolls of toilet paper as possible as only then can everyone dress up as mummies and scare the grave robbers into taking flight from the pharaoh's tomb.

During the game, players try to uncover toilet paper cards and match them to game boards for Kokosnuss, Oscar the fire-breathing dragon or Matilda the porcupine. Once a board is filled, players cannot reverse their actions. Stock up enough toilet paper, and you'll be able to keep the golden mask safe, winning the game together as the grave robbers flee.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Push Your Luck

name: Sound Quartett
description: An hilarious quartett game where only animalsounds are allowed to ask for cards.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game

name: Bible Sequence
description:
From the back of the box:

NOAH AND THE FLOOD, MOSES AND THE BURNING BUSH, THE EMPTY TOMB....Inspiring stories within the Bible. Now children and adults can learn about the Old and New Testament as they play the fun game of SEQUENCE. Pictures representing Bible stories are displayed on each card and the gameboard. The cards also include a story title and scripture reference. Players match the picture on a card to the same picture on the board, then place their chip there. Five chips in a row wins the game! It's the fun, challenging game of BIBLE SEQUENCE.

name: Bad Choices
description:
HILARIOUS ADULT PARTY GAME:
Bad Choices is the naughty love child of ‘Never Have I Ever’ and ‘UNO’. This is the adult party game for finding out hilarious truths, secrets and stories about your friends.

EASY TO LEARN RULES:
300 Hilarious Cards that will have everyone laughing. Created by the creator of the savage adult party game BAD PEOPLE.

The player to discard all of their cards first becomes the winner.

—description from the publisher

name: MADNESS
description:
The world has been infected with the Madness Virus which has begun turning the population into blood-thirsty zombies. Help find the antidote formula and save the world before it's too late!

Madness is a fast-paced card game for 2 or 4 players ages 9 and up. There are no turns in the game and so players must think and play quickly in order to win. Match your ingredient cards to the ever-changing MADNESS formula before your opponent matches theirs - But be careful, if you select an incorrect formula you lose!

name: Monochrome  Chess
description:
Monochrome Chess is played with 2 identical Chess sets, set up as you would for ordinary Chess, except with the same color on both sides of the board. The objective is to capture pieces (including the King) of your opponent.

Any piece positioned on your side of the board (i.e. the 4 rows closest to you) is yours, while any piece on the other side of the board belongs to your opponent. Any time you move a piece across the center line, it becomes your opponent's piece. You may only capture pieces belonging to your opponent, so pieces which get moved onto your side of the board can only be captured by your opponent. There is no "check" or "checkmate": a king may be captured, and the game ends if one player runs out of pieces.

The player who has the captured the highest point-value total of the opponents pieces is the winner. (K = 10, Q = 8, R= 5, B = 4, Kt 3, P = 1)

name: Postcards from North America
description: Postcards from America is a unique game where the players learn geography by traveling to cities and other locations based on actual postcards. The game used 64 postcards from the game designers personal travels. Designed for Ages 7 and up
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ithaka
description:
Ithaka is played on a four by four square grid with three pieces in each of four colors. The pieces are initially arranged so that the three pieces of each color occupy a corner space and the two adjacent edge spaces.

All of the pieces are shared by both players. Each player, in turn, moves one piece any number of spaces in a straight orthogonal or diagonal line over as many empty spaces as is desired, with the following restrictions:

1) The piece moved must not be the same piece moved on your opponent's most recent turn, and,

2) The piece moved must begin next to a piece of the same color.

Win either by getting three pieces of one color in a row or by leaving your opponent with no available moves.

The Ithaka Rules are available from the World of Abstract Games Web Site, and an Ithaka ZRF is also available for play with Zillions of Games.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement

name: The Tragedy of McDeath
description:
A scenario pack for 2nd edition Warhammer.

Contains four scenarios, background information, campaign map and cut out buildings.

An additional scenario for the campaign was included in White Dwarf #76 ("Glen Woe").
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Snapps
description:
A dexterity game for 2 or more players.
Plays in 10 minutes with 6 players.
For ages 6 and up .

In Snapps there are 6 blocks and a 8cm×8cm square board and all you have to do is place the blocks onto the board… simple.
Well, yes and no: You see, the blocks have magnets in them, and you must place the blocks without making any of them snap together. The first few blocks will be easy to place but as more blocks get placed, the available space on the board dwindles, and it becomes rather tricky to place the last blocks.

If all the blocks get placed on the board, the game enters a second phase, in which players must take turns to push a block towards the centre of the board. At some point the blocks will suddenly snap together, and the player taking their turn at the time is eliminated. Eliminate all your opponents to win.

Knowledge about the physics of magnetism is not essential; what you need are a steady hand and nerves of steel, because those snapping blocks will make you jump.

Schnapps is the adult variant, in which the player who makes the blocks snap together must drink a shot.

name: Bowling
description:
Cards and dice game. There are 9 cards representing the skittles 1 to 9. They are shuffled and laid out in a diamond formation. Then the player in his turn, reveals the 9 cards and rolls the three dice supplied. A skittle is hit if the number on a card corresponds with the numbers on the dice,either as an individual figure or the sum of 2 or 3 dice. In this way combinations of the dice may be used to knock over as many skittles (turn them over) as the player can. There are rules about which skittles in a layout are covered by other skittles. This cannot be knocked over until the skittle(s) covering them are knocked over first.

Players in their turn can throw the dice three times. Every skittle knocked over scores a point. If all 9 are knocked over in three rolls, then the score is 12 instead of 9. If you can knock them all over in just two throws, you score 15. First player to 77 points wins the game.

name: The Game of Life: Empire
description:
A new twist on an old favourite!

Choose a career, then choose your path to the big time!
Pick a token, spin the spinner, move around the board and start owning the world's top brands. Build up your empire as you advance through life!

A family-style game where you try to collect six brands, as determined by your 'Hot List' card and return to the center to win! Be careful though, as other players can steal your brands! You'll also collect 'Followers' on your journey that make you more money on payday!

The 'Action' cards keep things interesting and the 'Empire' cards give you the power to change the game!
mechanics: Acting, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Celebrity Name Game
description:
Home version of the popular TV game show hosted by Craig Ferguson. Players have to give clues to get their teammates to say the names of celebrities, characters, famous places, etc. before time runs out. Whichever teams has the most points after four rounds wins!

The show itself was based on the board game called !dentity Crisis? (Identity Crisis?) created by Laura Robinson.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Zombie Doctor: The Zombie Card Game
description:
Zombie Doctor is a fun and frantic card-turning game. Amputate, reattach and swap limbs in a desperate bid to stay alive. It's your turn not to turn!

The game is designed for 2-4 players (preferably 4), lasts for around 60 minutes and is suitable for ages 15+, due to the comic zombie gore.

It's small enough to fit in your pocket and is suitable to play at parties or if you have a spare hour with friends and family.

The game is easy to learn but the elements of luck and strategy will keep avid board gamers entertained and challenged.

—description from the publisher

name: In Full Bloom
description:
There are kinds of assortment flowers in four seasons. These flowers and trees interlace with one another become a great landscape. Let’s plant some lovely flowers! Who will design the most colorful sea of flowers?

Every player chooses a set of player markers. The game is played in 2 phases: Collect and Design.

Collect: Choose 3 Garden tiles, place a player marker and draw 3 Garden tiles from the bag.

Design: All players face up their 6 Garden tiles and place these Flower tiles together at the same time.

After all players finished their sea of flowers, the game ends. The player with the most points wins the game.

name: Rube
description:
Reuben "Rube" Goldberg was an American cartoonist, sculptor, author, engineer, and inventor, remembered today for his cartoons depicting needlessly elaborate contraptions that perform simple tasks. These intricate collections of springs, pulleys, marbles, and countless other components are at once pointless and fascinating, silly and inspiring.

Summon your inner Rube Goldberg to help you score points in a 2-player, 9-card game that challenges you to make amazingly point-filled but still pointless, machines.


Released in the March 2020 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Industry / Manufacturing, Print & Play

name: Monopoly: Dungeons & Dragons
description:
Heed the call to capture monsters from across the Forgotten Realms in MONOPOLY: Dungeons & Dragons! Buy, sell, and trade traditional and modern iconic and deadly monsters like the Beholder, Storm Giant, and infamous Demogorgon to nerf the competition. Six collectible tokens representing classes including Halfling Rogue, Human Fighter, Human Wizard, Dwarven Cleric, Elven Ranger, and Tiefling Bard take you around the board to make discoveries, build up Expeditions and Bases, and collect custom D&D currency to become the richest adventurer and win!
—description from the publisher

As an officially-branded Monopoly variety, the four corner squares are not allowed to be rethemed, but the rest of the game is D&D-themed. Gameplay works the same as classic Monopoly.

Includes game board, 6 metal tokens, 28 Title Deed Cards, 16 Encounters (Chance) Cards, 16 Treasure (Community Chest) Cards, paper money with customized art, 32 Expeditions (Houses), 12 Bases (Hotels), 2 dice, and rules.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Hasbro, The Op Games, Wizards of the Coast

name: Szeszélyes vizeken
description:
Trust your eyes and yourselves only - are you ready to set sail on the Moody Seas? The author of the award-winning Spicy takes you to the world of wild waves, where everyone is a foe of yours, including the sea itself.

The world is full of wonders ready to be explored. Charming landscapes and glory await the adventurous and advantageous, but the clumsy and unfortunate shall pay the price.

Set sail on the Moody Seas, explore the wild waves of vast waters like the Too Specific Ocean or the Snort Sea, and become more glorious than your fellow mates!
Careful you must be - a sailor is just as much of a swindler as their love, the sea, so you’ll never know whose story to believe and where to sail.

Moody Seas is a fast-paced, easy-to-learn bluffing card game where danger does not only come from the tall tales of others, but the cards themselves cause trouble too.

Set sail, seek the waves of fortune, and become the gloriest sailor of all times!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Push Your Luck

name: Galle Fort
description:
In Galle Fort, the players are attempting to build a lighthouse in the port of Galle, an important trading post in Sri Lanka.

During the game, players will either take resources from a central pool or trade them for other resources. One of the key actions is turning in tea to invite another player to a tea party, where you will demand all of one of their types of resources unless they pay one of the available bribes.

The first player to acquire three building materials, thereby erecting the lighthouse, wins.

name: Backgammon 4
description:
A nice-looking variant for four players, by the same company that produced Four Player Chess.

Picture a "rounded square" with six backgammon points on each side of the square, then add three new points in each corner. The board is reversible, with traditional backgammon on the reverse side.

Regular backgammon rules apply for movement. The setup is slightly different, since the points "farthest away" from your home court are used by another player, so those 2 stones start one unit closer to home.

The major change is direction - that all players in a three or four player game are moving clockwise. Evidently there is no way to set up four players with two running clockwise and two running reverse.

There are variants listed, including team play where two players can have stones resting on the same point. For two players on this board, each gets two sets of pieces.

This game differs from Quadragammon in that there are four complete sets of stones and the board has additional points printed in the corners. And its main difference, the all-clockwise movement.

Contents - reversible board (4-fold), 4 sets of stones, 2 dice (!) and rules.

name: Dico Déclic
description:
Dico Déclic is 120 cards of pure pleasure in the format "mini tarot," whatever you are a novice or a pro of word games.

Making a Dico Déclic is to form one or more words using all his letters. More long a word is, the more points he earns at the end of the game.

At the end of each round, players secretly note the words found, (with the number of letter of the longest word count as triple), then they pass their cards to their left neighbor for the next round.

Once all players have played with the hands of all players, all of the words found are revealed. The players compare the different Dico Déclic and score the points.

n.b. This game is available only in French at this moment.

name: Weird Alchemy: Kickstarter Edition
description:
The Kickstarter edition includes the base game as well as The Alchemist's Garden Expansion which is packaged inside the box of the base game.

The expansion adds eighteen more cards for your games of Weird Alchemy.

9 new creatures in three new sets.
3 new magic cards.
6 extra pass cards.

The expansion allows the game to be played by up to eight players.

-description from designer

name: Good Omens: An Ineffable Game
description:
Welcome to Tadfield! The forces of prophecy, Heaven, and Hell have assembled to start Armageddon. The angels and demons are preparing for battle and only a ragtag group of valiant interlopers can stop it. That’s where you come in. In this game, you will find several different dice and card games themed around the confrontations that took place in the final chapter (for now) of the Good Omens story. Many of the games feature a mix of dice and cards. Why cards? Because cards feature in the series and in the ethos of Good Omens. This whole existence thing is like one big game to those who pull the strings…

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Treachery of the Paper Fox
description:
Treachery of the Paper Fox is an 18 card game where an Origami Fox is trying to chase paper birds. Each player is trying to collect a set of 4 of the same paper animals, or 4 of the same colour of paper lanterns, where the Fox blends in as a wild, except two Foxes together become useless. Players must try and manage the cards in their hand, to best collect the set they think will win them the game, but also keep track of what information their opponents have given, so as to not give away free points.

Treachery of the Paper Fox features a cute paper themed design style, featuring Origami forest dwelling animals, and paper lanterns, making it a light game and a visual treat.

-description from designer

name: Detecteam Kids: Tales of the Plush Forest
description:
In childhood, every day is filled with interesting events! Meet Christopher and his plush toy friends: Little Bear, Piglet, Rabbit and other animals. Together they always find a way how to have fun: they can invent a tale and bring it to life with all their unusual ideas. What should they do this time? Maybe arrange a costume ball, a tea party or go hunt for a bizarre beast? However, even the best plans can go awry… But Christopher and his friends are not afraid of any difficulties ― the unexpected circumstances make their games even more exciting!

Tales of the Plush Forest is a co-operative adventure for young detectives. Your goal is to piece together the full picture, just like a jigsaw puzzle, and re-create the events. Find out what actually happened in this stand-alone game from the Detecteam Kids range!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Murder/Mystery
publishers: Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, Mirakulus, Red Cat Games

name: Subzero
description:
Description taken from the Kidultgame homepage:

SUBZERO: roll your snowball and shoot them "fast and furious" over your opponents. Move, hit, avoid the flying snowballs. Try to perceive by intuition what your opponent is going to do and where he is planning to go.
Try not to be unarmed in front of your opponents. Examine your cards and plan the better sequence of actions. If you can lower yourself to avoid the snowballs, remember: who raises up is lost!

The English/German/Italian version of the game can be downloaded for free on the Kidultgame homepage.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Humor, Print & Play, Sports

name: Rotaris
description: The board consists of a hex frame, a rotating ring inside the frame and a rotating centre piece. There are 12, 12, and again 6 holes in these, respectively. The 2 players rotate the ring, centre or both clockwise for 60 degrees and places a ball in one of the holes. To get 5 in a row is the goal, but the rotating ring / centre add complexity.

name: Pictionary: Simpsons Edition
description: The classic game of Pictionary using a set of Simpsons-themed words.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Spitfire!
description:
"Spitfire! captures the drama of the war in the air in Europe in 1939-1941, with scenarios drawn from the war over Poland, France, Britain, Malta, and Greece. Over 50 historical scenarios (5 of them solitaire) are provided, each featuring one or more fighter aces . . . The 40 aircraft types include the Polish PZL 11, French Potez 63 fighter bomber and the highly advanced Dewotine D520, the German Fieseler Storch, Focke-Wulf 200C, Dornier DO 17Z, and Messerschmitt 109, British Hurricanes, Spitfires and Beaufighters, and the archaic Fairey Battle, plus US and Italian aircraft."

This game extended Jim Hind's Aces High game system from World War I into World War II. Spitfire was the first of four projected games simulating World War II. Spitfire covers the early period of the conflict, from the invasion of Poland in 1939 to the end of 1941, when the war became global. 3W had announced the 2nd game in the series but never released Messerschmitt. The other two title were not named. No Pacific Theater airplanes were released by 3W.

Note that Spitfire! is not related to the 1973 SPI release bearing the same name.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II

name: Scribbage
description:
This game is played on a 5x5 'tableau'. Players take turns drawing a card from the deck and placing it face-up in any free space in the tableau. One player is trying to make high-scoring Cribbage hands (see the traditional card game "Cribbage") on the vertical columns and the other player is trying to build hands on the horizontal rows. So every card will be placed in an attempt to maximize one of the player's five hands and minimize the scoring of one of the opponent's five hands.

The game comes with a felt mat with a numbered 25-space playfield, and a set of poker chips for tracking the incremental point scoring during the play of the hand.

This game is very similar to the later-published "Cross Cribb".

This game should not be confused with the identically-named "Scribbage", which is another name for "Ad-Lib Crossword Cubes".

name: Monopoly: Century of Flight Aviation
description:
Fasten your seat belts and prepare for departure! This commemorative MONOPOLY game is rich in history and showcases the greatest aircraft built in the last century. Get rich while buying, selling, and trading the most significant aircraft and aircraft parts of the last 100 years. Put yourself in the pilot’s seat and wheel and deal to “own it all”.

This completely customized game comes with “Aviation Dollars” and 6 collectible pewter tokens: fighter jet, helicopter, monoplane, hot air balloon, commercial jet and airship.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Schleichfahrt: Sneaking Behind Enemy Lines
description:
In the not so distant future, mankind has managed to lay waste to earth's surface. Even though forced to find a new home on the ocean ground, nothing stopped humans to continue battling each other.
You are a mercenary trying to make his living by serving those that pay most.
Your mission sounds easy at first glance:
Scout the ocean ground for three different resources and bring them back to the hangar, so the technicans can build a bomb you are to drop over the enemy base.
Here comes the downside: You are all on your own between the beasts of the deep sea as well as the very well armed hostile submarines.
And the resources to equip your sub are limited!
Good luck, mercenary - we count on you.

Schleichfahrt - sneaking behind enemy lines has been created during the Sneaky Sci Fi Game Contest in May/June 2010 held by Rudolf Aligierski.
It is a solitaire ocean crawl in which you are playing a mercenary in his sub on his mission to gather resources and - upon having done so - to deploy a bomb on the hostile base.
While you will encounter monsters of the deep sea as well as loads of hostile subs, fighting is not always an option. Most of the time you will be better off relying on your engines to maneuver you out of sight of the enemy subs.
categories: Card Game, Exploration, Fighting, Nautical, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: GETSOME
description:
Operation World Party Gaming introduces GETSOME, GETSOME: Bad Decisions, and GETSOME: Ladies night, which are a series of naughty games for normal people.

GETSOME is a 2-4 'player' non-collectible card game, expandable up to 5-6 players with purchase of the expansion, Bad Decisions, and the deck can be enlarged through purchase of the first booster, Ladies Night. The goal is simple: earn yourself 10 Bed Notches while avoiding the consequences of your actions such as lost turns, Clingy Exes, STDs, and babies. The dialogue is both horrible and hilarious. Play is quick as everyone has the ability to play cards on another person's turn. A player will have seven cards in their hand and can GETSOME, become PREGGOS, gain a Status Effect, heal a Status Effect, or block a player from a GETSOME or PREGGOS encounter. Don't forget to call in your Wingman when the time is right.

The heart of the game is the story telling, where you'll create the details of your deeds and how you overcame difficult challenges presented by your so-called friends in pursuit of your next conquest. Your evening will be filled with buddies, belly laughs, and blushing cheeks of the newly acquainted.

The heart of the replayability is in the multifunction design of many of the cards to perform different tasks depending on your needs. There are an unlimited number of ways for rounds to play out. There's an amazing breadth of crazy things you'll hear yourself say over the course of the night, and a card for just about every occasion. Once you GETSOME, you're definitely going to want to GETSOME again.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Simulation, Storytelling

name: Der verdrehte Sprach-Zoo
description:
The monkey is loose at the zoo! When the zoo closes in the evening, the cheeky monkey jumps down from his tree and steals the zookeeper's key. In no time, he has freed all the animals from their cages, and together, they experience the craziest adventures. What could have happened? No doubt, you can think of many funny stories. Remember them well, because only then you can help the monkey to end the chaos!

Der verdrehte Sprach-Zoo (The Twisted Language Zoo) is played in two phases. During the game, players take turns drawing two tokens: one animal, and one object. The player has to come up with a story of what has happened with that animal and that object. For example, when a player draws "snake" and "balloon", he can say "the snake has found a balloon in a tree, and uses it to fly away".

When there is a story about each animal, the second phase of the game starts. Now, the players take turns remembering the stories. On his turn, a player draws an animal card. He has to remember what object was connected to that animal. The other players may give hints. If the player gives the right answer, he may move the monkey one space on the score track.

The players win together if the monkey reaches the last space of the score track (the tree). If they run out of cards before the monkey reaches that last space, they lose together.

The game comes with a mechanized gameboard for hiding and revealing the answers, and several rules variants.

name: Wackelbett
description:
English summary:
Stack cards for the princess to sleep upon. But beware the wobbling bed. Don't let the princess fall out of bed.

Description from the publisher (German):
Enni, die kleine Erbsenprinzessin, kann wieder einmal nicht richtig einschlafen. Liegt etwa eine Erbse unter ihrem Prinzessinnenbett? Vielleicht kann Enni besser schlafen, wenn sie noch ein paar Matratzen, Daunendecken und Kissen in ihrem Bett übereinander stapelt.
Aber aufgepasst, dass die kleine Erbsenprinzessin bei der ganzen Stapelei nicht aus dem Bett fällt.
Ein märchenhaftes Geschicklichkeitsspiel.

Spiel in der Dose mit Wackel-Effekt
plus Märchen zum Vorlesen

name: Mindstein
description:
In Mindstein, each player takes a turn as the reader, reading a card with five multiple choice questions. Where Mindstein differs from a run-of-the-mill trivia game is that each multiple choice question has three answers corresponding to three different letters; the correct answers for each question spell a five letter word that players compete to be the first to yell out.

If you get the five letter word first, you get to draw a letter from the draw pile; first to spell "S-M-A-R-T" wins!

name: Plantmanager: Build Your Own Plant
description:
From the Back of the Box:
Build Your Own Plant is the result of a unique collaboration between the branch FHI Industrial Automation and the developer and publisher of games; 999 Games. The game is designed and produced for the exhibition HET Instrument 2010.

Players are managers whom get a very clear assignment. Automate and improve and old rundown factory and turn it into a profit generating money machine. Processes are improved to obtain better quality, a higher efficiency, lower costs ans HSE needs to be improved to meet the necessary standards.

Improving your plant alone isn't quite enough in this game. Buying resources and selling goods is an integral part of the game and the way profitable companies operate. The simulated markets emphasise the need to buy and sell wisely.

The players are experienced Plantmanagers hired by the owner of a plant in need of modernisation. They have to upgrade the machines with products and services from the FHI members to improve the quality and quantity of the plant's output. To do so, resources are bought, processed and the final products are sold on the market.

Each round players select actions by putting they playing pieces on action spaces. For each action they play an Event card, Purchase resources, takes improvement cards, gets the HSE bonus, sells goods, pays OPEX, pays maintenance and pays taxes.

At the end of five years the managers are judged on their performance. The most valuable production plant with the most capital scores the most points.

name: OrkoMondo
description: A relatively simple, tile-placing strategy game in which players choose an army to portray (Orc, Elf, Human, Dwarf). After two dice are rolled, players can place units of their army on a small 6X6 board according to the coordinates on the dice. Playing units in this manner costs "Shield Points" (which go into a kitty obtained by the player who deploys all his units first) and despite the light theme of combat between units, the game is actually won by the player who has the most shield points at the end (thus being the most resourceful). OrkoMondo is part of KidultGames' series of free, downloadable games.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: Bus Depot Diner
description:
From the publisher:

You operate the DEPOT DINER together. When a Bus pulls up and the hungry passengers pile out with only 30 minutes to eat, you have to work as a team to see that they get fed and leave happy. The passengers belly up to the Counter with Orders... The Servers scurry out of the kitchen with food, the Boss directs the traffic, trying to please everyone.

It's tough when a customer finds a Bug in her Salad or Lipstick on her Coffee Cup. Worse can happen when a Server slips on a Greasy Spot & spills the Soup.

Time slips away, but maybe with an extra coffee and a piece of delicious blueberry pie, we can coax the Driver to stay a few minutes more. Maybe not. Still, you have to love those Big Tips earned for good service and we hope to get many of them.

Quick-paced, original, & challenging. With plenty of clever strategies for Teens & Adults. Especially pleasing is that it can be played by few or many & a variety of ages.

name: Gameshop Adventurers
description:
It will take strengthyness, craftyness and magickyness to be Gameshop Adventurers.

This is a D&D style adventure game for 1 or 2 players.

Needed to play: the deck of 6 cards, 1d20 and 4 eurocubes.

The players work together as a Party of Adventurers to survive their journey and defeat what awaits them in the final room. Each player chooses one Player Card and then which side they wish to use, placing cubes to mark their initial XP and HP.

Each player begins with 2 skills, listed next to their initial XP: STR (Strengthyness) and CRF (Craftyness). All players have a starting STR equal to a D4 and a CRF which will differ depending on which card they chose.
