For both STR and CRF, the die rolls will be as stated until you reach a new XP level where they will increase (ex. The Warrior begins with a STR:D4, when he reaches 2 XP this then changes to STR:D5)

The Sorceress and Wizard can also cast magic spells (their Magickyness). There are two types of spells: those in blue can be cast at any time during an Attack; those in red can be cast during an Attack but the player may not use their STR to help (see Attack below) in the Party Attack number. Only one spell may be cast in an Attack.

Each player also begins the game with a Special Skill or Starting Spell which is listed at the bottom of the Player Card.

Attack: Most rooms have a foe in them to be overcome. Attacking is mandatory unless the Wizard uses his Enchantment Spell (in this case the party moves to the next room and there is no attack but the party receives +1XP for being sneaky).

Each player will roll for their STR value separately and both values are then added together. This is the Party Attack number. One player then rolls for the STR of the foe (as listed in the current room). This is the Foe Attack number. If the Party Attack number is equal to or higher than the Foe Attack number, the players win the attack, slay the foe and proceed to the next room, with each player gaining the Success Bonus as listed. If the Party Attack value is lower, each player takes the amount of HP damage as listed and they then proceed to the next room.

Order of Play: The players will proceed from room to room, in numerical order, until they reach the final room where they will be successful and live to fight another day, thereby winning the game, or they will be soundly and utterly defeated.

This is the 4th in a series of Annual Games Unlimited Holiday Games and is the followup to Gameshop Express (2011), Gameshop Workday (2012) and Gameshop Gladiators (2013)
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Nachtwacht: Monster Battle
description:
A cooperative game in the theme of the Kids' series Night's Watch ("Nachtwacht").

Somebody opened the gates to the underworld. Monsters have free reign. The heroes of the Night's Watch are their to combat them, together.
They patrol through Twilight Town by rolling the "walk die". By being attentive during their patrol (a 1/3 chance roll of the "walk die") they can gather skills (up to 5 skill cards).
When on their patrol they encounter a monster they have to do a skill test. If they pass (roll 1 of the remaining skills required OR use the proper skill card), they hurt the monster. If they give the monster the final blow, the monster is defeated and removed from the board. If they fail, they loose health points (1 of 3). Incapacitated heroes can still help the party with their skill cards.
The Night's Watch wins if the monsters are all removed. However, the monsters win if EITHER all heroes are incapacitated OR no more skills can be learned (a skill card must be drawn but all skill card deck is empty).
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Lure
description:
Welcome to the world of competitive fishing!

Players compete to collect the most points by reeling in fish cards. To catch a fish, players roll their dice to beat the fish's target number, as well as meet any specific requirements on the card. Whoever completes those requirements and is closest to the target catches the fish!

Players secretly bid on how many dice to use before the round starts. Bid less dice to go first, but use more dice to make it easier to catch.

Most points wins after the deck of fish cards runs out!

Will you play aggressively and use fewer dice? Or, will you count on your opponents to be too risky? Let's fish!

—description from the publisher

name: Chapayev
description:
Chapayev is a dexterity game originating in the former USSR that is played upon a checkers board. The game is a unique cross between checkers and billiards.

The aim of the game is to advance your row of checkers to the opposite side of the board by winning rounds. Rounds are won by knocking all your opponent's checkers off the board. Within a round, players alternate turns flicking checkers. If you succeed at removing a checker from the opposing team and keep your pieces on the board, you may flick again. When all the opponent's checkers are removed, you win the round and advance your line one row. If you win the round without losing any of your checkers, advance two rows. The army to reach the opposite side of the checkerboard wins!

See also: Chaos Tactics

name: Cranium: Édition Québécoise
description:
Cranium bills itself as the "whole-brain" game. It borrows from a range of party and parlour games, including charades, Pictionary, trivia, and the like.

Cranium Édition Québécoise is packed with quintessentially Québécoise content (written in French). Do you think you can hum "When you're in love?" Or, carve a poutine?
categories: Party Game, Puzzle, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing, Team-Based Game

name: Ranka
description:
Ranka is subtitled "Easy Go" and the gameplay lives up to that description. The game takes place on a hexagonal game board divided into triangles, and players alternate turns placing one triangular piece of their color on the board. If you completely surround an opponent's piece or pieces with pieces of your own (or with a combination of pieces and the edge of the board), you capture the opponent's pieces and remove them from play. Players cannot immediately recreate a board position by playing into a space from which they were just captured.

Ranka also includes five double-sided wall/meal pieces, and if you play the game with them, players take turns placing them on the board before the game begins. If you completely surround a meal or wall piece — or surround a meal or wall in addition to opposing pieces — you capture all of the surrounded pieces. You can also use a wall as if it were a piece of your own color in order to capture an opponent's piece.

When using walls or meals, a player can win by either capturing five opposing pieces or capturing three wall/meal pieces.

The game board in Ranka is double-sided, with one playing area being smaller than the other.

name: Noisy Persons Card Game
description:
From the publisher's website:

Noisy Person Cards is a party game designed to help you develop new character voices.

Using card matching mechanics inspired by games like Apples to Apples and Utter Nonsense, NPC challenges you to lend a voice to potential thousands of character combinations.

NPC is best when played with 3 or more people. Games can last from 10 minutes, to 2 hours, depending on how long you want to play. The print and play set is ok for folks aged 15+, and becomes ok for all ages when you remove the cards marked with a lil’ skull icon.

Players take turns speaking a selected phrase in the voice of a character chosen by the round's judge, who then decides who performed the best voice for the round. Both the judge and the speakers have ways to attach additional descriptors to the current character, Upping the Ante of difficulty, hilarity, and reward for the round.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Acting, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Diamond Checkers
description:
Diamond Checkers is played on a nine by nine grid of checkered squares. The game is played on the light colored squares, of which there are forty-one, including all four corners. The squares on two opposite corners of the board are marked with a diamond shape and are called the Diamond King squares. Each player has one of these corners of the board closest to him or her. The next two light squares following the edges of the board to left and right are marked with rings and are called the King Squares. Each player begins with twelve stackable checker pieces, each with its crown side facing down, on the nine closest light squares and on the middle three squares of the next row closest to the center of the board.

Players take turns moving their pieces with the goal of eliminating their opponent from the board. The ordinary pieces may move to one adjacent square vertically towards the opponent, or horizontally to the left or right. Upon arriving on any of the opponent's King squares, a piece is turned over to become a King, and may now also move back towards his own side of the board. Upon arriving on the opponent's Diamond King square, a piece has another stacked upon it with its crown side up and becomes a Diamond King. Such a piece may move in any direction to an adjacent square, including diagonally.

Pieces are removed from the board as in Checkers, by jumping over them to an empty adjacent square. Pieces may capture in any direction in which they normally move. Jumps may be continued as long as there is opportunity to capture more pieces in a single move. Capture is compulsory, but a player is not required to inform his opponent of a missed opportunity. Players with choices of more than one capture may choose which to take.

The first player to remove all of his opponent's pieces wins the game.

name: Fette Kühe
description:
The game board is a square grid showing a meadow which is enclosed by stables, a river and some trees. The goal of the game is to have the fattest cows (i.e., the cows who ate the most grass, in the form of green plastic chips).

There are eighteen event chips showing different weather conditions. Sunny weather means the cows are moving around eating grass. Lightning kills all cows standing in the water or under a tree. Cows caught in the rain (i.e. are not in the stables or under a tree) catch a cold and cannot eat in the next turn. If there is dry wind (after a sunny turn), new grass grows. Wind after rain also damages the cattle's health.

The game has a push your luck element - which locations are safest while offering good grazing grounds? The stables are safe, but the cows don't get fat.

When all eighteen events have been played, the player with most grass chips is the winner.

name: Bioscopy
description:
The object of Bioscopy is to be the first player or team to score 20 points in each of the 4 categories of trivia (Who, What, When, and Where).

Each player or team puts their playing marker at the center of the board, and their 4 scoring markers on the 0 at the start of each of the 4 scoring scrolls. Players take turns rolling a six-sided die to determine how far you may move on the board, moving in any direction they choose (but they may not visit the same space twice in a turn). The spaces on the board are color coded to each of the 4 categories of questions, and are marked with a number (10, 7, 4, and 1) that corresponds to the difficulty of the clue. Each card has 4 clues on it, descending in value (10, 7, 4, and 1). Players may hear the clues in descending value until they reach the minimum value indicated on their space on the board -- if they can successfully answer at a higher point clue value, they will receive the higher points.

An alternate form of scoring is based on stealing points from the opponents by landing on a space on the board without a number. When this happens, the player competes head-to-head with the person that has scored the most points on that category's scoring scroll.

name: The One World
description:
Subtitled A Strategic Game of the Aztecs 1426-1501.

Internecine Aztec warfare among the Tepanscanpan, Acolhuacan, Tlahuican, Chalco, Tlateputzco and Mexica tribes.

name: Madcap Monkey Business
description:
From the box:

There's fast-paced fun as players race around a zany zoo trying to take photos of five animals. First player to collect all five wins. Sounds easy enough, right? But somehow the animals always seem to be where you aren't...mainly, because the other players are trying to ruin your chances by moving the animals from cage to cage.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Quick Count
description: A furious scramble to circle the numbers from 60 down to 1 on a pad of paper. The catch? Only 1 pencil! While one player searches for numbers, the next player rolls a die continually. As soon as he rolls Quick Count! he grabs the pencil and begins searching for his numbers as the next person rolls the die.

name: Duo
description:
Colors and numbers in a duel of dice. Two players. Two strategies. Two chances!

Roll the dice, observe the colors and select the numbers for getting the best result.

Duo. A lucky duel and reasoning

name: Powersled Circuit
description: A racing game with card-based movement, some combative elements and a high degree of intermixed luck and skill to succeed.
categories: Card Game, Miniatures, Racing, Science Fiction

name: Input
description:
You have to build numbers out of cards. On each card there is pattern you have to build. You have to use stones in different shapes for this. You need 5 stones for each card.

Ages 10 and up.

name: Con-Tra '50
description:
Versus 50 - an abstract board game in which players try to reduce their opponent's pieces to below a total value of 50. The board is a 12x12 checkerboard with some squares marked as barriers which cannot be crossed. The player's pieces are marked with numbers from 3 to 24 and with orthogonal or diagonal crosses, which indicate the direction they may move.

After putting their pieces on the designated starting places, players move them any distance as allowed and try to strike opponents pieces off by landing. This is only allowed if the attacking piece has a higher value, but not allowed though if the defending piece is a divisor. So 12 could hit 10, but not 3. When their total value drops below 50, that player loses.

name: Skedaddle!
description:
Description from back of box:

"Welcome to Colditz Castle, the Escape-Proof Fortress Prison. You have persisted in escaping from other camps, from HERE there is no escape! You are surrounded by sheer cliffs and razor sharp barbed wire. Sentries with tracking dogs patrol constantly. Alarm systems are monitored continuously. Counts will be taken, day and night! Both you and your quarters will be searched regularly without warning. Escape activities WILL NOT BE TOLERATED! Any such behavior is foolhardy. Solitary sentences will be issued swiftly and will be SEVERE!! From here THERE IS NO ESCAPE!!! Enjoy your stay. Dis...missed."

The gauntlet has been thrown down . . . can you escape???
Or will the Castle remain Escape-Proof?

Players take the rolls of either escape officers guiding the escape attempts of groups of allied prisoners, or of the Kommandant of Colditz castle, seeking to prevent escapes, or re-capture those who have made it over the wall.

www.crowhurstgames.com

name: Star Fighter
description: A simulation of spaceship fights. The only things you need are paper, a pencil, the rules and the special screen provided.
mechanics: Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Player Elimination, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Redline Korea
description:
Redline: Korea is a strategic level simulation of possible future conflicts in the Korean peninsula. One player or team is the Communist North Koreans and their allies, the other operates the United Nations or "UN" (South Korea, the United States, France, the United Kingdom, Russia, and Japan)."

The 11" x 17" color map "portrays the Korean peninsula and adjoining areas of China" at 33 km per hex. The standard game has 8 weekly turns with numerous options for both sides.

The two-sided die-cut counter sheet includes:

40 Light Gray North Koreans
5 Yellow Chinese
2 Brown Russian
2 Red UK
2 Purple French
4 White Japanese
25 Olive US
40 South Korean

The magazine includes a map and rules for an Ancients scenario: Munda, 17 Mar, 45 BC
publishers: Game Publications Group, One Small Step

name: The Doonesbury Game
description:
This is a game based on Gary Trudeau's classic political comic strip, Doonesbury. Trudeau did all the art for the game.

This is not a trivia game based on the series, though it is a "word-relation/matching" type game that would best cater to a crowd with at least a grasp of 1960s-1980s culture [pop, political, etc.]. The board is divided into 4 types of spaces relating to game cards [Brainstorm, Flashback, Public Opinion, and Soundbites], 1 set of "Doonesbury Card" spaces; and 6 special spaces [White House, Walden Commune, Mr. Butts Land of Immortality, Alice & Elmont's Shelter, and Duke's Casino].

name: Assault Across the Suez
description:
Covers the climatic battle of the Turkish 25th and 10th divisions epic bid to capture and destroy a portion of the Suez Canal in February, 1915. The day long battle is covered at the tactical level, platoons and companies, individual ships and aircraft. Several scenarios include the historical site and non-historical. Over 270 counters, one 11 x17" map depicting a section of the canal.

Units include MGs, naval, air, leaders, morale, explosives, artillery and more. The game length is 10 turns, including night.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War I

name: Space Shuttle 101
description:
"Command actual missions into outer space for the benefit of mankind."

"Welcome crew members, to the Space Shuttle Program. You are about to command the Space Shuttle on missions to Earth orbit and beyond. The object of the missions is to use the benefits of space to help people on Earth - to improve the quality of life for all mankind. The challenge is great and the vehicle is worthy, but it is up to you to decide how the missions can best be completed, handle emergencies as they arise, and manage your supplies - propellant and consumables - during the voyage. The propellant provides the power for your vehicle, the consumables are the food, water, and oxygen for the crew members. The more missions you complete and the more difficult they are, the more points you will accumulate. Your crew ranking can advance from Payload Specialist to Mission Specialist, Pilot, and finally Commander."

The object of the game is to score points by completing missions in space with varying degrees of difficulty. The player who completes missions as quickly as possible and uses as few supplies as possible will score highest. The player with the most points when any player completes five missions is the winner.

name: Toxic Crusaders Card Game
description:
Players battle Good Guy and Bad Guy cards for the right to clean up Tromaville.

Mini-cards are dealt in a 'Memory' fashion. Numbered cards are flipped over, with the winner attempting to make matches from the memory board. The player with the most matches wins the game.

Box Contents: 18 Good Guy & Bad Guy cards, 36 Toxic Clean-Up Time mini cards, 1 card tray, 1 spinner, and instructions.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Environmental, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Super Tomcat
description:
This is a Japanese original expansion for Air War: Modern Tactical Air Combat published by Hobby Japan.

This kit add 52 aircraft, 6 missiles, some optional rules and scenarios.
Example Mitsubishi F-1, Northrop F-20, Tu-128 Fiddler, F-14D Super Tomcat, Me-163 Komet etc.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame, World War II

name: Mirror Mania
description:
Which Reflection Goes Which Direction? You Make the Connection!

At the start of the game, a random maze of Mirror Blocks is set up on the board. Players use their spatial relations skills to try to predict various paths through the maze in an attempt to find the highest-scoring path.

In the simplest version of the game, the player is allowed to see the arrows on top of the Mirror Blocks to find scoring paths that lead to Target Pegs. The instructions also include optional rules to increase the difficulty of game-play for more expert players. Players can move or rotate a Mirror Block to increase their score or to try to block their opponent.

The player places the View Cube at the beginning of a selected path. They then place their finger on the Target Peg that they think is at the end of the path. The player looks down into the View Cube. If the predicted Peg is seen, the player scores by adding the values of the Mirror Blocks and the Target Peg to their existing score. If the selected Target Peg is not correct, the player scores nothing…

Mirror Mania is a fun and relatively quick-playing game, and the Day-Glo® hot pink, electric yellow, and fire orange Mirror Cubes are a retro blast!

name: Flip Your Lid
description: Players must propel a (very small) hat up a thin pole to flip the rim of a much larger hat which effectively forms the roof of a gazebo-like structure, with the four thin poles serving as corner posts. A spinner at the center of the structure dictates action and scores are kept using the sliding indicators located adjacent to each player.

name: Air War Games: Wargaming Aerial Warfare 1914-1975
description:
"Fighting Air Battles With Model Aircraft."

Covers many aspects of wargaming air combat. Chapters cover the models themselves, methods of using model aircraft in war games, and a "strategical/tactical" air war game without models. Time periods covered include pre-1914, World War I, and World War II. The book also covers incorporating model aircraft into land and sea war games. There is also a chapter devoted specifically to helicopters in war games.

144 pages. Photos and illustrations.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I, World War II
publishers: Stanley Paul & Co Ltd, The History of Wargaming Project

name: Squirt
description:
There are 3 separate games that can be played.
Squirt Game (2 players and the squnk, "Squirt"):
Place path cards to lead Squirt (a skunk) away from your property and toward your opponent's.

My Dog Roscoe (3 or 4 players):
Place path cards to lead Roscoe onto your property.

Squirt and Roscoe (3 or 4 players):
Place path cards to lead Squirt onto opponent's property and Roscoe onto your property.

name: Kick-It
description:
"The fast game for long flanks, ideal passing and tactical moves."

Kick-it is a tactical soccer game that challenges the head and not the legs. The team in possession of the ball has 2 movement points available, while the opposing team without the ball has 3 move points available. By jumping straight over the opposing player, the ball can be taken away at any time.
To complete the move, the ball is passed over any number of your own players - preferably, of course, directly into the goal.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Movement Points, Pattern Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Cien Cañones por Banda
description:
Cien Cañones por Banda is a set of rules that allows to simulate fast but elegantly any naval battle of the 1750-1830 period. The battles range from the Napoleonic wars to the battles of South American independence to the American Revolution. The ships represented, rated for crew, crew morale, firepower, speed and hull, range from the nimble frigates to the Victory, Nelson's flagship at Trafalgar to the biggest sail and wood ship-of-the-line ever built, the 130-gun, 4-decker Santísima Trinidad, also known as "The Escorial of the Seas". the admirals represented include Gravina, Nelson or Villeneuve.

In this first installment of Cien Cañones por Banda there are ships, scenario rules and leaders to simulate the following battles:

Cape St. Vincent 1797 "The Prelude"
Finisterre 1805: "Brothers in Arms"
Trafalgar 1805: The Abyss of an Empire
Trafalgar 1805: "The Gravina Touch" (hypothetical scenario)
categories: American Revolutionary War, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame
publishers: Ludopress, Revistas Profesionales S.L., Soldados y Estrategia

name: Airborne Stand!: The Battle for the Marcus Heim Causeway
description: An Advanced Squad Leader compatible scenario and map pack depicting the actions around the area in Normandy that would later become known as "The Marcus Heim Causeway". Contains 12 small-action scenarios and a large-hex 25"x35" color map.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Die Maus im Nacken
description: The object of the game is to score points by moving your set of elephants around the track and either getting them home or onto the couches that surround the track.

name: Tummy Ache Junk Food Game
description:
The object of the game is to feed "Tommy Tummy Ache" his favorite Junk food without giving him a "Tummy Ache"
The players take turns (according to a spinner, not alternating), placing food on the mouth of the cardboard Tommy Tummy Ache character. If the food is placed improperly, the food will all spill and the player must use one of their tummy ache pills to make him better. This continues until all but one player has used up both their tummy ache pills.

name: Dixit: The Dictionary Game
description:
From instructions: Dixit - The Dictionary Game is a unique, fast pacing, thought provoking word game for 2-4 players involving crossword style word making with an original scoring system that enables the players themselves to decide where and how a word score may be multiplied. No player possesses letters, the choice depends on the throw of dice every time.
There's a Collins Minigem Dictionary to act as a referee and add ingenious twists to play.
The winner is the player scoring the most points at the end of play by clever word making and shrewd usage of the changing possibilities offered by the playing circuit. Strategy and good word searching together make a winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement
publishers: Air Ouest Médias, Croner, Les cheminées René Brisach, Waddingtons

name: Pomarańczowa Rewolucja
description: "Pomarañczowa rewolucja" (Orange revolution) is the first attempt to portray the events that took place in Ukraine in November and December 2004, and possible alternate ways the conflict could have developed. The players can take the roles of supporters of the "orange" opposition of Wiktor Juschtschenko, or "the blues" - government side of Wiktor Janukowytsch. In a 4 player game each player plays one of the 2 orange or blue factions, with players forming 2 teams.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Professor Noggin's Wonders of Science
description:
Professor Noggin takes Science out of the classroom and into this entertaining trivia game. See what you know, and learn surprising new facts as you go. Wonders of Science will create science wonderment for all who play.

Card.topics.include:
Birds & Fish
Cells
Compass
Earth
Energy
Electricity
Environment
Famous Scientists
Force
Gases
General Topic Card
Gravity
Invertebrates
Light & Color
Liquids & Solids
Machines
Magnets
Mammals
Mass & Weight
Microscopes
Motion
Natural Disasters
Photosynthesis
Plant Life
Reflection
Sound
Temperature
Time
Water
Weather
publishers: Éditions Gladius International, Inc., KENSHO Kft., Outset Media

name: Play Pirates
description:
Another game of the 4 square cardboard games from Scandecor (Play Racing, Play Olympic, Play Western, Play Pirates).

Before the game starts, several land pieces must be laid on the large gameboard, so you'll get a board with some islands and some fortified harbors.

Each player choses one home harbor, where his 4 ships start. Movement is done by dice roll, but it can be modified by some of the included cards.

12 of these cards indicate, where a treasure is located.
The game ends, when all 12 treasures are found.

As with all games of the series, the board is illustrated with funny comics.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Zeon
description: Abstract strategy game created for the "Learn & Play a New Game" tournament held during FirenzeGioca (="FlorencePlays") 2004
categories: Abstract Strategy, Print & Play, Territory Building

name: Trade Deadline Hockey
description:
From the manufacturer's website:

Object: Your job is to out-maneuver your opponents and build a fantasy championship roster of 15 players while staying under the salary cap.

In TRADE DEADLINE HOCKEY The Board Game, the trading is fantasy but the salary cap is real. Here is your chance to get behind-the-scenes of pro hockey as a General Manager. Spots on the on-ice game board will initiate trades while “Penalty” and “Action” cards drive play. The Deadline Scorekeeper will track your progress while the action builds to a flurry of trading as you approach the end of the game and, possibly, a shootout.

name: The Action Man Game
description:
From the Rules: You command an Action Man force of 19 units. You objective is to put all the opposing forces out of action by capturing all their surviving units and commanders.

The Action Man Game is a simple roll and move game, taking appropriate actions according to the squares landed on. When opposing force commanders land on the same square they must "battle it out" using the special wooden battle dice provided.

name: Scooby-Doo! DVD Board Game
description: Help Scooby and his friends solve their next mystery. Go to the crime lab, race to the mystery mansion and the freaky forest. Watch for the secret passageways and be the first player to collect 3 clues , track down the villain and win.

name: The Bowl Game
description:
Due to its simple rules and ease of playing, "The Bowl Game" is a perfect party game for mixed groups of non-gamers.

Much like the parlor game "Celebrity", players are broken into teams and given slips of paper. Each player writes down a set number (usually 10) of 'things' on slips of paper. These 'answers' are folded up, placed into a bowl (or hat or cup, whatever you have handy), and the game begins. Each player is given 1 minute to draw slips of paper, one at a time, and try to get their teammates to guess the answer. Much like Taboo, no charades (hand gestures) may be used, and no rhyming or "starts with" is allowed.

The "things" written can be anything that makes sense, and can be conveyed. Expressions, quotes, famous people, things, etc. As long as it's not nonsense, it's appropriate.

When the timer goes off, the team gets one, and only one guess, as to what the last answer was. The teammates must confer, and come up with a guess. Usually there's a time limit to this. If it's guessed correctly, it's a point, otherwise it's tossed back in the bowl.

The bowl is then passed clockwise, and the next person gets a turn.

Continue until the bowl is empty.

name: Criminal Mouse
description:
Criminal Mouse is an Italian game (written in part by prisoners) about being in prison in Italy. Players are incarcerated rats living their daily lives. Although an educational game, it is not recommended for children under 14 years.

Winner of "Archimedes 2004" special mention for its high social value.

name: Keys to the Kingdom
description: Keys to the Kingdom is a boardgame that attempts to simulate the Christian life. The players roll the dice and move through 5 concentric bands. In order to progress, one must collect key cards, which represent faith, truth, and humility. Once all of these are collected, it is possible to move into the inner rings. However, once you have reached the inner rings, it is possible to help those who are stuck. You may give up your turn, in order to give one of your key cards to someone in need. For this kind deed, you receive a crown card. There are also a number of obstacles, including pride, doubt, deception, and the sins of flesh. Along the way, one may also need to draw a Scripture card. These include a Bible verse that you need to memorize before its your turn again in order to proceed. The game ends once a player reaches the center or when a timer goes off (the rapture option). The winner is the player with the most crown cards. Thus, victory goes to the player who helped the most other players.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Boomtown: The Building of a City
description: An economic board game in which players try to make the most money and build a successful city. Players can buy land, build businesses, make money and then wreck havoc on the other players with some crime, fire, lawsuits or taxation. Features both basic and advanced rules. Will also have a stock market expansion.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Draumaeyjan
description:
Draumaeyjan (The Dream Island), subtitled A self-help game for an excited nation, is a game where the player decides what kind of industry he wants to build in Iceland, be it heavy industry, knowledge-based industry, tourist industry or agricultural/fishery.

Industries are paid for by resources gained from already built industries (much like in Catan) and monuments can be built after the players have built the pre-required industries. Various cards can be bought or are handed out according to the roll of the dice. These cards can then be used to further ones game or against other players.

name: Klappe auf!
description:
In this game the players try to recognize objects/things/animals on images that are hidden and only revealed step by step (max. 8 steps).
Each time a flap uncovers another part of the image, the players may make a guess. Each player has 3 "guess cards" of which he has to give one to the host. A round ends when either all players have a correct guess or all players have used up their "guess cards".
The sooner a player guesses the image correctly the more points he will be awarded. The points are used tho move the player's pawn along a track. The first one to reach the and is the winner.

name: Shopping
description: Downwards goes the one lift, upwards the second one. In the new warehouse you can see marvelous things to buy. The skillful user of the lift will soon have full shopping bags first. The player who returns to the entrance hall with full bags first wins the game.

name: Matches
description:
Matches is an easy game that will exercise your memory and deduction, as well as press your luck. It is enjoyable for children and adults, and also plays well with mixed groups of both.

Rules are available on the Piecepack Wiki.

Game System

Piecepack Game System

name: Mingle
description:
Mingle - Dice of Diction
Dice of Diction is the slogan that appears on the box top of this made-in-Malaysia letter-dice game.

The game comes with 8 letter-dice, each letter having its own point-score indicated next to it. There is also a 3-minute sand-timer and a pad of scoring diagrams for players to use.

Two games may be played with this set (and one of these two games may itself be played in two ways).

Mingle-Crossword makes use of the scoring diagram - each player gets one sheet of score pad with a 17 X 17 square grid on it (and space for writing down the scores). Each turn, the 8 dice are cast and the timer started. Players then have until the timer runs out to form a word using two or more of the eight letters showing. This first word must cover the centre square. Play continues, with each player forming words that intersect crossword-style with existing words on their own diagram. The diagram contains shaded squares that when used result in double or quadruple letter scores or double or quadruple word scores. After a fixed number of words (say 25), players total up their scores and the highest score wins.

Mingle-Listing is simply a game of anagramming letters that come up on the eight dice when thrown. The first way to play is simply to throw the dice, set the timer going and for each player to list out as many words as he/she can. The player who lists the most words, wins. The second way of playing is to have players take turns to state a new word that can be formed from the dice. When a player cannot state a new word, he/she loses and drops out. The remaining players cast the dice again and play continues until only one player remains.

This game is probably no longer in print as it is not mentioned in SPM's current website.

name: Crypt
description:
Crypt: Monster and magic in a dungeon you create!

In Crypt, players take on the role of evil wizards who control competing monster forces, which move about in a dungeon that constantly grows. Each turn, a player may take one of three actions: lay a tile which expands the dungeon, move a monster in his force, or cast a magic spell. The objective is to move your monsters into enemy Crypts.

Monsters begin the game in their home Crypt. Each has a strength and movement rating. Strong monsters are slow, weak ones fast. Which will you play early and which will you save for later? Which will you use to defend, and which will seek entry into enemy Crypts?

Dungeon tiles are used to build the dungeon. Lay them carefully to block monsters from entering your Crypt, and make entryways into enemy Crypts.

Spell tiles keep things interesting. Poisons lower abilities; Potions raise them. A Reaper could mean instant death, while a Seraph returns you safely to your Crypt. Traps stop movement, while a Ghost lets you walk through walls. Or use Transporters to pop up in unexpected places. Suffering under an enemy spell? Remove it with a Zapper.

Crypt is an easily-learned, quick-playing tile-laying game suitable for 2-4 players Ages 8 and up. It is available as a self-published print-and-play game.

name: Loaded Questions: Political Party
description:
In this latest edition of the Loaded Questions line of games, it’s not a matter of how much you know about politics, but how well you know your fellow players. However serious or silly your answers, they are never right or wrong. Players write down answers to quasi-political questions and the judge for that round must try to match the answers to each player.

Sample Questions:
“Who would make a terrible First Lady?”
“If the US legalized cloning, who would you clone first?”
"What would you not expect to find in the Oval Office?"

name: Re
description:
Re is a popular Chess variant.

The game is played on a 5x5 board. When the game starts, the board is empty. Each player starts with 10 player pieces: One king, one queen, two rooks, two knights, two bishops, and two pawns.

On your turn, you can do one of the following three things:


Put one of your pieces (not yet put into play) on an empty square on the board.
Make a capture with one of your pieces on the board.
Pass. Note: This may only be done when you have put all your pieces on the board.


When both players pass consecutively or when all pieces of a player have been taken, the game ends. Each player earns points for their remaining pieces on the board: 3 points for each king or queen, two points for each rook, knight, or bishop, and one point for each pawn. Each player counts the total number of points for the pieces they have taken, and the player with the largest number of points wins the game (the score is the difference between the point totals).

Originally published as Spielbox Edition No.8 in Spielbox issue 2/1994.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: John Deere Family Farm Board Game
description: Create and manage your own successful farm with the John Deere Family Farm Board Game. You’ll decide which crops to plant, which equipment to invest in, how much fuel to buy, how to seed/harvest your land and when to buy more land. Flood, insects, equipment, subsidies and much more will play a role as you make decisions that will determine the ultimate success of the farm. The player with the most assets at the end of the game is the winner. Includes large quad-fold game board, 24 land parcels, 6 hat pawns, 6 tractor pawns, 1 silo pawn, card, play money and instructions.

name: Op en neer
description:
Op en neer (Up and down) is a childrens game. The purpose in the game is to try and finish the shopping tour in the department store as the first one.

In order to achieve this you need your player to get in and out of the elevator at the right floors for you to pick up the items on your shopping list. The elevator moves up or down depending on the spinning of an arrow. The player who spun the arrow may decide which number of floors the elevator will move (always to possibillities) and in which direction (up or down). On the gameboard are two elevators, connected by a small rope and when one elevator goes up, the other one will go down, and vice versa.

name: Penneech
description: This game is played with a standard deck of cards. In this trick-taking game the trump is changed after every trick. Player score points for winning the majority of the tricks, for taking face cards, and for turning up a face card for trump.

name: Charades
description: This games comes with the word cards, a spinner to decide which "version" of the game you will play that round, and score sliders. It comes in a one-piece (except for the cards) blue clamshell in a box. You pick a card and spin the two-hole spinner -- one hole indicates whether you are using "talking only" of if you are performing charades. and the opposite hole, if you land on the words version, will tell you how many words you are allowed to use (in which case your team is allowed "one minute" to guess after you finish saying the 6 - 9 words allowed, but the game does not come with a timer). Winning requires 10 rounds.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Puzzle, Word Game

name: Alchemy
description:
A fast two-player abstract strategy stacking game with a theme and a twist

(Designer’s note: Alchemy was created as a simple game to thank the gamer community and fans of Symbol. Alchemy is played with one player’s basic set of pieces from Symbol, and thus provides a clever way to determine first player for a game of Symbol or can be played as a separate stand alone game for those who want a quick match that is easy to learn, almost impossible to solve, fun, and mathematically very interesting; though a new and unique game, Alchemy shares some ideas and mechanics with other stacking strategy games and members of the NIM family of games.)

The players represent dueling alchemists trying to make chemical reactions with the Aristotelian elements (earth, water, air, fire), and a fifth, unstable element of destruction. Alchemists want to create gold, but they never could figure out how to create gold, so instead the players are fighting over a single gold coin by alternating turns making new combinations of elements. When on a player’s turn no new combinations are possible, that player loses the round. The first player to win two rounds in a row wins the game.

name: Bamzaai
description:
A game of deduction, in which one has to try to figure out how many colored rods the other player holds in his/her hand. the player deducting best wins the game.

Each player plays with 3 rods, the boardgame is set to indicate the total number of rods in play at any given moment (eg. at start of the game with 3 players, the indicator is set at 9). Then players choose to hold 0,1,2 or 3 rods in one hand and shows his/her closed fist on the table top, hiding the rods in the hand.
Then each players takes his/her colored indicator and places it next to the indicator equalling (guess!) the number of rods in all players' fists. this process is done for all players, but one can not choose a number already chosen.
The person guessing correctly can place one of his/her colored rods in the boardgames foreseen spaces, the total number of rods indicator on the boardgame is then changed to one less (rod in play).
Should nobody have guessed the total amount of rods, the round is played over again.
First player to get rid of all 3 of his colored rods wins the game.

PS : 'Bamzaai' is deducted from the dutch verb 'Bamzaaien' and means 'deciding based on guessing a number in ones fist' (these can be beads, matches, peanuts, ...)

name: It's Anybody's Guess
description:
This great new "fill-in-the-blank" trivia game will keep everybody guessing. Anybody can win because no trivia knowledge is necessary to score points. Players write down answers to questions they think are true or what they think other players will think are true. The "card reader" then reads all the answers aloud, including the correct answer. Players must guess which answer is correct or which they think most players believe to be correct. You can score points with both right and wrong answers. So, if you can bluff your friends and accumulate the most points, you'll be the big winner.

Components:

a box of Trivia Question Cards,
a Score Pad,
An Answer Pad,

name: FlashWordz
description:
Players in FlashWordz need to create words quickly by mooching letter cards from one of their opponents and combining the letters with cards from their own hand.

At the start of the game, each player receives six double-sided letter cards from the 100-card deck and places the cards on their rack. On a turn, a non-active player starts the timer, then the active player races to create a word using at least one of the letters facing him on his rack and at least one letter facing out from an opponent. Words must be at least four letters long, and a player cannot use letters from more than one opponent.

If a player calls out a word before time expires (and the word is valid), then the player scores the letter cards used in the word, leaving those particular letters face up. If a player uses all six letters in his rack or an opponent's rack, then he takes another turn (after players refill their racks to six cards). If a player fails to call out a word, the first non-active player to grab the "flash round" token from the center of the table creates a word and scores it.

When the card deck runs out and no one can create any more words, the game ends. Players sum the letters they used in words (with wild cards being worth zero points), then subtract the point value for letters that remain in their racks. The player with the highest score wins.
publishers: Knightweaver Games, U.S. Games Systems, Inc.

name: Gelini Catch Me!
description:
No sooner won, than ready to escape...

The cheeky Gelinis are not easy to get a hold of! You only barely manage to grab them before they are snatched away again. The winner is the player at the end of the game with the most Gelinis in his collection.

Contents...
45 Gelini cards
9 Gelini figures
Rule book.

In this game players attempt to catch as many of the nine Gelinis as they can. All the Gelinis (small plastic bears) start in the middle of the table. Each turn a player can play a coloured card to take to appropriate Gelini (bear)and put it in front of them.
But watch out! Your opponents can steal your Gelinis from you. If he plays a card of the colour of Gelini you have he can take it from you, your only hope is to defend by playing yet another card of the same colour to stop him. Only good defense will help you win the game.

name: If Badger was a Bunny
description:
The hare and tortoise are staging a series of races! This an asymmetric 2 player climbing race game using the Decktet system. Even though the players must shed the same amount of cards, the Hare is given much more to use (and is more free to use them) at the start of the game, but the Tortoise will slowly and steadily build up her hand.

The card play like climbing games is in response to the opponent's plays, but it is also constrained because the players must always connect their plays with their developing race tracks. The winner with the best record after four races is the champion badger!

Full rules may be found on wiki.decktet.com

name: Mosaic
description:
A color matching, tile laying game for young children.

Players place tiles with red, blue and yellow triangles. Each side of a placed tile must match the tiles around it. If an area of color is closed off (no longer has any sides where more tiles may be placed) the person who played the last card gets one point per card containing the color.

This game is designed for small children. It helps counting small numbers (2-5) when scoring areas, and up to 30 or 40 when tallying final score. The decision set is small, but there are important decisions to be made.

name: Из грязи в князи
description:
From publisher:

From Rags to Riches (Make carrier in a fairy-tale world!) is a role game based on a comical medieval world. The players occupy varying social levels from servants all the way up to the King. Each player tries to make the best carrier possible. The game process copies that of the Russian card game Durak (or “Fool” http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Durak), but the fun lies in players acting out their roles and interacting with other players.

Players have their own rights and duties that they must perform. For example: the Janitor collects the cards that were beaten, the Hangman punishes those who have wronged, and the King gives orders. If players don’t complete their gaming duties, then they can be punished by having to do certain unpleasant tasks. On top of that, the game contains a certain mode of conduct which, if broken, can cause even the King to become a simple servant.

The expanded version of the game also includes social order cards, the King’s Charity cards and the ability to chronicle each player’s gaming achievements. A number of blank cards also allow players to devise their own characters.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
publishers: Fantasy World, Inc., Hobby World, Igrology

name: Scrabble: Holiday Edition
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Deck the halls with America’s favorite word game.
The Holiday Edition of Scrabble includes classic Scrabble fun with a festive twist allowing players to earn bonus points for words related to everyone’s favorite time of year. Gift Tag cards add holiday cheer as players enhance their scores with directives for all new custom game play. Spell your way to victory with holiday-themed words including all of your favorite things. Can you spell F-A-L-A-L-A?

name: Pirate's Bay
description:
A game for two buccaneers.
After placing the 12 treasure cards (six vertically - including two face-down cards and six horizontally including 2 face-down cards), each player takes his pack of 18 cards buccaneers.
The players draw cards from their packs and play a in turn on the table.
When all cards are played, they look at who is in the majority for each treasure in each row and column.

Players add up the values ​​of their treasures to know how many points they totaled for that round.

name: Monopoly: Ingolstadt
description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements of Ingolstadt, city/home base of 'Audi' in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Tumble Down
description:
User Summary

Tumble down is a game of patience and careful balance, in the mode of Jenga. Players take turn removing blocks from the tower and relocating them onto the top to create a more treacherous play area with each turn.

name: Uno: Burger King Edition
description:
A somewhat streamlined version of Uno, given away as a promotional item in Burger King Kid's Meals. The Deck is only 36 cards. Each suite (green, yellow, blue and red) is comprised of 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 and Draw 2. Finally, there are 4 Wild Cards.

As in regular Uno, the object is to eliminate your hand before your opponents. Because of the reduced card counts, this edition seems to be optimized for 2-player play: the set lacks the traditional skips, reverses and draw 4 wilds of the normal edition.

name: Tell Me a Story: Robot's Mission
description:
Robot characters in a Robot World engineered by Saxton Freymann line up to assemble a science fiction fantasy. Pick some automated animals and a space-aged skyline to start a futuristic story.

The included deck of 36 cards is dealt to the players so that each has six cards. Keep them or trade up to 2 from the remaining deck pile. The winner is first to tell a story with the cards in his or her hand.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Science Fiction

name: Patsch
description:
The quick reaction game! 25 cards with 5 different elements in 5 colors are layed on the table: the fish, the bird, the dog, the house and the car.
Player rolls the 2 dice with animals and colors and who is the quickest the catch the right animal with right color get it!

Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Dice
description:
A fast strategy and tactics dice game for 2–4 players. The game comprises 36 dice than can be placed in a 6×6 grid on a playing board. Each player considers the outer row of six dice which he is facing (his 'home row') and will try that either a) all six dice show the same number, or b) the dice be placed in ascending (1-2-…-6) or descending (6-5-…-1) order. For this, 35 dice are placed in the playing area leaving an empty space, and the 36th die is used as action die: the active player rolls it, and the rolled value can be split into several sub-values (for example: 6 = 3+1+1+1) to perform one or more of several possible actions, such as turning a die, swap files, etc.
DICE provides several options to build the starting dice grid, as well as advanced rules for a longer and more challenging game experience (additional dice moves and a more challenging winning condition).
DICE is available in several colored sets: Natur (36 white dice); Regenbogen (6× 6 dice in each of the colors red, orange, yellow, green, blue, and violet); Devil Dice (black dice with red pips, and the pips are randomly placed on the die faces, making it impossible to predict which value will show after turning a die); and also two- or three-color dice sets.
More colors means a more complicated game and more possible tactical variations, as additional winning conditions can be established (for example, a home row with alternating black and white dice, if a two color DICE set is used).
According to the rules leaflet included with the game, there also exists a set of 121 dice called MARATHON DICE.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Glamour
description:
Players assume the role of fairytale princesses getting ready for the ball - Cinderella, Rapunzel, Snow White and Sleeping Beauty. They move around the board collecting dresses, shoes, accessories and make-up, combining them on their personal "princess board" to create a look. Their looks will earn them "glamour points" if items correspond to the fashion trends defined by the fashion towers.
Players must move they princesses according to dice rolls, and lead towards on of the 4 fashion towers - each of them corresponding to one type of item. The princess collects these items and may wear them, combining them so as to be as fashionable as possible. Cards on top of the towers are kept revealed, and indicate which is the current fashion trend - which also means that when you reach a tower and collect the item, a new one will start a new trend. There are four different possible trends for each of the four item types, and they form four sets of items (each set has it's own shoe, make-up, dress and accessory).
The game is a roll-and-move, with special spaces along the board that may help of hinder the princess and bifurcations to minimize the luck component. When a princess arrives at the Ball, the space in the middle of the board, she compares her fashion items to those on the towers, and get a glamour point for each match (but loses the item on doing so). If she have all items of a set, she gets points for them all, ignoring the fashion trends.
The game ends when the first of the towers run out of items, which means a winning player may speed up the ending. When it happens, the princess with most glamour points wins the game and the heart of prince charming.

name: Memory Challenge: Adventure Time Edition
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Shmowzow! It's the world's most popular matching game - Memory - now with an Adventure Time twist! Turn over the cards to find matches of your favorite characters from Lumpy Space Princess, Marceline and The Lich, to the Ice King. New Item Cards unleash new powers for added game play. The fun will never end!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory

name: Starstead
description:
Starstead, a card-drafting/set-collection card game for 2-3 players, employs a novel card-drafting mechanic that allows players to Explore, Claim and then Settle in star systems of different types and sizes. Once enough of a type have been Settled, players can Utilize each system’s special ability to further their positions, scoring more points and expanding their empire!
Mechanically, players will be collecting sets of System cards and playing them in front of them. A player’s final score is based on the System type of which a player controls the lowest value, so an even balance of development is key. However if a player settles more than a critical value of a System type, he/she can utilize that type’s ability every turn for the rest of the game!

name: Mit Sputnik in den Weltraum
description:
This gorgeous game reeks of mid-20th Century science fiction imagery and optimism. While undated, the rules begin: "According to the latest scientific research, it will be possible at the latest in about 50 years, to voyage to the Moon, to other planets and even to stars much further away."

Underneath the beautiful artwork, it is a roll-and-move game, but with one twist. Up to four players try to move their rocket ships from Earth around the board and home. But another player controls the fearsome Robot, who starts somewhere on a separate network of lines between stars.

The Robot network and player track intersect at various points, and if the Robot can land exactly on top of a rocket, that player is out of the game. If all rocket ships are killed, the Robot player wins.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Racing, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture

name: Triominos Turbo
description:
Why Triominos? Because it's like dominoes, but with 3 sides... So it's not dominoes... It's triominos. Got it?

Why Turbo? This game is against the clock. You have to be quick before time runs out. If that happens, everyone gets punished... including you!

So the other players aren't my friends? In your dreams! Everyone wants to win! You have to act quickly and get rid of all your stones before the others... Without getting distracted by the evil timer!

name: Dein Körper und Du
description:
During this game, you will learn about the human body: the operation of the ear, the causes of muscle pain, the different teeth, ...

The teacher (= tiptoi pen) asks you to choose one of the 14 childrens in her class, they'll ask something and she will explain it. Afterwards, she will give you some excercises to learn about the human body.
F.e. you'll have to find the listed tooth or you have to represent a certain feeling which the other players will have to guess. Each time, you'll be doing other excercises and you'll get 1 or 2 points, depending on how good you did this game. Sometimes you'll be doing these tests by yourself, other things should be done by all players. After a few rounds, the teacher will announce how many points you scored and who won the game!

This game works with the tiptoi-pen and can't be played without it.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Electronic, Medical, Trivia

name: Bad Habit
description:
In Bad Habit, a player draws a card with three bad habits and chooses one. The other players ask questions and to find out what is the required bad habit. Questions must be simple. If your teammates guess your bad habit you get the card as a point. If your opposing team guess they get the point.

The team who has the most points is the winner.

name: Chicago Shootout
description:
A swift brutal cardgame for two players. Plenty of luck, plenty of influence -and plenty of bullets.

The game is about getting control of the different districts of Chicago. The player with the most victory points at the end of the third round wins.

At the beginning of each round place three district cards in a line in the middle of the table.

Then each player draws seven gangster card and take turn placing them by the districts. When each player has placed two gangsters in each district the shooting begins.

The shooting happens in three phases, your gangster card shows if your gangsters can shoot in each phase, in which direction the gangster can shoot and if he can dodge a bullet from any of the directions. If shot three times the gangster is killed and is removed at the end of that phases.

When all bullets are fired and the three phases has ended, you determine which player has the most influencial gangsters in each district (the most family points). The players then take each of the districts they now control.

At the end of the game the player with the most victory points win. Victory point are shown on the district cards.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Ninja Dice: Mystic Kage Master
description:
The most mysterious ninjas, mystics focus internal energy to tap into magic powers.

Includes a custom kage master die and character card.

Ninja Dice core game and Ninja Dice: Kage Masters expansion needed to play.
categories: Ancient, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Edge of Extinction: The Educational Trading Card Game
description:
Description from the designer:

Edge of Extinction is a fun and educational trading card game about wildlife… bringing the intensity of gaming into your homes, classrooms, libraries and learning centers.

Each Starter Deck contains 63 unique cards that represent the park, trail or region labeled on the cover of the deck. 2-4 players use their own deck to play against their opponent(s). The goal of the game is to have more points than your opponent at the end of ten rounds. Ideal for ages 10 and up, each game usually take 15-30 minutes to complete.

The key to the game is how the players learn by accident by building ecosystems with the highest points, each player learns how many different species are needed in nature for an endangered species to be introduced.

SPECIAL THANKS goes to Anthony Ortega and his game development student at Harrisburg University of Science and Technology for refining the EDGE of EXTINCTION gameplay rules in order to make them easier to understand. We appreciate your assistance with the gameplay rules. TOURNAMENT RULES are also now available thanks to Chad Davis, the first official EDGE of EXTINCTION Tournament Judge. We appreciate the time and dedication Mr. Davis provides to ensure that Tournament Gameplay is structured and fair.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Collectible Components, Educational, Environmental
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management
publishers: (Self-Published), Two Sisters in the Wild, LLC

name: Kierowcy!
description:
Simple set collection and racing game for kids. Player controls one of six different cars of municipal services (police car, fire engine, school bus, taxi, garbage truck and ambulance) and travels through the city on the round board.
Each car has a possibilty to collect three items connected to it within 18 hidden on a map at the beggining of the game. Players try to find their objects - in this case they can hold them. If they find an item connected to other car, they have to show it to other players and place unrevealed on the map. Unused cars stay in a center of a map and can be used by all players who are able to change their own cars whenever they want to.
The goal is to collect as a first player set of certain items dependent on number of players (from 4 to 6).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Quest for the Sampo
description:
You have heard of a wondrous artifact, the Sampo, which will bring great prosperity to your country. Unfortunately, it has not yet been created! In order for the great smith Ilmarinen to forge the Sampo, you must bring him the finest wool of a lamb, a single grain of barley, white iron, and a white swan feather. However Louhi, the Sorceress of Pohjola, also wants the Sampo to bring her prosperity! Will you be able to gain the Sampo and return to the Stone Fortress of Kivimäki before Louhi can steal the Sampo?

There are four stats in the game: Brawn, Wits, Magic, and Luck. At the start of the game, Brawn, Wits, and Magic all start at 1, and Luck starts at 0. You have 9 points to distribute between the 4 stats. Each point means you roll an additional six-sided die when using that stat.

These stats are used for the encounters at each location. Each encounter is fixed, and requires certain stats or combinations of stats for you to succeed. These encounters are how you gain better stats, gain the items you need to make the Sampo, and once you have the Sampo, how you avoid Louhi and her minions.

Inspired by the story of the Sampo from the Kalevala.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing

name: Inquizitor 2: The game
description: The sequel of the Inquizitor board game with 2500 new questions. The goal is to reach the end of the path before the other players by answering questions.

name: Triumph of the Will
description:
Description from the publisher:

This game allows two players to game an alternate history where Germany and Japan have won WWII. Three years after that victory in 1948 they square off against each other for a final battle for world domination. The map of the game joins along the equator to depict the entire world.

Game mechanics recreate dilemmas and challenges inherent in grand-strategic warfare and the issues involved with controlling the entire planet. Movement switches rapidly back and forth between players keeping you fully involved in the game with no long waits between players. In any order you want, you can: enter reinforcements; bring back into play previously eliminated units; move an army, air force, fleet or elite corps on the map via land, sea or air; launch a conventional attack or launch a nuclear attack. Both conventional and nuclear attack options are available to players.

Complexity: Medium
Time Scale: Varies 1yr/turn
Map Scale: Global Area Movement
Unit Scale: Armies/Fleets/Air Forces
categories: Industry / Manufacturing, Modern Warfare, Political, Wargame

name: Fantasy Fantasy Football
description:
Fantasy Fantasy Football is an inventive card game in which you are the Oracle manager of a football team of powerful and gruesome fantasy creatures battling through a season of fantasy football. Go head-to-head against other Oracle managers and battle the elements, manage bye weeks, and use your team's magic powers wisely.

Developed by designers Daryl Andrews and J.R. Honeycutt with art by Rob Lundy, Fantasy Fantasy Football is a roster-building card game in which players must assemble and manage a team through a season full of unexpected challenges using players skills and magical abilities to win games.
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Recycling Route
description: In Recycling Route, you are a trash-hauling company expanding into recycling markets. Each turn, you’ll roll dice to determine what types of recycling contracts are available in your city -- and your neighbor’s city, as well. Then, steer your truck along a collection route that maximizes revenue while trying not to completely fill up your landfill. The player who makes the most money is the winner of Recycling Route!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building

name: Beowulf Legends: Terror at Heorot
description:
Beowulf Legends: Terror at Heorot is a fast-paced and exciting card-drafting game for 2 to 5 players.

Players take on the roles of loyal Thanes to the good King Hrothgar, carousing in the vast and fabulous Mead Hall of Heorot, but powerless to defeat the terrible monster Grendel who nightly attacks their feasting — until a fearless warrior from Geatland arrives to save them: a hero named Beowulf.

The game takes place over four rounds, each representing one night of feasting. During the feasts, players draft cards to collect valuable gold coins and healing balms, receive the honour of Heorot, and sing songs to the glory of Hrothgar in the hope of being rewarded with one of his gifts.

At the end of each feast the next Grendel and Feast cards are revealed to determine who Grendel attacks, inflicting 'scratches' on one or more of the players.

After the fourth feast, Beowulf arrives and defeats the monster Grendel, and Hrothgar rewards Beowulf for finally ridding Heorot of Grendel’s terror, but Beowulf is generous, and shares these gifts with the players who he considers to be the most honourable.

But, before the true hero of Heorot can be celebrated, the player who suffered the most at Grendel’s terrible hand is laid to rest by his comrades, and his gold coins buried with him.

The surviving player with the most gold coins is celebrated as a true hero of the Danes — by Beowulf, Hrothgar and everyone at Heorot!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Kirby's Sweets Party
description:
This is a Kirby board game where players are creating sweets by collecting different ingredients.

Exerpts from the box (rough translation from Japanese):
Today I called Kirby's friends and had a sweet party! I am busy preparing for it now. Let's make a lot of sweets while sometimse helping your friends!

This game is a game where players compete for points as a fine patissier. The game is divided into two parts, Sweets Making and Sweets Party.

In Sweets Making, you get points by arranging materials that are on sweets cards and completing them. You can also earn points by raising money and helping other players.

Sweets Party is where you invite guests and get points if you have a favoriet sweet of the invited guest.

name: Quiz Quoz
description:
Quiz Quoz is a fast, fun trivia game anyone can win. Think a traditional quiz meets tic-tac-toe meets bingo, with three unique strands of luck that mean even a beginner can beat a brainbox.

The game takes a minute to learn, is family-friendly and takes 15-30 minutes to play.

So whether you're into Shakespeare, the Super Bowl, Star Wars or Subatomic particle physics, please support our kickstarter and help make Quiz Quoz a reality.

How To Play:

1) A Player or Team selects one of the game boards to play, then rolls a six-sided die.
2) The outcome of the die roll indicates the difficulty of the question they are asked.
3) If you answer correctly, you place a counter on the corresponding number on your Quiz Quoz game board. Each game board is a random 3x3 grid of numbers from 1-9. Each box contains one of the numbers and there are no duplicates.
4) The winner of the game is the player/team that completes a vertical, horizontal or diagonal straight line on their Quiz Quoz game board.

Components:
171 Cards (1026 Questions)
1 Six-Sided Die
6 Game Boards
36 Counters
Rulesheet

name: OReCLE
description:
OReCLE is a card game where you try to collect the most valuable gems. First there's a drafting stage where you develop an idea of what your opponents value and what options you have, then in the auction phase you use your accumulated resources to get even more valuable gems, including the high-point diamonds.

—user summary

name: ラララうちゅう (Ra ra ra uchû)
description:
User summary
ラララうちゅう (Ra ra ra uchû) La La La Alien is a set collection card game in which you collect aliens.

Aliens have crash landed on earth and you need to help them find the others from the same planet. Your points increase as you gather aliens of the same type, and there other other scoring opportunities based on their color.

Each round you may either exchange cards twice between your hand and the face-up supply or exchange your entire hand for the supply. The game ends after three rounds, which means you will only take a maximum of six moves in the entire game and you must watch the other players carefully to determine the best move to take.

The basics of this game are taken from a card game called 51 that is fairly well-known in Japan but not outside of it.

Publisher's summary
『ラララうちゅう』は、宇宙人を集めるセットコレクションのカードゲームです。地球に不時着した宇宙人たち。同じ星の仲間を探すのを手伝ってあげましょう。
同じ星の仲間の宇宙人を集めると、得点が増えます。宇宙人の色によって、いくつかの得点方法があります。１ラウンドでは、手札と場札の交換を２回ずつ行います。手札と場札を”総替え”することもできます。それを３ラウンド繰り返してゲーム終了となります。つまり、最大でのたったの６手しかありません。相手の動きをよく観察して、機敏な１手を指しましょう。
publishers: イマジンゲームズ (imagine GAMES)

name: The Overtime
description:
The player is one of employee who works in a black company. In this company, there is a strange custom that someone who left in the company until the end on Friday somehow also go to work on weekends. Let's smartly adjust your office hours to avoid Friday's survival.

The flow is simple. People who hand out five cards at a time and who sent out the latest leave time card will receive one stress token and will be the next start player.

Monday to Thursday are still relieved, the problem is overtime on Friday (that is the last one). If you remain on the company until late on Friday, you will be confirmed on Saturdays and Sundays and lose one precious life token. When the life token becomes zero ... ... I do not talk deeply any further. Anyway, at that point the game will end.

Players will accumulate stress tokens, but if they had three or more stress tokens as of Friday ...... Good news (or perhaps a bit new). If you collect three or more stress tokens and enter Friday, you will be caught in a stress check and you can rest. Furthermore, you can recover one lost life. What you should have is reasonable stress.

Also, there is a last train break. It is only possible to leave work after the last train after someone has missed the last train on that week. If someone misses the last train, "Ah, I can work even after the last train ..." is the same as reality wrapped in air feeling. Is not it?

name: Intelect 3D
description:
Spanish version of the original Scrabble with a mix of Upwords. This game shares the board, chips and rules with Scrabble and adds the possibility of stacking one or several letters on the original word to change the meaning of the words.

—user summary

name: Ticket to Ryde: The Game (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial, fan-made expansion. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.


Ticket to Ryde: The Game is a fan expansion of Ticket to Ride, set in the Ryde area of Sydney, Australia.

This expansion follows the principles of the Ticket to Ride games on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Dragon Busters
description:
The aim it to circle the castle once counterclockwise. The choice of the way is freely selectable.
At the beginning, the game machine is set up with the towers. The dragon comes into the courtyard. Each chooses a character and places it on its tower on an outer edge.
The active player turns the rotary arrow. Afterwards each player is allowed to move his character as many spaces as indicated at movement points. If a player ends his move in an occupied space, he simply moves on to the next empty space. At intersections the direction may be freely chosen, whereby it is clearly dangerous along the inner courtyard.
If the dragon symbol is turned, the active player must activate the dragon. He pushes the lever as a trigger to a freely selectable point and lets him go. The dragon now winds its way across the field and beats against the towers until after a certain time it is switched off by the device alone. The duration of its movement depends on the position of the trigger.
If Knights have fallen down or been knocked down by towers, they must begin their journey again from the beginning. This also applies to knights who have been completely pushed off their current field! The dragon is then placed back in the middle of the castle.
End of the game: If a knight manages to completely circle the castle, the game is over.

—user summary
publishers: Competo / Marektoy, Irwin Toy Ltd., Ravensburger

name: Swiss Yatzy
description:
Pairs, straights, a number of identical symbols, a full house or a "Swiss Yatzy" straightaway! Score points with 5 popular Swiss motifs!
—description from the back of the box

The game differs from Yahtzee in that you have to roll the exact symbols to fulfill certain objectives.
—user summary

name: Match Up!: Promo Game
description:
Links Promo is a cooperative trivia game with 13 Clue cards and 14 Number cards.
The goal is to Link all the Clue cards to the Number cards on the table. One Number card will remain. Validate its code with the Answer card to know if you win this level.
There are 2 levels in the game.

name: House Guests From Hell
description:
House Guests From Hell brings a unique experience to the table, through patented innovative game play, humor, and collaboration of players. This is a beautiful game that is intellectually stimulating, handsomely crafted, and extremely funny. It plays 2 to 6 players, involving creative problem solving. All players move around the game board in different directions at the same time creating a fun gaming experience.

The object of the game is to be the first player to get rid of their bad house guest. Entertain your guest, collect tokens and fix their problems that come up along the way.

Dilemma and solution cards are drawn on every turn, each player has to use a solution to fix their dilemma card. The player has to come up with a persuasive scenario that they present to the other players, who have to vote with a thumbs up or thumbs down resulting in the verdict. It is simple: would it work, or not so much?

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Advantage Token, Dice Rolling, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: Trick of Trip
description:
In トリックオブトリップ (Trick of Trip), rather than being dealt a hand of cards, players' hands are selected through an "I Cut, You Choose" mechanic. It is a trick-taking game played over 4 rounds. In each round, players will draw 6 cards from the deck, and split them into two sets of 3 cards. These cards will be placed onto a rack adjacent to the player. The other player next to the rack will choose which set of three cards they would like in their hand, and the splitting player will have the other set. (The cards remain on the rack.) Each player will have 6 cards to play in a hand, 3 on each adjacent rack.

Trump cards come from a special trump suit, and the lowest card of the trump suit, otherwise of the lead suit, will win a trick. (There is a special exception for the 7 cards.) The winner of a trick keeps the card they played face up in front of themselves (until the end of the game); the other cards are discarded.

A player's score is calculated at the end of the game and is equal to the sum of their score in each of the 5 suits. In a suit, a player's score is the product of their highest rank card and the number of cards collected in that suit. The player with the most points wins.
publishers: (Self-Published), AaAaAaGames (アーアーアーゲームズ)

name: Trolling for Trouble
description:
