Most of the spaces you land on ask you to do something fun—either find, play, or think! If you can do it, then you will win 1 toy token for the team. And if the players can together collect 12 toys before bed time then everybody wins the game! But if the clock makes it all the way to bedtime first, then nobody wins. But don't worry, you can always try again!

Components: Game Board, 20 Find Cards, 10 Play Cards, 35 Toy Tokens and 4 Player Pawns with bases.

-description from instructions
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing

name: Level 8 Junior
description:
The popular card game LEVEL 8: redesigned for children 6 years and up, but loads of fun for all ages!

Four cards in hand, on your turn pick up a card, complete a set if you can, and discard a card. Each player has their own discard pile, and you can take from the pick up pile, or any discard pile.

Collect 4 animal cards that match your tile, and get the tile for that animal. The first to get 8 animal tiles wins.

name: Tria
description: Tic tac toe with a twist. Each player controls 3 wooden cubes with different symbols on each face. On their turn a player can move any cube or turn one of their own. The winner is the one who makes a line of three symbols no matter the colour of the cube they are on

name: Cholent, The Game!
description:
"Cholent the Game" is a brand new card game that everyone in the family will love playing. Players are dealt a secret recipe card and venture out into the shuk--or market--to collect the ingredients they need, like meat, potatoes, eggs and spices. Using their gelt--or money--, players outbid each other for the ingredients. But don't forget your chevra! The other characters you meet in the market, like The Rebbe, The Bubby, the Prophet and more--will help you get your ingredients before anyone else.

You've tried the food. Now play the game.
publishers: Epicure Games, HaKubia, Jewish Educational Toys

name: Black Friday
description:
Take part in the crazy sale! Grab your bargains before other shoppers snatch them from under your nose! Pass the aisles and buy the items you need before anyone else! Remember that you can only take items to the checkout if they fit in your basket. Your task is to complete the 7 shopping lists as quickly as possible. When one of you manages to do so, count up the points on the list cards. The player with the most points wins!

—description from the publisher

Weźcie udział w szalonej wyprzedaży! Korzystajcie z okazji, zanim inni klienci sprzątną je Wam sprzed nosa! Mijajcie sklepowe alejki i kupujcie potrzebne sprzęty przed innymi! Pamiętajcie, że do kasy możecie zabrać wyłącznie te towary, które zmieszczą się Wam do koszyka. Waszym zadaniem będzie jak najszybsze zrealizowanie 7 list zakupów. Kiedy komuś z Was uda się tego dokonać, podliczcie punkty na kartach z listami. Gracz, który uzyska najwięcej punktów, wygrywa!

—description from the publisher (Polish)

Nehmen Sie an dem verrückten Verkauf teil! Schnappen Sie sich Ihre Schnäppchen, bevor sie Ihnen von anderen vor der Nase weggeschnappt werden! Gehen Sie durch die Gänge und kaufen Sie die Artikel, die Sie brauchen, vor allen anderen! Denken Sie daran, dass Sie nur Artikel zur Kasse nehmen können, die in Ihren Warenkorb passen. Ihre Aufgabe ist es, die 7 Einkaufslisten so schnell wie möglich abzuarbeiten. Wenn einer von euch das geschafft hat, zählt ihr die Punkte auf den Listenkarten zusammen. Der Spieler mit den meisten Punkten gewinnt!

—description from the publisher (German)
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Income, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: Dino Jump-a-Saurus
description: Based on the award-winning Traverse game, this one features not wooden shapes but 4 different dinosaurs on 4 differently shaped bases. Same objective as Traverse - get your pieces to the other side (or "trek across the prehistoric landscape"). Tyrannosaurus = triangle with three-direction move. Velociraptor = diamond, moves diagonally. Triceritops = square, moves orthogonally. Stegosaurus = round, moves like chess queen. The board features lava pits and water slides. Easy version for ages six and up. Advanced version also, plus variants like Stampede, Water Slide, Hot Lava and Lava Luck. "For extra excitement, try combining the rules for two or more variations."
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Miniatures, Prehistoric

name: Macho Women with Guns
description:
Macho Women with Guns is a humorous tactical miniatures game with some RPG elements tacked on for good measure. Players take on the roles of heavily armed women battling everything from Drunken Frat Boys to Bthulhu and more. One player controls the monsters and NPCs while the rest play the women. Characters are created with a point based system governing the stats of Strength, Dexterity, Macho, Looks, and Health. (There is no Intelligence score), as well as various skills like "Run in High Heels" and "Hit Things With Things"...
Combat and skill use is based on a 3d6 roll system combined with double-sided cut-out paper miniatures (cardboard bimbos), and hex boards supplied with the game. Gameplay is quick, easy to learn, and often very absurd.

The game has gone through 3 editions and several expansions.

Expanded by:

Renegade Nuns on Wheels (stand-alone game)
Batwinged Bimbos from Hell (stand-alone game)
Macho Women with Guns: The Final Chapter (Part One)
More Excuses to Kill Things
categories: Fighting, Humor, Mature / Adult, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Paper-and-Pencil, Player Judge, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up
publishers: Blacksburg Tactical Research Center, Nexus Editrice

name: Mini-Schlotterstein
description:
The students of the haunting school at Shiverstone Castle are very excited as the final haunting exam takes place today. The little ghosts have to prove that they know they are asters of their trade. Whoever pays close attention and displays a bit of skill, will be able to frighten lots of the castle inhabitants and undoubtedly pass the exams.

An eerily nice collection of games for 2 to 4 little ghosts Ages 4 and up.

This is a collection of 3 games requiring the players to move a ghost within Shiverstone Castle, using a magnet underneath, to find and frighten its inhabitants.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Horror, Memory

name: Big Picture Apples To Apples Snack Pack Game
description:
Play Big Picture Apples To Apples™ Snack Pack™ Game as a standalone game, or mix it with the cards in the Big Picture Apples to Apples big box or with other Apples to Apples games.

Make comparisons by playing picture cards. Descriptions picked by the judge win an Apple Chip. First player to collect five chips wins the game.

Note: Walmart exclusive. Actual color and style may vary by store.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Storytelling, Voting

name: Appalachian Trail Game: Special Edition
description:
Create your own adventure on the Appalachian Trail as you hike your way along the nearly 2,200 mile footpath from Georgia to Maine. Prepare for your own WALK IN THE WOODS with this fun new game! GEAR, CHANCE, and CHALLENGE Cards define your journey.

GEAR - Be prepared and learn to use the essential items during the game when faced with emergency scenarios.

CHANCE - Encounter opportunities to race ahead, hazards that slow your pace, or choose to stop and enjoy the trail.

CHALLENGE - Play and learn about hiking first aid, LEAVE NO TRACE camping and backpacking skills, Plant and Animal I.D., and Trail History.

Chance and GEAR Cards interact during the game. When faced with an emergency, if you are carrying the proper equipment, then you can continue your hike. Collect points as you correctly answer questions, identify plants and animals, and use the gear in your pack to help navigate through perilous situations that arise! The game ends when the first player completes a Thru Hike--arriving at either Katahdin or Springer Mountain. All players then tally the points from their Trail Journal cards and the player with the most points is the Winner!

This game is a fun and engaging way to prepare new hikers (kids scouts, students) for a their next adventure! It is also great for seasoned adult hikers to reminisce and test their knowledge! (Did I hear "alternate rules" with adult beverages?) It is also perfect for COUCH POTATOES because it lets them hike the AT from the comfort and safety of their living room! (One of the game pieces is a sofa!)
categories: Adventure, Animals, Card Game, Educational, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Sports
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Octorage
description:
Mercenaries who came to plunder forgotten treasures, you woke up the Octoman. You'll have to run fast not to be devoured!
To survive: manage your weapons to the best of your abilitiy, give your treasures up if you need to and lure the Octoman onto your companions of misfortune!

A game of OctoRage takes place in several rounds.
As soon as a player wins 2 rounds, he wins the game.
During their turn, players will be able to play a:

Weapon card, whose value must be greater or equal to the last card played. If the card is an 8, then the Octoman's rage is increased by 1.
Dodge card, which changes the direction of the turn.
Treasure card, which curses another player and decreases his chances of survival.


If a player can't or does not want to play a card, then he is attacked by the Octoman. He loses as many tokens of life as the Rage value of the Octoman.
If a player loses his last token of life, then he is eliminated.
A round ends when only one player remains alive.

—description from designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That
publishers: Banana Games, Furinkazan board game, GRRRE Games

name: Figure Grand Prix
description:
It's the world's first figure skating board game! Represent your country in the Figure Grand Prix. Who will be the figure skating queen in this competition? Enjoy all the thrill and excitement of figure skating with this board game!

Players control skaters from 6 different countries. There are 2 rounds of play - a short program and a long program. Each skate routine is started by a jump and ends with a spin. Players draft sets of cards to perform their routine for the most points they can.

Contents:
72 Cards
1 Game Board
5 Player Markers
5 Player Tokens
1 Starter Marker
1 Die
1 Scoring Book(30 Sheets)
1 Rule Book(in Korean, English, German, and Japanese)

Award:
Won a Prize @ 2010 Korea Boardgame Create Competition - organized by KOCCA and MCST
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: ¡Guka Croka!
description:
"¡Guka Croka!" translated from the much known troglodyte language, means: "HURRY UP, AMONG THE DINOSAURS, WE MUST ARRIVE TO THE CAVE ON TIME TO HAVE DINNER!!"

In this game, each troglodyte must arrive to the cave, only the fastest will be winner, so you need good luck rolling the dice and good memory to remember where dinosaurs hide to escape from them as quickly as you can.

Game is a combination of roll-and-move and memory elements. Players build circuit from hexagonal tokens, each carrying picture of one of 12 dinosaurs, faceup adding "Start" hex as a first one and "Cave" hex as last one. There are 4 addtional hexes that give "special action" - two "ladder" and two "extra roll". Additionally there 12 tiles with same 12 dinosaurs which is arranged in separate 4x3 grid, face down. When arriving at particular hex with dinosaur picture player has one try to find same dinosaur in facedown 4x3 grid - if successfull he rolls a die and moves again. First player to arrive to "Cave" hex wins the game.
mechanics: Memory, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dragon Epic
description:
Dragon Epic is a strategy game of army maneuver and battle, with the added flavor of magic. Heroes go on quests to discover powerful artifacts. Dragons can fly across territories to raze and pillage. Mighty leaders send hordes of mercenaries and strange creatures into mortal combat.

Troop types range from basic infantry, knights, mystic creatures, and heroes. Each troop card is placed in a battle line and casualties are removed from the front of the line unless they can be targeted with a special ability. So generally you want to place your toughest units in the front lines.

Each card lists its strengths and weaknesses. The number of stars across the top represent the amount of damage it can take, followed by number of dice it rolls in combat, offensive strength, and defensive strength. This seems simple, but the addition of creatures, special abilities, artifacts, and spells add to the strategy.

name: Die verflixte 0
description:
In this very simple abstract game players place pins with hidden numbers from 0 to 5 on a 6 by 6 board. The highest added "line" of numbers by one player, interrupted or not, diagonal or orthogonal, wins after all pins are revealed at the end of the game. The hitch: any "0" in the line, your own or by any other player, nullifies all numbers, making the line worthless.
Advanced rules introduce betting in the possible outcome, so you might win a series of games by guessing who placed best in each game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Deduction, Math, Memory, Number, Territory Building
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Memory, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Kugelblitz
description:
Each player holds a clear plastic tube. A large round pool contains lots of small balls with numbers 1-0 on them, in different colors. The bottom of the tubes has an elastic opening; press a tube onto a ball, and it gets picked up into the tube.

A task card gets revealed. Simultanous, each player trys to collect the balls depicted on the card in the correct order in his tube. The first player who finishes the task calls stop. If he did it correct, he scores three points; otherwise, each other player scores one point.

There are 3 types of task on each card:
- a color sequence (for example, red - yellow - green - blue - green - yellow - red)
- a number sequence (for example, 3 - 9 - 8 - 7 - 6 - 5 - 4)
- a target number; in this case, players have to collect any balls that add up to this number.
Players agree in before what kind of task they use; the color sequences is suitable for smaller children, number sequence rewards knowledge of the numbers; target number requires basic addition / subtraction skill.

The game ends after a predefined number of rounds (task cards). The player with the highest points total is the winner.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Math, Number, Real-time

name: 99 chances
description:
The indy RPG storytelling game 99 chances consists of a deck of cards, each with three distinct features: numbers from 1-99, opposing sets of words (good/bad, open/closed, wise/foolish, etc.), and genres (western, zombies, sci-fi, murder mystery, etc.)

Players are dealt a hand of cards and choose two genres from among them to mash up and pitch as a story. The group decides on a story by consensus, then builds characters. Players play cards on themselves with the positive side up to represent resources they have within the context of the story; they play cards negative side up on other players as problems.

Players take turns telling tales about how they will use their resources and the story itself to overcome their problems. Other players select number cards from their hands to represent the plausibility of the active storyteller's chance of success. The player who selects the median number is rewarded with a bonus resource and the median number becomes the chance of success for the storyteller. If the turn of a card is below this chance of success, the problem is turned into a resource.

After all players have had two turns to tackle their problems, the player with the most resources frames the climax. Players wager their resources on the final turn of the card.
mechanics: Acting, Betting and Bluffing, Role Playing, Storytelling, Voting

name: Queen Bee
description:
This game is played on a small field consisting of hexes. Each player has a force consisting of a queen, some worker bees and some fighter bees. Each turn, a player is allowed to move a single bee. A queen moves 1 space, a worker 2 and a fighter 3. Opponent's bees can be captured by ending your move on the same location as the opponent.

Goal of the game is to get your queen safely to the center of the playing board.

__________________

Re-themed and published as Kaiser, König, Edelmann in 1976 or Kendo in 1989 . Both by Otto Maier Verlag Ravensburg

name: Der Schatz der Inkas
description:
This is a game about collecting treasures of the Incas.

The center of the board shows a number of different treasures, connected by paths. Five cards are drawn, each showing one of these treasures. Players roll a die to move their pawn, and when they reach a treasure that is on one of the cards, they place a chip in their color on that card. Each card can be visited three times; the first player to find a treasure gets the most points.

The score is kept on a track around the board. Several spaces on this track have a symbol; if a player lands on such a space, they may discard one of the treasure cards.

The winner is the player that is the first to reach the end of the score track.

Not to be confused with the Ravenburger game of the same name.

name: La Reconquista
description:
La Reconquista is probably one of the first wargames published in Spain. It's a strategical level wargame simulating the reconquest of the Iberian Peninsula by the various christian kingdoms against the muslims.

It has scenarios from the 8th century to the 15th century and uses the typical hexagonal map and combat resolution tables. It also presents a curious system of detachable counters to represent combat strength reductions.

name: Riese Grobian
description:
Content:
board, 11 dwarves, 1 Giant, 7 bushes, 1 special die,

4 pairs of dwarves must try to safely get themselves into the cave on the mountain summit with their jewels before the giant Grobian has reached it. If at least 4 dwarves, one from each color, succeed in reaching the jewel cave, the dwarves beat the giant and win.

name: Makers of Universe
description:
Based on the novel "Maker Of Universe" By Philip José Farmer

Only one way to become the best Makers of the Universe to be the first to build its own world. But be careful because the path is strewn with pitfalls and friends of a tour will be the enemies of the next.

For this you need to buy machinery for building developments such as water or wildlife. You must protect your world by installing traps to your door, throw creatures to slow players and use your creative powers.

The game is divided into towers themselves divided into 2 phases.

During the first phase is named "Buy" players play together. A map "Machine" is drawn, then each player proposes a secret "Units of energy" in their closed fist. Whoever has the highest placing the machine wins.

Therefore, it must open the doors of his world to repatriate the machine and can use it.

During the phase of actions, each player in turn, plays many cards in his hand as they wish. The possibilities are:
Play-card creature in defence to protect its World enemy attacks
Play-card creature in launching the attack on another world.
Play-card trend to build its world if we have the machine that goes well
- Protecting the world map by a trap or a decoy

In addition, each player represents one of the 10 characters available and has a unique power affecting the game It may also use the cards type action at any time during the game, a turn or not.

Between developments and machinery, points creations (annotated by stars on the charts) are earned. The first to reach the required number of points (defined according to the number of players) won the game.

Online Play: VASSAL module
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Fantasy, Fighting, Memory, Negotiation, Science Fiction, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Memory, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Mega Mindy: De ontsnapte boef
description:
A boardgames about the TV series "Mega Mindy".

Each player plays superstar "Mega Mindy" and try to catch the badguy.

The games consists of 2 boards. One should be on table, the other one on the ground.

Ladders are used to switch between boards.

You move both your pawn and the bad guy buy throwing dice. First player to catch the Bad Guy wins.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Photo Safari
description:
Taken from the back of the box:
Come along on a photo safari and take pictures of the funniest animals! Use your camera to capture 4 photographs of your favourite animal family.

In Photo Safari each player tries to collect four different pictures of the same animal. This is done by taking the plastic camera, when landing on a "camera square" on the board, and taking a picture. If this picture is a new pose of he animal you already have photographed you keep it until you collect all four.

name: Bulrup
description:
Players compete to grow long extinct plants, while trying to enlist the aid of magical creatures and repel the attacks of terrifying ogres and repulsive urgs.

Each turn players draw cards and either discard unwanted cards or plant crops. At the beginning of the turn all planted crops grow and are worth points at the end of the game. Lodges and mystical helpers can also be played to game changing effect!

name: Ghiotto di Ghiande
description:
Squirrels are stocking on food supplies for the winter, but Ghiotto, the most gluttonous and lazy squirrel of the forest, goes from hole to hole to grab some acorn from other squirrels!

In the funny tile game Ghiotto di Ghiande, players must choose each turn a bunch of nuts - without knowing how many leaves will be needed to cover it - or a group of leaves - without knowing how many nuts it contains - to stock on supplies before hibernation, avoiding carefully to drag Ghiotto's attention by having the biggest stack of leaves at the end of the turn. There are three types of nuts, and players will score only two, so... choose carefully!

name: Carps & Angsty Manatee: Volume 1 (fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
description:
A third-party, unofficial parody expansion pack.

Includes 150 brand new, original cards (130 absurd white cards & 20 ludicrous black cards)
categories: Card Game, Fan Expansion, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: StoryCards: Die drei ??? – Buch der Finsternis
description: StoryCards: Die drei ??? – Buch der Finsternis is a storytelling game of sorts in which a player or team is confronted by a situation that presents them with two options for a journey. Which way should they go to solve the mystery? Once they choose, they lay down the card, then search for the appropriately numbered card that they chose. The more cards they lay down, the more they score. If a card is no longer available, however, then the game ends and the detective trio has failed.

name: Tally Ho! Tactical Air Combat Game, Allies vs Axis 1939-1942
description:
Tally Ho! is volume 5 in the Battle over Britain game series, covering North Africa, 1940-41. In addition, it contains warplanes and six other campaign games featuring Italy, Britain, Germany, the USA, Japan, AVG China, Poland, and the Netherlands from 1939-1942... 119 warplanes in all. It also provides six new "stand alone" scenarios--a first for the system--such as Rommel himself trying to escape behind lines in a Storch, or a short campaign scenario pitting a single Chennault's Fighting Tiger (without spare parts) against the Japanese, or flying against an Me-109 on escort duty (rather than on its own), and more. Also new is guidelines/formula for rating the value of warplanes yourself, based on game ratings, to allow for more in-depth comparison of aircraft.

The game system is identical to and compatible with Battle over Britain. This 52-page full color, illustrated book includes standard rules, advanced rules, solitaire rules, and historical scenarios. In fact, the aircraft and campaign games include those contained in Battle over the Pacific (Vol. 2), Faith, Hope & Charity (Vol. 3), and Flying Tigers (Vol. 4). (See descriptions below for details.) This edition is a handsome volume and comes with new North African and Additional Plane counters, featuring aircraft new to the system, plus others such as the RAF Battle and Hudson, the Italian C-32 and SM-82, American P-38 Lightning, Australian Boomerang, and German Storch and Ju-52 Tante Ju. Also included is a "points system" for rating planes (or design-your-own scenarios), and new stand-alone game scenarios.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Wargame, World War II

name: Adventurer's Kit: Expedition
description:
Adventure's Kit: Expedition is a treasure-collecting card game for 2-4 players. The game is designed for younger ones to start with, as it becomes more strategic with aggressive play for adults. In the game, players send out expedition teams to explore ancient continents and collect world-famous artifacts.

To set up the game, draw ten culture cards, then place them on the appropriate continents on the game board sorted according to their age. Place museums and relics to the side as they are bonuses acquired during the game. Each player starts with five expedition cards in hand; if anyone holds an event card, they should discard it, and redraw until they have five cards, after which event cards are shuffled back into the deck.

On a turn, draw one expedition card, then choose to either send out the expedition team (i.e., place the specialist cards on the table), replace any number of specialists in hand by redrawing, or explore. You can explore only if you've already established an expedition team. When you explore, see whether the cards played match any of the artifact requirements on the table; the artifacts can be retrieved by consuming certain specialists, and the player can continue exploring the next card in the same continent as long as the requirements match. At the end of your turn, check that all four continents hold at least one artifact; if not, draw ten new culture cards and place them as at the start of play.

The game ends after 5/7/8 museums or relics have been uncovered, depending on whether you have 2/3/4 players in the game. Players then tally their scores from artifacts collected, along with any bonus points they've acquired. Whoever has the highest score wins!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Card Game, Children's Game, Exploration
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Monetes
description:
Fast and fun card game for all ages and audiences, especially appropiate for children, encouraging the use of numbers and basic strategies.

Play your cards following the numerical or color pattern, use your actions and make clever combos to be the first to run out of cards and finish the game. Have fun as crazy monkeys!

—description from the publisher
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Party Game

name: Hungry Hugo
description:
Hungry Hugo is a card and dice game. Every player starts with a hut (consisting of 5 parts), an empty garden, with 5 spaces for nice garden décor and 3 action cards, which can be: Build (décor), Move (the sleeping monkey), Wake (the monkey), Banana (for bad times).

In the middle of the table, there are 20 “BEAUTIFUL THINGS” (garden décor standees), which players can build in their gardens. The first players, who has 5 "BEAUTIFUL THINGS" in his garden, wins the game.

Sounds easy? There’s a little snag. The snag is called Hugo, and is 3 meters high. This monkey is always hungry … when he’s awake. Fortunately he sleeps most of the time.
The game is played turn by turn. In his turn a player can play 1 action card, or discard 1 action card, and draw a new card (hand = 3 cards).
As an action you can BUILD a beautiful thing into your garden - but only if the monkey is not in front of your hut. Another possible action is to MOVE the sleeping monkey to another players hut. Or, you can WAKE up the monkey, when he’s at anothers players hut.
If someone plays a WAKE card, he rolls the HUGO DICE, to see what the monkey will do. The dice has 4 sides with HOT HUNGER, which means, Hugo will eat one of your BEAUTIFUL THINGS. 1 other side shows a sleeping Hugo, which means, Hugo felt immediately back into his dreams, the guy in the hut is lucky, and nothing else happens in this turn. The last side of the dice is I SEE YOU, which means Hugo noticed the active player, while waking him up, and follows him to his hut.
And what about the banana? You can keep these cards in your hand, to give it to Hugo in a HOT HUNGER Situation, so that he can eat it … instead of your garden décor.
And so players will build décor, push the sleeping Hugo back and forth, collect bananas and hope not the have the monkey in front of their huts, when he awakes hungry. Every eaten thing comes out of the game, so the game ends, if someone has a full garden (5 beautiful things), or if no beautiful things are in stock (in the middle). In this case, the player with the most beautiful things wins. In case of a tie, the winner will be the one who’s furthest away from Hugo.

name: Monopoly: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Collector's Edition
description:
Monopoly: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Collector's Edition follows our favorite "Heroes in a Half Shell" as they battle their way through 22 of the most notorious villains in the turtle world. Six custom-sculpted colored vinyl tokens include Leonardo, Donatello, Michelangelo, Raphael, Splinter & Casey Jones, Use your Turtle Power and come kick some enemy butt with Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Monopoly.

Includes:


Six custom-sculpted colored vinyl tokens include Leonardo, Donatello, Michelangelo, Raphael, Splinter & Casey Jones.



Custom sculpted Pizza Slices & Pizza Boxes replace traditional Houses & Hotels.



Custom designed game board revisits the original TV show's notorious villains.



Chance & Community Chest cards are transformed into Mutagen and Allies cards.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: San Guo Sha: The Return of Legend
description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that San Guo Sha is an unauthorized reproduction of BANG! with just a few differences, published in China and distributed in several coutries of the world.




All official expansions (Battle, Wind, Fire, Woods and Mountains) released in 2011, at the same time with 2011 Standard edition of the base game.

Yoka released this edition together with the 2011 Standard edition, updating the terminology and the new cardback so that it can be mixed with the latter.


Legends of the Three Kingdoms (a.k.a. San Guo Sha) is a card game based off the Chinese classical novel, Romance of the Three Kingdoms, which shares many rules with Bang!, the differences are as follows:
1. The Monarch (Sheriff) may get an additional skill related to their kingdom allegiance; players routinely have two powers.
2. Weapons may have their own additional powers.
3. A card to let a player borrow a weapon from another.
4. A card to cancel the effect of other cards.
5. Peach (Beer) may be played by any player when someone loses their last life; there is no exemption of using Peach when there are only 2 players left.
6. The game proceeds counter-clockwise.

name: The Dark Crystal Game
description: A path-race game based on the movie, The Dark Crystal. This game uses a physical manifestation of time, so not only are the players racing against one another, they are also racing against "time" to attempt to restore the crystal.

name: Christmas Lights
description:
It’s nice to spruce up the Christmas tree with light even if your brothers and sisters are a little competitive about it. This year you’ll show them how to do it right.

To play you will need to print out the game sheet and have a different colored pencil or crayon for each player. The board represents a Christmas tree the bulbs on it and the wires that join them.

On his turn a player will do one of two things -- 1) Color in any bulb not already part of a string of lights or 2) Continue a string of lights. This is done by coloring in a wire from a bulb of your color to another unclaimed bulb coloring it in.

Continue until there are no more bulbs to be claimed. Then the tree is scored -- one point for each bulb, one point for each wire.

name: Gin
description:
Content: board, 2 big dice, 35 wooden chips

This game board is like a kind of flipper, where the players play in their chips, in order to get out some more for themselves.

At the beginning of the game, a chip is placed on each of the three corner spaces of the game board. All other chips are equally distributed to the players. Eventually leftover chips are put on the last space marked with an arrow.

The players roll a die and set a chip on the corresponding space on the game board, 1 beeing the center space. If there is already one or more chips on the space, the player rolls again and moves the entire stack accordingly.
What a player moves over the arrow field onto the table are his winnings.

GIN is game No. 10 (of a least 12) in a family called "Miniplays".
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wordquest: Expansion set
description:
Expansion for Wordquest! Wordquest! is basically a multi-player word search. When you locate the word, you mark it with your color tiles. If an opponent finds a word that uses a letter with your tile marking it, your word gets erased from the board. That makes the game more interesting. Whoever has the most tiles on the board when all the words are found is the winner.

This expansion contains 20 new themes.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Word Game

name: Look Look
description: Crazy creatures abound in this fast-paced, mixed-up matching race! Draw a card to reveal the challenge. Will you need to find the identical creatures within two differently colored frames, or do quick math once you spot the numbers? Race against your opponents to spot it or solve it. The winner keeps the card. Be the first to collect enough cards to spell “Look Look,” and you take the game! Game board is comprised of eight interchangeable frames, making it a new game every time you play. Includes 68 challenge cards. 2 or more players.

name: Scuba Junior
description:
Scuba Junior is a fun and fast paced card game that mixes aventure with educational contents.

"Would you dare to dive into the sea together with other Junior Scuba Divers and go in search of the Captain Pirate´s gold? But look out! Old Captain is still lying in wait!"

Scuba Junior is an easy to learn children's game. The objective consists in recovering all the treasures that the Pirate Captain hides in his sunken Galleon. Thus, each Junior Scuba Diver must dive from his ship to the Pirate Galleon, obtain a treasure and go back to the ship. By the way through the sea, the junior scuba divers will discover up to 30 real marine species.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Pirates

name: L'Isola del Tesoro
description:
All pirates of the Seven Seas are looking for the Treasure Island, where Barbarosa, the infamous pirate, hid his precious treasure! Are you ready for this incredible voyage? You'll need courage and a bit of luck!

L'Isola del Tesoro is a great adventure game with pirates, ships and treasures. It is a game for the whole family, easy to learn, with a fast gameplay and two bonuses for the bravest pirates.

L'Isola del Tesoro is a basic roll and move game, where you are trying to get from the Start tile to the Treasure Island, progressing through all the Sea tiles placed in a line. On your turn, you roll the six-sided die and move as many spaces as the result of the roll. You flip the tile where you land and apply any effect indicated (move forward one space, move to the tile where stands the last ship, skip your turn...). The first player to reach the Treasure Island wins the game.

The Monster tiles are used to block your progression. When you cross one, you must stop, flip it and stop your turn. On the following turn, you roll the die to try to beat the monster. Whoever beats the monster gets the tile, which doesn't give any advantage.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Voyagers: Lure of the Sea
description:
Get ready to sail around the world! Join this wide-eyed ocean adventure and sail the wildest seas, dive the deepest canyons, and drop anchor at the most exotic ports. Explore our world of water, rich in life and lore... This is the Lure of the Sea.

This family game presents a ship's log of 1,080 questions. Some are easy. Some are hard. Some are simply amazing. Some may ask you to play a role, or find some treasure, or maybe just steer a smooth course around the world and Be a Voyager! Answer at least two log entries in each area of the globe without getting shipwrecked, and you'll be the winner and a true Voyager!

name: Warhammer Adventures
description:
This boardgame has been published together with Warhammer: 28 periodical issues sold in the Italian newspaperkiosks. They included the game, a Warhammer Encyclopedia (by Andrea Angiolino himself) and short stories set in Warhammer world.
The boardgame is played on squared modular tiles to form dungeons and outdoor battlefields: several underground, open field and mixed scenarios are included. The issues included cardboard models of two houses and a tower, to be used in the game. Game characters depict all the main races of the Warhammer world, together with monsters and some characters from the short stories in the issues, as Felix and Gotrek.
The game uses cardboard counters, but there was on sale a box with all the lead miniatures included in the game.
The issues have been published and distributed by the Italian publisher Hobby & Work. Nexus Editrice designed and edited all the materials up to the printing stage. Games Workshop licensed the issues and provided the miniature sets.
publishers: Games Workshop Ltd., Hobby & Works, Nexus Editrice

name: Golf, the Game
description:
A golf simulation game in which players use a combination of chance and trivia knowledge to compete a round. The game comes with a very large photo-realistic board, playing pieces that look like golfers, and handbooks that contain various tables. Depending on the play situation, a die roll is referenced to these tables to determine the outcome of a particular shot.
The 1985 version of this game comes with a colorful cartoon-like board and uses golf tees as the playing pieces.

name: Gettysburg 1863
description: "Gettysburg 1863" consists of 112 pieces , a 29.5 x 42 cm map(printed in English) and 8 pages of rules(in Japanese). Circumference of Gettysburg is printed in a map. Turn length is four hours and units are battalions , brigades or divisions. Player numbers are one or two and playing time is three hours.

name: Path to Glory
description:
Path to Glory (PtG) originally appeared as a series of articles in White Dwarf Magazine #275,#276,#277,#278,#279,#284(US). It was meant to be a sort of spin-off from Warhammer Fantasy Battles, to add a little variation to the game. Later it was published as a stand-alone game, though the basic Warhammer rules are still required.

In PtG you take control of a Chaos Champion. You are allotted 35 "Favor Points" with which to build your retinue of chaos followers. Available are anything from Barbarian marauders and Chaos Knights to Evil daemons and the foul chaos spawn! Once you've collected your War band you set out to battle against other war bands in a show of might and power. If the Chaos Gods are pleased with your performance they award you with their favor (Favor Points), although they may even punish you, as the will of the Gods of Chaos are fickle and unpredictable...
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Anagramme
description:
In Anagramme, two players (or teams) compete to find anagrams of French words as quickly as possible.

Each side of a card shows five words, and the words on the opposite side are their anagrams. The cards are placed vertically between the players (or teams), who try and guess the opponent's word as quickly as possible to get the card. Various colors for each of the five words indicate the difficulty (and allow the players to look for the same puzzle).

name: Theomachy: New Blood Pack
description: An expansion pack with 2 new pantheons: Aztec and Nightmare (Cthulhu Mythos). Available as an add-on on KS campaign.

name: Длань Мануса (Hand of Manus)
description:
In Hand of Manus players take roles of craftsman guild leaders, competing to construct and present the best hand for valorous warrior Manus, who lost his hand in a battle.
Each round players design and then test their constructs in a test room. A hand consists of three parts - shoulder, forearm and wrist and each part has affinity to different elements, so it's performance depends on testing conditions. Every round players bet on expected performance for their hand and then secretly influence testing conditions. Whoever fulfills their bet scores points accordingly, and a first player to get 12 points wins.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Trivial Pursuit: Rick and Morty
description: Trivial Pursuit: Rick and Morty allows fans of the hit television series to test their knowledge from 600 questions relating to Frienemies, Technology & Science, Locations, Rick and the Family, History & Events and a Wubalubadubdub Wild Card category.

name: Juxtabo
description:
Juxtabo features 126 discs, each with one of seven colors on one side and a different color on the other side. Several discs are chosen randomly to form a grid to start the game, and each player receives seven discs as his hand. Players also receive two challenge cards, each of which shows a pattern consisting of either three or four discs.

The idea is to find the card pattern somewhere in the grid. A player may use his discs to change the colors in the grid. For example, one color in the grid, say, blue, does not match the color he needs, say, orange, to complete the pattern. He can play a disc with a blue side on top of the blue disc in the grid. If the other side of the played disc is orange, then he is done. If not, he can add one or more discs to the same stack in the same fashion until the grid pattern matches the card pattern.

Draw new challenge cards as you complete them. Replenish to seven discs at the end of your turn and play until all discs have been used and no one can make a match.

name: Trinidad
description:
Selection #3 of The Games Collection by Pin International.

A quick but treacherous game where speed and sacrifice count, as players maneuver to unite three pieces in a row of the central tic-tac-toe.
Type of game: Strategic movement with goal pattern.
A combination of checkers with tic-tac-toe.

name: 5 Star
description:
Quoted from the box cover: "5 Star is an exiting but fun travel and business game in which the budding entrepreneur attempts to be the first to not only build an empire but also amass a fortune of $100 million.

"Players trade in gourmet restaurant chains, holiday clubs, airlines and luxury hotels. Each player has a different set of objectives and can manipulate the buying and selling price of each of the four types of business to enable them to be bought and sold at a profit to that player. At the same time players may manipulate these prices to, hopefully, cause the other players to trade them at a loss.

"In this way players use their entrepreneurial skill to amass a personal fortune but must use business skill and strategy to avoid the consequences of bad dealing."
publishers: Desyllas Games, Habourdin International, Spear's Games

name: Ava
description:
Ava comes with a wooden gameboard displaying a hexagon divided into small triangles and 59 colored stones in black, white and red.

The players try to achieve one of the three winning conditions using 6 stones: 6 stones in a row, 6 stones creating a triangle or 6 stones creating a hexagon.

Game has placement and movement phases.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Identicards
description:
From the box:

UFO? James Bond? Restaurant? What's your ID? The answer is "glued" to your face. It's more than just what you know. Be smart, do the right questions and guess your ID quickly. The cards, with very funny images, garantee laughs during all play. You will laugh and have fun trying to discover yourself!

Every player attaches a headband with a card, and the card may have a famous person, a object or even a place. Players alternate turns asking questions, and the other players must answer either "yes", "no" or "I don't know". When a player correctly guesses the content of his card, he advances one space in the board, while the others continue with the same cards on their heads. The first player to cross the board is the winner!

name: North Star Games Promo Facebook Cards
description:
North Star Games received hundreds of submissions from Facebook users to create this promo pack. The best questions were chosen by their Facebook community. This promo pack contains 25 cards with a total of:


49 Wits & Wagers Questions (7 cards with 7 questions on each, and 1 'How to play'-card.)
42 Say Anything Questions (7 cards with 6 questions on each, 5 marked 'Facebook Fan', 2 marked 'Geek & Sundry', and 1 'How to play'-card.)
11 Crappy Birthday Cards (and 1 'How to play'-card.)

name: That Dirty Blanking Card Game
description: Players are dealt five "harmless word" cards while one player (the teller) is chosen to read an "innocent story". The teller will be using a book mark to let the other players know what kind of card (black noun and adjective or red verb and adverb) to play. The players will then play one of their cards, hoping to play the ones with the highest points as the player with the lowest score wins. By playing their cards, they assist the teller in telling an innocent story that turns dirty with the harmless word cards.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Arcane Guardian
description:
Arcane Guardian is a quick, fun solo dungeon crawler card game of tactics, scarce resource management, and luck. Ancient powers have risen and are threatening humanity once more. It is you, the Arcane Mage who must face them. You have to weaken them before they swarm the realm of the living. To do so, you have to confront all the terrors crawling deep below the surface. The goal of the game is simple: escape the dungeon. Will you live to see the daylight?

Arcane Guardian is lightweight and highly enjoyable from the very first play with enough depth to keep you entertained. You control a mage who wanders in an enchanted dungeon, opens treasure chests, fights monsters and drinks magical potions. You have to defeat numerous elementals and undead. Try to save as much Mana as possible, for if you run out of it, you cannot even emit light from your staff and are left in the dark. Your options are limited, while the dangers are many. In Arcane Guardian, every decision matters!

Arcane Guardian is a Print and Play card game. The deck contains 60 cards, and there are an additional 21 cards. One game takes about 10 minutes. The game is made up of steps that are to be carried out in a set order. In the beginning, you have three ways to go. You select a deck and interact with the upper card. If the chosen card was not revealed, then you must reveal it and instantly interact with it. You may collect the card or discard it into the discard pile. After an interaction’s end, you have to reveal all cards that are unrevealed (face down) on top of a deck except on the one that you interacted with. If your health goes below 1, and you cannot heal than the game is over and you lose. You should always consider whether to fight an enemy and lose health, or cast spells and spend your mana. You may suffer several terrible curses that weaken you, but you can even their effects out with masks, or create powerful and interesting combinations of different positive and negative magical effects. Of course, luck has an impact on your gameplay, you have to roll a die when you open treasure chests and when you interact with traps.

You play until you find an ending card among the bottom six cards of a deck. If you successfully interact with it, then you win the game and escape the dungeon.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: Dice of Fury
description: Each round, a card is revealed. Then, the players roll their 6 dice as fast as they can to try to match the card, locking in any dice they want as they roll. First person to match gets the card. There are a few "Slow your roll" cards in the deck that have a little minigame where they players roll at their own pace. First player to win ten cards wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Re-rolling and Locking, Real-Time

name: Rainbow Friends
description:
Way up in Cloudlandia is where the Rainbow Friends live – Kody Koala, Cammy Chameleon, Penny Penguin and Lazy Lou. These four friends create beautiful rainbows together when the sun is shining through the rain.

Valuable cloud crystals can be found where these rainbows touch the ground. Grab them by proving you have a good eye for distance and size.

The first player to collect three golden cloud crystals wins the sparkling collection game!

name: Frog Rally
description:
Will you be the first frog to make it to the pond ? Roll the die to determine which frog leg you have to hold onto - and then pull the frog as far forward (for green or blue) or backward (for red or yellow) until the string is pulled tight. After each pull you will be in a new position in the race and must fix the frog´s legs so that both front and back legs are the same length. Roll the frog symbol and you get a free move forward. But if you roll the car symbol, this means danger so you have to take a move back. The winner is the first player to reach the pond.
In the original Perlhuhn version, you didn't have to fix the legs to the same length after your move, but could decide freely, therefore putting an element of risk in it at your own choice.
publishers: Beleduc, Edition Perlhuhn (Göttinger Spiele), KOSMOS, Ravensburger

name: Pixy Cubes
description:
Arrange colorful cubes in different designs with Pixy Cubes. Each cube is colored green, red, yellow, and blue either as solids, halves, or in two variations of crescent shapes. You can race for speed, challenge your memory, or simply create pictures and designs as a pastime.

In the speed game, players try to be the first one to arrange their cubes in a pattern designated on a Challenge Card. In the memory game, players have ten seconds to memorize the pattern, then try to be the first one to duplicate it.

Pixy Cubes also contains Design Cards that players can use as a layout. Some cards show the sides of the cubes while others are plain. The levels of difficulty vary. With or without the models, the possibilities are just about endless!

name: Bombshell
description:
It's a simple game, in which four bomb disposal soldiers (thick cardboard cut-outs) with names like "Major Disaster" try to defuse a bomb. The bomb is a red plastic shell in two parts with a spring inside. Players turn the top of the shell click by click, and eventually it will 'explode' and wound the soldier whose turn it is. Plastic bandages clip onto parts of the soldiers to show how wounded they are. Eventually the winner is the last soldier left.

This game is quite rare; as weeks after its release, a bomb disposal man was blown up by an IRA bomb, so the game was taken off the shelves.

name: Der Berg ruft
description: The Mountain Calls. Help Heidi and Peter climb the mountain, trip your opponents without falling yourself.

name: Virus Alert
description:
From the publisher's website:

The basic premise of the game is to acquire 10 virus-free Object cards that represent computer resources such as Graphics, Software, Web Pages, Games, Documents, and Email. Action cards provide game play strategy that allows players to introduce viruses (represented by tokens) onto their opponent’s Object cards. You can’t win unless you have 10 Object cards on your side with no virus tokens on them. Other Action cards shield your Objects from viruses (like Anti Virus), and help to clean virus tokens off your Object cards (Cleanup). There are Action cards that allow you to steal a card from another player (Piracy), remove anti-virus protection (AV Killer), or that pesky Virus Generator card (Scan), or search for a card in the discard pile (Backup). Some Action cards like Virus!, Recycle or Repair use a 6-sided die to determine how many virus tokens are placed or removed from your Object cards. This adds an aspect of chance to the game, and helps make every game you play different.

A more attainable goal of playing to just 6 virus-free objects is recommended by some players.

name: Rex
description:
Rex was an independently published game made by Mag-Nif, 8820 East Ave. Mentor, Ohio, in 1982 (I wonder what's there now?). In many ways, the Gigamic games owe something to this one. In Rex, players stack colored balls onto nine pegs, one each per turn. The goals are to get three balls a) vertically on any one of the pegs b) horizontally on any level in any one row c) diagonally within any one row d) at the corners. It's not as confusing as it sounds once you read the instructions printed on the back of the box. Neat game. Probably didn't sell well. Ahead of its time I presume.

Similar to:

Score Four

name: Assault on Belgium
description:
A small demo game of Udo Grebe Game design games.

A small teaser/give-away to the "Empires of the Apocalypse" series. The first game of which was "Morsecode"

This small game is about the German assault on Belgium in 1939.

name: The Hat
description:
The Hat is a game for a good big company that plays it all together. Players one after another try to explain, show by pantomime or draw any word and all the others do their best to understand it. A performing player and those who coped with guessing words get winning points. Sometimes it happens that you need to describe several words but the time is always limited. Moreover player can cut down his time or make his task harder by any other way to earn more points. Players take the word samples from the hat or something modeling it. They decide how to fill the hat choosing words themes, their difficulty or language. It’s easily possible to come across with unknown words or you can compose the tasks by your own self.

This parlor game has got its name after the game popular in many companies where you have to explain words written down at the sheets of paper that are put into a hat. The game mechanics is based on the popular russian games such as “Associations”, “Crocodile”, “Stooping dog”. Mostly well-known western board games of this genre are Activity and Alias.
The Hat cards are the basis of the game – they describe the way of representing the word: to explain by words, to show or to draw it.

Players draw cards with face up from The Hat pile by turn and define the way of the word explanation. Finally played words bring winning points marked at the card. Also cards recount the time for the performance. It’s possible to reduce explanation time to increase points. In this case the time is fixed by a dice roll.
There are also 3 other card types with extra explanation terms. You get more points if you succeed using these cards. For example, you can take a complication card “draw a word with your left hand” as an addition to a simple drawing task.

The main trait of The Hat game is in the unlimited ways of using words. Only you decide what word should appear in the hat and what will be guessed by your company. Varieties are numerous because Russian dictionary contains 140 000 different words, and it’s possible to play using any foreign language as well.

The game box contains of several word sets that differ by difficulty. They are sealed so nobody will see them before the game begins. You need to cut the word sets into the hat without opening it.

It also happens that players get tired of the word game after guessing the same words for several times. This will never happen with The Hat. Words from the basic sets suit only for the first play. New words can be downloaded from our web site or bought in the special boosters.
publishers: Rightgames RBG SIA, Stolitsa Design Group

name: Bastogne: Crossroads of Death
description: Bastogne: Crossroads of Death is a simulation on the American defense of this town during the Battle of the Bulge. 100 counters, 22" x 34" map and 16 pages of rules.

name: Black Stories: Das mörderische Drehbuch
description:
Who can reconstruct the raven-black scenes of the murderous script?

Total chaos in the film studios! In a burglary, everything was devastated and important scripts were stolen. The players are scriptwriters and have the task to rewrite the scripts. It helps that some scenes that are already shot, as well as the director.

The director draws a director's card and reads the script through. Only he knows the complete murderous script. He reads the screenplay and the introduction to his scriptwriters, puts on the first film scene and off you go! The scriptwriters have to guess with yes / no questions what happened here and what happens next - only then they get the next scene given by the director as a “reward”. If the scriptwriters have guessed all six scenes and the complete murderous script is shot, the next round starts and another player is allowed to play the director.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game

name: Pow Wow
description:
from Game Cabinet rules:

Unroll the game board and place 5 of the smaller white stones on the center space of the teepee on the board, one stone in each of the five segments of the circle. Place the 6 Indians tokens on the START space on the outside track on the board. The remainder of the white stones should be placed in a convenient location off the board. Use all 6 moccasin cards with Indian names and sufficient POW WOW cards so that two cards can be dealt to each player. Shuffle the moccasin and POW WOW cards and deal 2 face down to each player. Players should conceal their hands. The POW WOW cards have no value in the game but can be traded among players as the game progresses.

OBJECT
The winner of the game is the holder of the moccasin card with the Indian that matches the color of the Indian token that leaves the last space on the track at the outside of the board (indicated by the two poles side by side).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: franjos Spieleverlag, W. Nostheide Verlag GmbH

name: Bataille de Fleurus
description:
A simple "Napoleon's Last Battles" type game about the battle of Fleurus (June 26th 1794) between Jourdan and Cobourg.

hexes : 500 meters
Units : brigades
Turn : 2 hours

name: Zeitreise
description:
A development of Cloak & Dagger by Fata Morgana's Urs Hostettler and historian Werner Meyer.

The new theme is time travel through the history of Germany and Switzerland. The envelopes represent different historical epochs. The players try to find and bring together historical persons and objects.

There are two sets, one for Germany called Zeitreise in die Deutsche Geschichte and one for Switzerland called Zeitreise in die Schweizer Geschichte or Voyage dans le Temps de l'Histoire Suisse.

name: Milwaukee in a Box
description:
A Monopoly-style game from Late For The Sky publishing which uses a thematic setting of Milwaukee, Wisconsin.

Summer Fest and The Great Circus Parade are the utilities in this game, and property cards cover places like the Bradley Center, County Stadium, Miller and Pabst Brewing Companies, Harley-Davidson, Usinger's Sausage, the Pfeister Hotel, and the Allen-Bradley Clock Tower.

The tokens which are unique to this edition are a pewter mug of beer with a frosty head on it, a pretzel, a baseball glove, a snowman, a sailboat, and one other item (not sure about which one it was)...

Peruse Water Street, sail in Lake Michigan, visit the zoo, or BOWL! All centered around a nice graphic of the tower of Milwaukee's historic City Hall.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Pyramyz
description:
In Pyramyz players will be tranported to a silent arena of minimalist appearence. In this strange place we see portals of energy that seem to connect with another reality and give rise to mysterious colored pyramidal shapes that float. These pyramids move controlled by an invisible force to dominate areas of this strange and unusual place of combat and strategy.

Pyramyz is an abstract game of area control. It is for 2 players and use D4 like pieces. In each round, the players must put new dices in board OR move dices that are already in play; The idea is let dices of same color orthogonally connected because that way they "lock" and the players earn points.

One player plays with the black color and the other with the white color. When the dice lock orthogonally to bind the points are distributed according to the number of the dice and the color of space it occupies. A movement based in "jumps" by rows of dices and the special areas of launch granted many strategies and new high gameplay in Pyramyz.

name: Star Wars: Episode I – Electronic Lightsaber Duel Game
description:
The duel for Naboo rages on! It's Darth Maul vs. Qui-Gon Jinn in a one-on-one lightsaber duel to the finish...the turning point in the battle for Naboo and the galaxy beyond!

Deep inside the Theed Royal Palace you face your foe. Grip the handles and your figures come alive. Lightsabers ignite. The duel begins!

You thrust! You slash! You spin and block! You clash! Your swords flash and crackle with every blow. Hit your rivals head—and send him flying! You survive!

Use the Force—and keep your head!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Science Fiction

name: Redshirts 2: Leprechaun's Revenge
description:
Leprechaun's Revenge is an expansion for what is simply the bestest and most funnest card game in the world, Redshirts.

Redshirts is a fast paced screw-your-buddies style card game for 2 to 6 players. Technically you can play with more, if you have extra cards from expansion sets.

Redshirts is a card game set in a universe similar to, but legally distinct from, many sci-fi franchises. The goal is to be the first player to run out of crewmen because everyone knows the captains of boring voyages don't get promotions. You do this by sending them on missions they are not trained for, taking away vital equipment at the last second, and occasionally, just shooting them in the back and shoving them out an airlock.

Redshirts 2: Leprechaun's Revenge is an expansion, offering a new set of cards, featuring the evil protagonist, Leprechaun. (Don't worry, there's lots of other stuff in there too.)

name: Banana Bandits: SPIEL 2016 Promo Cards
description:
Banana Bandits: SPIEL 2016 Promo Cards is a pack of five promotional cards for Banana Bandits produced by Capstone HK for giveaway at SPIEL 2016. Three types of cards are included in this pack:


Free to Move x1 — The active player can move to any unoccupied window on the building.
Return Coin x2 — All other players hang one of their collected gorilla coins onto the window from which they are currently hanging.
Press Down x2 — The active player can move any one gorilla in a straight line down to the first floor, hanging a gorilla coin on each window that gorilla passes over in the process.
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Push Your Luck

name: The Marching Cats
description:
In the memory game The Marching Cats (ネコのマーチ), you start the game by playing out the cards face down on the table. The deck consists of black, green, and gray cats (six each), blue and red cats (three each), golden cats (four), and eight music notes.

On a turn, you reveal a card, then stop and collect that card or reveal another card. If you reveal a type of card that's already been shown, then your turn ends, you collect nothing, and all revealed cards are laid face-down again. If you stop before this, you collect the revealed cards except for a revealed note card, which is turned face down again. If you collect a blue and red cat, thereby reuniting the lovecats, you score 2 points; if you collect a pair of matching cats, you score 1 point. Golden cats are wild and can be paired with any color. You cannot use the same blue cat to score for both lovecats and a pair.

The first player to score 8 points wins. You can do this solely by collecting cats, but another possibility is to start your turn by saying "Note atsume" ("Collecting notes), then reveal only note cards — which are worth 1 point each — until you have a total of 8 points between cats and notes, thereby winning the game; if you flip anything other than a music note (i.e., a cat), your turn ends and you must hide those notes once again, while giving the cat card to the player on your left. Hope you didn't make them win!

name: The Good Life
description:
If you've ever wanted to go 'self-sufficient', here's your chance to give it a try... Use your wheelbarrow to move around the board to collect fruit, vegetables, pigs and chickens. The winner is the first to fill their garden and allotment with the most produce and animals. Seems simple. It is. But the 'Green Fingers' cards turn up unexpected twists and turns. So you'll have to protect your chickens from foxes, sell your crops and livestock at the village fair, and avoid drought, bird flu, and your animals escaping. Now, are you ready for The Good Life? The Good Life board game is great fun for children, but can also be played and enjoyed by adults. There are lots of interesting, funny, and 'eye-opening' facts that players will learn along the way as they play the game. 'The Sunday Times' received a pre-production copy of the game, and have given a great quote to use: "Don't encourage kids to become greedy bankers with Monopoly - keep them green with this Good Life game."

—description from the publisher

name: Monopoly: Call of Duty Black Ops
description:
Played like traditional Monopoly.

Includes Custom COD themed gameboard, tokens, money, Chance/Community Chest cards etc. Play as Intel Case, RC-XD, Dragon Fire, Capture the Flag icon, Attack Dog, or Firebreak’s Helmet.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement, Trading

name: Scene It? Marvel
description:
The basic Marvel Scene It?

Comes in a 'cardboard' box' and not a tin like the deluxe version.

As with other Scene It? games, the object is to travel around the board and get to the end. Finishing with an 'All Play To Win' before all others. If that should fail, each round is a series of questions that get increasing easy as others get a chance to catch up.

Contents
DVD
Game Board
Six sided movement die number one to six
eight sided category die
4 metal player pieces
4 category reference cards
30 'Buzz' Cards
160 Trivia Cards

The game requires that you supply the TV and DVD Player.

The Categories:
My Play - current player gets a question from the DVD
All Play - All Players race to be the first to correctly answer question from DVD
Triple Threat - Answer a trivia question based on three clues
Screen Test - Answer a 'movie' trivia question
Power House - Answer a 'comic' trivia question
'buzz' - draw an 'action' card
Player's Choice - Choice one of the three trivia categories or My Play.

Alternate rules for Longer Games, Shorter Games and 'Party Play'
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Salla 1941: A Fight to the Finnish
description:
Brigade-Regiment level. The first Axis attempt to break the Murmansk Railway in the Summer of 1941. Uses combat sequencing to simulate the fog-of-war.

100 counters, 11 x 17 map, 8 pages of rules.

name: B-Daman Crossfire Break Bomber Battlefield
description:
Players must master power, speed, and precision to keep up with the frenetic marble shooting play in the B-Daman Break Bomber Battlefield arena, inspired by the B-Daman Season 1 TV series. Players start on opposite sides as they shoot at the rows of blocks in the center of the arena. Blasting away yellow blocks reveal red blocks. The player that blasts three out of five red blocks into the opponents’ territory wins.

The B-DAMAN figures are definitely toys of this generation. They are tied-in with the B-DAMAN Crossfire TV series; there are QR codes on the figures, and an associated app is available, so you can continue the battle online. Yet, even with all these new twists, it is still a classic marble shooter battling game at its core.

Set includes one deluxe target unit with 25 blocks, completely enclosed arena walls, two B-Daman figures, two B-Daman Wide Magazine Accessory pieces, 1 customization tool, 16 B-Da Marbles, 4 Ultra B-Da Marbles, 2 collector cards, a sheet of consumer-applied labels, and instructions. Each of the Wide Magazine accessories takes ten marbles at a time, so players can do less loading and more blasting.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Collectible Components, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Moose Quest
description:
In Moose Quest, you help your moose herd migrate, while maintaining their numbers against predators and the terrain you attempt to cross. The more dangerous the terrain, the more it's worth. Each player heads a herd, and attempts to take the most valuable course to Green Pastures.

The trek is represented by a deck of cards with Green Pastures at the bottom. There is also a moose deck from which your herds may grow. Occasionally (upon rolling doubles), you will have a "moosehap": These may be immediate events, or predators you can save to unleash on a competing herd.

name: Sherlock Kids
description:
From the back of the box:
Time and time again precious paintings keep disappearing in the art museum. And each time a mysterious envelope with a picture riddle is left behind. Fortunately the Sherlock Kids are there to put a stop to the bold thief's game. Only those endowed with bright brains, good observation and memory skills are admitted as members of the Sherlock Kids club and can join in the chase for the thief. By setting cunning questions and getting the right answers from the other players the thief of the paintings will soon be tracked down!
A communicative memory game.

Mechanism: Players take turns submitting riddles. To submit a riddle, randomly take one of the colourful drawings and let everybody take a good look at it. Then cover the picture and ask a question to which the answer is a colour. The other players then mark their answer on a rotating disk and simultaneously reveal their answers. On a correct answer, you may move your pawn one step in the direction of the thief. The riddle submitter scores a point if at least one player gives the correct answer and at least one player gives a wrong answer. The game ends after a set number of rounds or when a player reaches ("catches") the thief.

A variation included in the game lets you put riddles where the answer is a number.
Other questions are also possible, but this requires pen and paper to write down the answers. Players can also supply their own drawings or photographs to ask questions about.

name: Fraggle Rock Game
description: A Milton Bradley and Jim Henson game, inspired by the children’s TV show Fraggle Rock. Using a cardboard spinner you must pick up a postcard in Doc's Workshop and visit the Trash Heap and then jump in to the Swimming Hole. First one to do all that wins the game.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Ferkelei
description:
Players do essentially two things in Ferkelei: Shift their portfolios of stock in show pigs, and play cards to award prize money to pigs (or cause them to lose money or not to win). Many stock-based games have these features, but this game has a significant bandwagon effect. As one color of pig became active, many players would accumulate its stock, and the stockholders would naturally do things that helped each other, without forming explicit alliances. Then the color would play out, or other players would quash it or play the negative pig, and the game would move on to another color. The effect is like successive waves of popularity being washed out or dashed.

More about the mechanics for those who are interested: On each turn, the player may exchange one stock chip for another or buy one. (At the start, nobody has cash to buy, so they only have their initial two chips available for exchange.) Then the player plays as many cards of one color as they like (from zero to five, except zero is not allowed if one has five or the draw pile is empty). Playing the cards can cover up competing pigs and/or bring one's favored pig to the fore, awarding it prizes depending on how far it has reached and how many times it appears on the board.

Re-implemented by:


Merchants, with a number of changes
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Stock Holding

name: Reigns at War
description:
Back of the Box:

Players are rulers of rival kingdoms. Everyone wants to develop its power to the best of his ability and at the same time undermine and thwart the plans of the rival.

Each player, during the game, will build five stacks of cards in front of his/her, one representing each facet of his/her reign:

- Buildings
- Army
- Espionage
- Commerce
- Knowledge

For each category there are three types of cards:

- Score cards (points)
- Attack cards (delete the score cards)
- Defence cards (protect from the attack)
Some Attack and Defence cards don’t belong to a specific category, but have instead show a jester(Mercenary). Those cards can be played on any of the five stacks, to the player’s will.

The game ends when a player has a score card in the top of each category, or when a player's deck is empty.

Each player sum all valid score cards and the extra points earned by combinations. Who have more points is the winner.

(by automatic translator from Chinese)

WZY 2010 Board Game Awards - Best 2-Player Game (China)

name: Seven-Handed Poker
description:
Seven-Handed Poker is a clever little way to play poker! This game requires a single deck of playing cards and seven poker chips.

In Seven-Handed Poker, players play any amount of cards from their hands. The player with the better poker hand wins the round. After each round, players always draw three cards regardless of how many cards they just played. Hand sizes will grow and shrink depending on how many cards a player plays each round.

name: Vem vet mest?
description: A board game version of a quiz show on Swedish television. A player can either choose to answer a question themselves (after hearing its category) or choose to give it to someone else (and then score points if they can't answer it).

name: バイバイレミング (Bye-Bye LEMMING)
description:
The Lemmings were getting too comfortable where they lived.
There were too many Lemmings because they have been eating too much.
Now, there was no food left so the Lemmings decided to leave and try and find a new place to live.

Timing is important especially when starting out on a journey. When one Lemming starts out other Lemmings will follow, because they have the same instincts. The object of the game is to be the first to send out all your Lemmings.

—description from the publisher

name: Tacopocalypse
description:
Serve up the best (mutated) foods in the fast-paced drafting game Tacopocalypse. Build combo plates that need to be sold before they eat you, and always be ready to scramble for the Wasteland's best condiments. Push your luck to score big, but beware the monstrous Chalupacabra!

In more detail, each turn players select a food card from their hand. All players reveal their cards simultaneously and either begin a combo plate or add to their already existing one. A player's combo plate must consist of all the same or all different food cards. If a card is played that cannot be added, then the combo plate is discarded without scoring it.

When any two players play the same food card, all players attempt to grab a condiment card. Will you get Nuclear Hot Sauce to enhance your plate, make your opponents fill up on Chips & Dip, or unleash the Dreaded Monstrous Chalupacabra? There is always one fewer condiment cards on the table than the number of players. These cards allow for greater scoring, opponent bashing, and multiple scoring options. Players then score any combo plates they wish, then pass their hand to the player on their left. This draft-and-play continues until the hands run out. Play as many rounds as you wish, then the player with the highest score wins!
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Defiant Holland
description:
Defiant Holland: The German 18th Army's Conquest of the Netherlands covers the German 18th Army attack on Holland in May 1940. Players may choose to use historical Orders-of-Battle or may employ "what-if" situations in which France, Belgium and/or Great Britain send reinforcements to assist the vastly out-manned and out-gunned Dutch.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 12 hours
Hex: 5 miles / 8 kilometers
Units: Battalion to Brigade

Game Inventory:
One 22 x 34" full color map
One dual-side printed countersheet (228 1/2" counters)
One 6-page Defiant Holland rulebook
One cover sheet/folder

Solitaire Playability: High
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 4-15 hours

name: Terre Pirates
description:
Terre Pirates is set between the 17th and the 18th centuries, during the golden age of piracy. This era saw the birth of the most renowned captains, famous for their incredible feats. Here are gathered the pirates that made their marks on history: some were great fighters or great adventurers, others relied on cunning to reach their goals. Choose your captain and play with your very own deck of action cards to get the advantage. Manage your hand by drawing weapons, items, movement and cannon fire cards. The seas being full of dangers and opportunities, take advantage of the fair winds but beware of storms, the Royal Navy and the Kraken. What will be your strategy? Brutal, quick, opportunistic or crafty? Get the most treasures, and bring them back to the capital!

In Terre Pirates, a card-driven game, each player embodies one of six famous pirates, such as Blackbeard, Anne Bonny and Bartholomew Roberts.
