2.Move your ships and/or place agents
3.Bribe stars (to conquer them), battle over stars or build ships.
The object of the game is to be the last surviving player or the player with the most stars and resources wins.
mechanics: Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Domina
description:
Domina is a traversal game by noted New Zealand game and puzzle designer Karl Scherer. The object is to get one of your pieces to the opposite end of the board before your opponent does the same.

The board is an 8x8 square grid, and the pieces are rectangles in two colors, seven for each player, each spanning two square spaces. Dominos in two colors on a standard Checker board work well. On a turn, a player pins one end of any of his/her pieces, then rotates it 90° clockwise. If, and only if, that would cause the rotating end of the piece to occupy a space that is either already filled, off the board or behind the pivot end of the piece, continue rotating the piece another 90° to 180°. Likewise, continue rotating another 90° to 270° if the next target space is unavailable or illegal. If none of the three target spaces make a legal move, the player must select a different piece to move. The first to land one end of a piece on the opposite row wins.

name: Innamoramento e Amore
description:
A game from Francesco Alberoni's Book.
This game explores human interaction from falling in love to marriage and betrayal..
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Great Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade Game
description:
Illustrator Gerry Olin Greengrass loved a parade so much she decided to create a board game to hold onto the feeling year-round. Game enthusiasts now get to join in the fun with the release of The Great Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade Game. As in the annual Macy's march down Broadway, Santa Claus takes center stage. The player (two to four can compete) whose Santa travels the entire parade route and enters the Herald Square store first wins. Depending on the roll of the dice — and the float or balloon square landed on — game pieces move forward or loss ground. "Surprise cards" keep the action going.

Greengrass enjoys playing the game with her 4-year-old grandson, but says she'll be out on the real parade route again this holiday.

name: Baston: La Rue – extension n° 1
description: The one (and only) expansion for Baston, featuring street map boards, new cardboard figures, new weapons (nunchakus and trash can lids), a phone booth and 6 new scenarios.
mechanics: Action Points, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Damals & Heute: Selecta Nobile
description:
[Translated roughly from web pages]

A version of the the memory game for older participants than the classic game. Players try to find matches of tiles that have an association between two objects. One of the tiles is from a historical perspective and one from contemporary times. The play is meant to invoke discussions about the associations and provide a learning experience for those involved.

name: The Great Boer War Board Game
description:
Game of the Second Boer War commencing October, 1899.

Game comes in a small 9" x 6 1/2" x 7/8" box with a cover illustration of a well-dressed Victorian family playing a map-and-pin flags boardgame of the war.

The cardstock hex map measures 16 1/2" x 11 5/8" and depicts the region of conflict running from cape Town and Port Elizabeth in the south to Mateking in the west, the Rhodesian border in the north and the port of Lourenco Marques in the east.

Map has one-inch hexes featuring Clear, Hill, Railway, River, and Mountain terrain plus economic centers and ports. The mounted, pre-cut 3/4" counters featuring forty green Boer Commandos of various strengths, Command Flags (three per player), two Natives, thirty-five "Gold" (Supplies), twenty red British Infantry brigades, twelve red British Cavalry brigades, and five red British Garrisons plus a Turn Marker. Two D6 are also included.

Unit counters feature, as appropriate, a drawing of a Boer horseman firing at the gallop, native shields, national flags, British lancer, British infantry, and a field gun with crew (for garrisons). Counters include deployment location or turn of appearance, combat strength, and movement allowance. Historical unit identifications are also included.

Normal game length is fifteen turns (victory determined by holding the most economic production centers) or, optionally, thirty-six turns (pursuing the bittereinder to the last counter; if one survives to the end, the Boers win).

Rules cover reinforcements, the British War Chest, Natives, Neutrals, Railways, Sea and Off-map Movement, Multi-hex combat, Sieges, and the assymetrical nature of opposing forces.

Movement is handled in a distinctive way. Each turn, Boer and British players alternate placing a "flag" on the map (numbered between One and Six). After placement, players alternate moving units adjacent to these flags. Units must stop if they move adjacent to a hostile unit. Following this "Consolidation Movement," Combat occurs.

After Combat, surviving units may engage in "Dispersal Movement," which is the opposite of Consolidation Movement. Movement to and from flags takes place sequentially in the order of numbered flags.

Optionally, players may place their flags simultaneously rather than sequentially; in this instance, players plot the hex number where each flag will be placed. Another option allows for random flag draws from a cup.

Combat is determined by odds ration and a singld D6 die roll. The resulting number indicates the "Butcher's Bill" imposed upon either the S (smaller force) or L (larger force) engaged. Losses are in units removed; the Boer player may retreat in lieu of taking losses if his units may retreat the full amount (one or two) and not move next to any British or native unit. "Gold" (supplies) may not retreat and may be captured.

name: Hyborian Risk
description:
Hyborian Risk is an unofficial Risk variant, themed to Robert E. Howard's Hyborian Age world of Conan the Cimmerian. It was designed by Lewis Pulsipher, and published as an article in the Space Gamer number 37 (March, 1981), pages 16-17.

In addition to the map, Hyborian Risk includes variant rules for initial placement, stacking, reinforcements, and leaders (including Conan and the wizard Thoth-Amon).

Expands

Risk
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Variable Set-up

name: Mike Mulligan and His Steam Shovel Dig It! Action Game
description:
From the publisher:
Join Mike Mulligan and his steam shovel, Mary Anne, in their race to dig a cellar in just one day. Use your steam shovel flippers to fling pieces of dirt into the back of the Popperville Trucking Company truck. Each time your dirt hits its mark, another Popperville towns person joins your crowd to watch you dig. The first player to collect a crowd of 5 Popperville people wins!

name: Word Master
description:
Word Master is the perfect crossword-style game for having fun with words. It can be played anywhere, and with any number of people. The box includes all game components, plus a book with easy-to-follow rules and quick-reference anagram lists. Includes: 5 lettered dice, 200 magnetic letter tiles, game board and book of rules.

The game is won by having the highest score. Each word scores 1 point + 1 point per letter + any bonuses.

name: The Battle of the Bulge: Panzers in the Snow
description:
This is a Japanese wargame about the Battle of the Bulge 1944.
It was mostly called "SS Bulge" because there are many games of the same name.

This game was firstly published as one of the Series: SS (Sho-Kikaku) in 1990.
Republished in Command Magazine Japan #46 in 2002, along with D-Day.

Designed by Yasushi Nakaguro.
publishers: Kokusai-Tsushin Co., Ltd. (国際通信社), Sho-Kikaku

name: Gnaqush
description:
It’s not just the nickname of the game’s designer – it’s what you’ll do with your teeth as your carefully-laid plans get thwarted and blocked over and over again in this strategic Icehouse game for 4 players.

Original game design and concept by Nash, with additional modifications and variants by The Monday Night Games Group.

Object: Promote your one-pip pieces up to two-pip pieces, then three-pip pieces – eventually promoting the three-pip pieces to Nirvana. The first player with all pieces in Nirvana wins.

You Need

* One Icehouse stash for each player. Each player must have a different color.
* A chessboard.
* (optional) – 16 blocker tokens to fill spaces to modify the board for two or three players.

Normal Play: On your turn you can Jump over an adjacent piece or Slide (Move) one of your valid pieces Move to an adjacent square. When you move a piece or stack into a space occupied by another piece or a stack of pieces, you must cap that stack with the piece(s) you moved.

Ascension: If one or more of your pieces is in your goal square at the end of any turn and your home square is vacant, you must remove one of your pieces from your home square. Set it on its side in front of you, off the board. Put a piece that’s one pip larger point up in your home square. If the piece you removed was a three-pip piece, it has ascended to Nirvana – do not put a piece in your home square.

Winning: If you’re the first player to send your last three-pip piece to Nirvana, the game ends and you win.

Download the full rules plus variants to the rules here:
http://www.invisible-city.com/play/271/gnaqush

name: Meeple Fling!
description:
It's that time again! Unity Games is here and all the meeples are ready to party! They're gathering for a day of wining, dining, and dicing. You're the host and you have to decide how many and which ones to invite. Do you want an exclusive party where only select meeples are welcome? Or do you want a wild riot of a party where everybody is welcome? Each has its merits and both are subject to unwelcome party crashers. The player who has the most valuable party at the end of the game wins.

The game was designed for and given to attendees of Unity Games X on January 21, 2006.

name: Pictionary: After Dinner Mint Edition
description:
Like the classic Pictionary game. The team must guess the word that their team mate is drawing.
The spin is that the game is played with mints - each correct guess earns the team a chocolate. The team with the most chocolates at the end wins.

name: Steady Eddie
description:
Eddie is a plastic seal with a spring balanced on his nose. On top of the spring is a large plastic ball with holes in it.

The instructions include several different Steady Eddie game variations. All however basically involve placing small plastic pick-up sticks in the holes in the ball without causing any sticks to fall.
publishers: Funfair Games, John Sands Pty Ltd, Milton Bradley

name: Kaaaos
description: The players aim at trading the best series of cards from their opponents during a 30 second trading window, where everybody is taking part at the same time. So a lot of noise. If you get the wrong cards you'll have to go backwards on the board.

name: Legends Of Hockey
description:
Both players move their hockey players' cards along the "ice" (game board) to set up shots, check other players, incur penalties, avoid offsides, pass the puck, etc. Everything capable in a real hockey game. Includes 90 accurately portrayed ice hockey all-stars from throughout NHL history to the present.

Contents:
1 - Game board (in three sections)
90 - Hockey player cards (54 forwards, 25 defensemen, 11 goaltenders)
4 - Six-sided dice
12 - Card stands (Two sets of 6)
1 - Puck
1 - Set-up & Summary sheet
1 - Rules sheet
1 - Cover sheet
1 - Dry erase marker

name: Rain Forest Frog Jam Game
description: Each player has four moves to move all three of his frogs or any combination of his frogs. Frogs are moved onto tokens. Tokens are then flipped to reveal picture of a particular frog predator. The number of tokens flipped gives the player the same number of chances to match the token to other tokens. Players keep tokens when two match. Players can land their frogs on opponent's frogs and send them back to their starting corners. When all tokens are gone, the player with the most matches wins.

name: Aristo
description:
From the back of the game box:
Contents: Original plastic playing board plus 64 two sided (yellow and green) playing pieces, plus game instructions.

Aristo - The Game

The AIM - to try to end the game with a majority of your color pieces on the board. Aristo is a game of wits. You have to outwit your opponent, overturn as many of his pieces as possible in each turn and aim to cover the playing board with your color.
Sounds simple? The problem is that your opponent is trying to do exactly the same to you!!! Are your pieces blocked? Are most of the pieces on the board your opponent's color? Don't give up... one well placed piece can turn your opponent's pieces over to your color in up to eight different directions at once!!!

name: Schnecken-Schmaus
description:
Schnecken-Schmaus, also known as Snail Banquet in English, is a game for children aged 5 or older in which four small snails are competing to eat strawberries.

Players are secretly assigned a snail to race and take turns hiding a mixture of wooden cubes in each hand. Based on the guesses of the other players as to how many cubes are hidden in each hand the snails advance along the strawberry trail. The first player to collect three strawberries by winning races wins.

Components:

4 wooden snails
12 cardboard strawberry pieces
7 red cubes
4 illustrated snail cards
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Children's Game, Memory, Racing

name: Games of the World
description:
GAMES of the WORLD has been Chris's pet project at Acorn Games for years. Acorn Games has always wanted to produce a game with a solid wood board and playing pieces that allow you to play a multitude of games. They have gathered together four classic games from around the world and have designed four of their own games that can all be played on a classic "Alquerque" board.

They found some games which use 12 or less pieces of each color that can all be played on the same board. Next they set out to design a series of new games which use the same pieces and board but have either more modern moves or conditions of victory to make them appeal to today’s game players.

The classic games that you will find in the book are;

Alquerque("Alquerque" is a Checkers variant) from Spain
Seega("Seega") from Africa and Egypt
Cercar La Liebre(similar to "Catch the Hare") also from Spain
Five Field Kono("Five Field Kono") from Korea

The new games from Acorn Games in the book are;

"Fortress", a "condition" game
"Centaurs", a "replacement" game
"Troop", another replacement game
"Neutrino", another condition game

In a "Replacement Game" the players are each trying to get from
their starting point to where their opponent started out from.
Sort of like in "Chinese Checkers"

In a "Condition Game" the players
are trying to be the first player to DO something. This may be to
get something like getting 3-in-a-row as in TicTacToe but not
mattering WHERE on the board you achieve this.

Solid wood construction and pieces as well as a clearly written rule book with diagrams make this a sure bet with teachers and game players alike.

Not described but playable with the included board of the board game collection as well: "Bagh Bandi", Bagh Chal from Nepal, and Fanorona Dimy (a Fanorona variant on a five times five board) from Madagascar. Rules available in BGG.

name: Flip Flop Faces
description:
From DrToy.com

"This is a combination bean bag toss and silly faces that become targets that flip when you hit them the right way. The child will build their eye/hand coordination, depth perception, and accuracy as they toss plus they will learn math skills as they keep score. There are six target cups and six bean bags. The product also promotes gross motor skills and visual thinking. When the child is playing with this kind of game they are learning how to master playground games, sports and learning to take turns. It encourage the child to position their body and focus on throwing and social skills."
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: Opus
description: Opus is the third of the larger box games published by Pseudon. It is a musical game where players must match cards showing styles of music in the right combinations to score points. The board is quite nice-looking with spaces for cards on the top and musical staffs below that identify the combinations to be made.

name: Glückstreffer
description: Glückstreffer ("Lucky Strike") is a Yahtzee variant, which makes use not only of usual dice numbers, but also of the colors they show. Every dice is printed with 1 red, blue, yellow and green side plus 2 sides in black. Accordingly, there are 6 dice used instead of the normal 5, so that it's possible to throw a row from 1-6 in every color.

name: Trio Trio
description: A wooden abstract where players use multi-colored stones and try to create sets of three through clever movement.

name: Trigammon
description:
Backgammon for 2 to 6!

In a 3 player game: Each player has 15 “stones”. These stones are played from the slots and are brought onto the “Bear In Table” according to dice rolls.

The object of Trigammon is to move your stones from the slots to the “Bear In Table” then around the game board to the “Bear Out Table” and then off before your opponents can.

There are variations for 2 to 6 players.

name: KootiKooti
description:
KootiKooti is an addictive, strategic interactive game that is played with 2.5” flexible rubber game pieces. Using a finger to nudge or flip their KootiKooti, 2 to 4 players take turns, using their skill and judgment to try and ‘pin down’ their opponents KootiKooti to win the round.

Series 1 comprises 50 unique designed colorful game pieces for kids to collect and trade.

name: Space Shuttle
description:
Each player is commanding a space shuttle spacecraft with a mission to collect data (planet cards) from each planet and return to the launch pad. The first player to collect all 9 planet cards and returns to Earth is the winner.
Equipment: Game Board, 4 playing pieces, pair of dice, 36 planet cards, 20 quasar cards, 20 pulsar cards.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Scoop: The Newspaper Game!
description:
Scoop was one of Western's games distributed by Leisure Home Parties, which apparently was an early attempt at a home party sales approach to games. It has nothing to do with the Waddingtons/Parker Brothers game of the same name.

In this game, each player represents a newspaper trying to fill its front page, represented by a 6x8 grid. Players move around the main board buying, auctioning, and trading stories, which are thin tiles in four different sizes. The stories must be placed upright on the newspaper boards and must fit together without overlapping. Some stories have events on them, and all have fake headlines and leads.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: The Nobel Game
description: Nobelspelet is a Chutes and Ladders type of game with humorous (but still somewhat realistic) depictions of the steps in a scientific career. Players roll a golden six-sided die and move along the path from birth to the Nobel prize. Good rolls move you ahead fast, poor rolls give you long detours or move you backwards. Ironically (or not!) this game to win the Nobel prize requires no skill. Published jointly by the Nobel Prize Museum in Stockholm, and Alga in Vittsjö, in honour of the 2001 Centennial of the Nobel prize.

name: Poker For Lovers
description: Directions: Each player gets 30 chips: blue chips go to the guy; pink chips are for the woman. Each set of colored chips is segmented into 3 sets (10 each) of 1, 2, and 3-minute activities. Play starts when each player antes up a corresponding minute chip and 5 cards are dealt (a 1-minute ante must be matched by another 1-minute ante and so on). As play progresses, each player may elect to call, raise, or fold. Players bet by choosing among the chips that contain the activities that they would be willing to perform in the event they lose. At showdown, the player with the best poker hand will get to receive all of the chip activities that were bet from the other player. For example, if the guy wins the hand, the woman must now perform all of the activities contained on the pink chips that were bet into the pot. When you ante up, you are not deciding what you want done to you; you are choosing what you will do for your partner. This way, players own comfort level will dictate how 'hot' things get. Choose your own variation of poker or stick with the standard 5-card draw. Poker rules and a hand-ranking sheet are included.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Variable Player Powers

name: Zig Zaggle
description: This game uses letter tiles to form words on a grid. Players start with 3 wildcards each and 9 letter tiles. After playing a word, a player draws tiles back to a total of 12. The tiles are colored and there are bonuses for using only one color in a word and laying it in the section of the board of that color. The playing area is cross-shaped, with each arm of the cross a different color. The center section contains dual color areas. Words are played trying to reach the end of an arm for a bonus. Once the bonus is awarded, play is towards the next arm of the cross. once the fourth bonus is taken, the game ends and highest score wins.

name: Insider Dealing
description:
From the rules:
"Insider Dealing is a fun boardgame which recreates all the excitement of dealing - legal and illegal! - in the Stock Exchange."

The object of the game is to make it back to the start square with £1 million. As you would expect, players hope to make profits by buying and selling shares in one or more of six companies whose prices can rise or fall dramatically during the course of the game. Share prices are affected by several means.
1 - Market Information cards. These have immediate effect on one (or more rarely all) companies once a player lands on a particular square
2 - The Stock Exchange. Players select a company in which they have a minimum holding and roll dice to determine the extent and direction of the share price of that company.
3 - Inside Information cards. The most fun, these cards can be kept by players and played at the most advantageous moment. For example, by raising a share price immediately before you sell, or dropping it as you want to buy (or your opponents sell!).

This UK game was released at the height of the yuppie, 'greed is good' period in the late 80's.

name: Spot Cash
description: Each player secretly places his collection of tiles face down on a triangular board. The covered half of the tiles have different colors and different denominations. Each denomination must be placed in a certain pattern on the board. Players then turn over the tiles on other boards, earning a multiple of the denomination. Red tiles score for the player who turned over the tile, black tiles score for the player who owns the tile. Each turn ends when a black tile is uncovered. The game ends when all tiles have been uncovered, and the player with the most money wins. This is an interesting but (seemingly) forgotten game from one of the largest publishers. The game is similar to Battleship, but with much more depth.

name: Tee Time Golf
description:
A dice-and-chart simulation of golf. From the publisher's we site:

Tee Time Golf is a shot-by-shot golf simulation that allows you to coach the sport's greatest historical golfers, as well as today's best, over 18 holes on the world's premier golf courses. Professionals and some amateurs are available for purchase and they are rated using the same criteria. Golfers from the U.S., European, and Japanese professional tours are represented.

name: Detectives
description:
London 1905. Alan Baddy, sinister and evil character, greatest exponent of organized crime, tenaciously chased by Scotland Yard for his terrible misdeeds, has gone back to his old ways. Which detective will first locate the building where Alan Baddy committed the crime, finding the incriminating proof?
In this deductive game, first who plays Alan Baddy is randomly determined, the rest will play the astute detectives. The one playing Alan Baddy´s role will have to prepare the other elements of the game: decide in which building (11 pubs, restaurants and hotels altogether) the crime was committed, and assign the incriminatory proof (fingerprint, footprint and ring) of his crime to one of the buildings. All buildings will contain proof, but only one will contain the relevant ones with the required features.
During the game the detectives will have to search the different buildings on the board gathering clues in every one of them and making notes of them in their "Detective Notes" sheets, followed by Alan Baddy who'll do everything in his/her power to frustrate their quest.
The winner is that player who discovers in which building the crime was committed, contributing the proof which corroborates his/her hypothesis.

name: Don't Cut the Cheese
description:
The trap is set with a paper strip of cheese. Each player spins the spinner to determine how many times they must perforate the cheese with the mouse hole-punch.
When the cheese strip breaks every player other than the one who cut the cheese draws a cheese token from the pile.
The player who collects all three colored cheese tokens wins.

name: Paks
description: Paks is a card game of connections and combinations featured in Sid Sackson's A Gamut of Games. The game can be played by two, three, four, or six players. When played by four or six, the gameplay is divided into two teams and partners are seated alternately.
publishers: Dover Publications, dtv (Deutscher Taschenbuch Verlag), Hugendubel Verlag, Hutchinson, Random House, Inc., RBA Libros S.A.

name: Wizards & Warfare
description:
"Wizards & Warfare - Rules of Wargames" was one of the earliest fantasy miniatures rule sets to be published. It was heavily inspired by Tolkien's "The Lord of the Rings", and thus includes references to Treemen, Huorns, evil wizards with gunpowder, Nazgul, etc.

From the Introduction:

"Followers of Good Wizards, minions of Dark Lords, this is for you. Cowards all, why suffer the slings and arrows of abject defeat! All you can lose are your paint skins. No longer suffer the permanent scars of sorcery so that your own mothers won't know you, webbed feet, pointed ears (sorry Mr. Spock) and other aids to charm and elegance. See no more your followers disappear in a puff of smoke or vanish with the light of day - just put them away until next time, etc., etc., etc. This is for you, a representation of those days of long, long ago. Fight the Men of the West, defeat the powers of darkness in safety on a wargames table. By the wizardry of Miniature Manufacturers the forces of Dark and Light are reduced to 1/75th their full size. At least, manageable Treemen! Read on for further enlightenment."
publishers: Heritage Models, Inc., Leicester Micromodels Ltd.

name: The Sword in the Forest
description:
"The Sword in the Forest" is a French and Indian War variant / expansion for "The Sword and the Flame". It is a skirmish level miniature war game. It is generally played with 25 or 28 mm figures.

The Game uses a card initiative system, where each side is assigned a color in a deck of cards and acts upon it being drawn. Play proceeds players moving unit after unit. Once movement ends, play proceeds to shooting.

Expands:

The Sword and the Flame
categories: Age of Reason, American Indian Wars, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
publishers: And That's The Way It Was...

name: Storm Over Sekigahara
description:
This is a Japanese area movement wargame on the battle of Sekigahara using the Storm over Arnhem system.

192 counters

Total of 10 turns.

name: Aussie Rules Super Subsistence Farmer
description: Players compete to be the first one to make 15 dollars by planting and harvesting over 20 different varieties of crops in this educational card game.

name: Buckle For Your Dust! Wargaming in Miniature: Vietnam 1965-1973
description: Buckle For Your Dust! is a set of explanations, rules and scenario data for small unit actions (at platoon or squad level) set in the 'American' war in Vietnam. It is designed to be used with miniatures, vehicles and terrain in any scale although scales such as HO/OO, 1/72 or 20mm / 15mm are recommended. Larger scenarios may be played with scales around 1/300 or 5mm.

name: Are You Being Served?
description:
Join all of the characters from this British hit television series Are You Being Served from the 1970's in tryng to secure as much inventory for the Grace Bros. Department Store as you can. Acquire Garment cards for you department.

Captain Peacock, Mr. Humphries, Mr. Rumbold, Mr. Grainger, Mr. Lucas along with owner Mr. Grace and the pretty sales lady Ms Brahms join the irrepressible Mrs. Slocombe in trying to make Grace Brothers a successful venture.

name: Casino
description:
Casino, "The Incredible All-In-One Game", was published in the Philippines in 1981. The components is composed of a gameboard, various cards, play money, tokens, dice, and a rule sheet.

The gameboard has tracks around it wherein the tokens can traverse upon the roll of the dice just like in Monopoly. But there are subtle differences: instead of streets the tracks are mostly illustrations of different Casino-related games. When a player lands on a track with a specified game, he must play that game by placing a bet using play money and drawing the related card. The card drawn will show the "summarized" result whether the player wins money or loses them. There are also other types of tracks wherein any player who lands on them automatically loses money or gains some.

The object of the game is to win the largest amount of play money and avoid becoming bankrupt.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Express It Guess It
description:
From the Publisher's website:

Its the game where you get to express all kinds of feelings by drawing, charading and talking. Can you draw the word confused? Or act out the word sneaky? Can you say the tongue twister Peter Piper and make other people guess the word forgetful? Every correct guess you move ahead a space in the race to the finish.

name: Squaredance
description:
This 2-player game uses a unique movement mechanic of pivots. The idea is to force your opponent into a position where they cannot move.

Online Play


Super Duper Games

name: Kampen om svampen!
description: Get the most mushrooms by betting, using cards and having luck with the dice.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Balkan Gambit, 1943-1945
description:
Balkan Gambit is a military simulation exploring the alternative-historical premise that the Allied powers have chosen to invade southern Europe via Greece, Albania, and Yugoslavia in the latter half of World War II. Nothing like this actually happened, though the Allies went to great lengths to convince the Axis powers that such plans were intended in order to mislead them
as to their true intentions. Nonetheless, some Allied strategists and leaders, including Winston Churchill, believed that an invasion of Europe via the Balkans was a legitimate and war-winning activity. Hence, the game is partially a reflection of the concepts and anxieties of both sides.

Each hex on the map equals about 20 miles (about 30 km) when measured from side to opposite side. Each game turn represents 2-5 days, depending on the scenario chosen and the weather currently in effect. Every ground unit represents a division, division-equivalent, or brigade of about 5,000 to 20,000 men and/or 50 to 350 armored fighting vehicles.[...]

This game has 3 scenarios:
– Operation BOARDMAN: In summer 1943, the British 8th Army is sent to liberate Greece and Crete. This was a deception to cover Operations HUSKY and AVALANCHE, the historical invasions of Sicily and Salerno.[...]
– Operation ZEPPELIN: In summer 1944, the notional British 12th Army attacks Greece and Albania while the US 7th Army attacks in Dalmatia, in concert with Soviet amphibious operations against the coast of Rumania and Bulgaria. This plan was part of Operation BODYGUARD, the overall deception plan to disguise Operations OVERLORD and ANVIL (the invasions of northern and southern France).[...]
– Operation GELIGNITE: Actual plans were drawn up to send the British 8th Army across the Adriatic in late 1944 or early 1945 to cut off the final retreat of German Army Group F and forestall any further Soviet advances towards northern Italy. The plan was shelved due to shortages of troops and landing craft.[...]

Components: One 22" x 34" map & 280 counters

(source: rulebook and user's description)

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 2-5 days (depending on scenario)
Hex: 20 miles / 30 kilometers
Units: Brigade to Division

Game Inventory:
One 22 x 34" full color mapsheet
One dual-side printed countersheet (280 1/2" counters)
One 16-page rulebook

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 4-15

name: Stake a Homestead
description:
From box:

"In 1862 congress passed the Homestead Act. A United States citizen twenty-one years old could file a claim on 160 acres of public land which he wished to own as a home for himself and his family. If he lived there for five years, had built a house and was raising crop, he was given title to the land."

"The country was wild, the problems faced by the "sod-busters" were great. Many homesteaders gave up before five years had passed. Everyone who succeeded did so through sheer determination and by using every skill or handicraft he could master."

Players take turns drawing cards and playing them onto their Land Tracts. The cards come in 5 colors, one for each year. At the end of the game, players who have a house, crop, and 4 of the 6 other types of cards, without having the claim jumper card, win.
categories: American West, Card Game, Educational, Farming

name: Château: Vinspelet
description:
Each player starts the game in charge of a small wine trading company with contacts to wineries in three different countries. Your company is represented on the board by a wine merchant and a buyer. These pawns move around the board in hope of buying fine wines and their requisite grapes. A wine and grape combination together form an agency.
The game ends when one player has at least six agencies representing at least five different countries. But the winner is the one with the most successful company, i.e. the highest monetary value of combined resources.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Le Négocio
description:
Le Négocio is a mix of Monopoly and Trivial pursuit with a social mission : sensibilise childrens to the Fair Trade.

The objective of the game is to get 5 Fair Trade goods and 5 coffee warehouses.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Lions and Gladiators
description:
This is a dice/board game for 2 players.
You are in the Roman Coliseum fighting for life.
You player is the Gladiators and the other one is the Lions.
All you need is a 8x8 square board and 2d6.
Available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Operation Fischfang Smashing the Allies at Anzio February 1944
description:
Operation Fischfang(Fish Trap) depicts the German operation starting on Feb.16th, 1944 to destroy the Allied invasion landing at Anzio. The 76th Panzer Korps almost pushed the Allies back to the sea but was stopped by a desperate counterattack by the 6th Corps backed up by massive air and naval support. Both sides were quite exhausted by the end of the fighting.

The game has 280 counters, uses the same system as Nanawa: Verdun in the Chaco War, July 1933 complete with air and artillery rules, weather etc. 9 pages of rules.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: What's Cooking?: The Ultimate Party Game for Cooks, Foodies & Friends
description:
From the box: "Whether you're a true food fanatic or just like to cook, this party game will have everyone laughing. Each of the five categories What's cookin'?, What's a spatula?, Melting Pot, Renowned Restaurants, and Foodie First are so diverse that no matter what you're good at, each dinner guest will be a star."

A variable length party game in which two teams try their hand at the five categories:
What's Cookin'?- guess the dish from the ingredient list
What's a Spatula?- draw the specified kitchen tool and have your teammates guess
Melting Pot- Determine where a dish originated
Renowned Restaurants- Choose the city where a restaurant is located (multiple choice)
Foodie First- write down as many items that you can that within the category given.

Each team gets an equal amount of turns until the food is ready
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Recognition, Team-Based Game

name: McDonald's McNugget Buddies Masquerade Ball Game
description: 2 to 4 players Ages 3 and up each pretend to be one of the McNugget Buddies getting ready to go to the Masquerade Ball. Players practice counting as they collect pieces of their fancy costume. But hurry. If you're not home by midnight you turn back into a plain McNugget Buddy.

name: Lab Rats
description:
Build a maze and then navigate your rat (pawn), from the start of the maze to its exit, using a limited number of moves. Warning, the layout for this solitaire can take up a lot of table space; this is not one you will be playing on an airplane seat tray.

This game was an entry for the Solitary Confinement contest.

name: Super Mario Bros. Crystal Maze
description: Race a metal marble that represents Mario through a maze. You control him via a joystick in this non-electronic labyrinth maze game. You must collect 4 flags before attempting to attack Bowser in the center of the maze.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Maze, Video Game Theme

name: David Dickinson's Antique Chase
description:
What can I say about this revolutionary game. It will simply change your life. Now if you are as excited by 1920s silver ware or Edwardian style protractors, then you are in for a real treat.

So where do you begin? Let’s stsrt with the lovely design of the game, it’s full colours are in keeping with the aesthetic look of the 2003 season 75 episode 21 look of the live show. These are small nuances but actually help create the atmosphere needed to make you feel like you are living it!

I don’t want to spoil too much of the rich content. But one thing that can not be suppressed is the highlight feature of auctions. It really gets my giblets wobbling.

All I would say is go to your nearest Woolworths, blockbusters or BHS and get yourself this game. For a price of a mere 3 course meal of 9 sausage, beans and cheese melts from Greg’s, you really can not afford to miss out.

Enjoy and remember no likey no lighty.

name: Siemens Grand Prix Game
description:
A simple Formula One racing game released by the electronics manufacturer Siemens for their Formula 1 sponsorship program.

Simple and basic system with few if any nods to realism, strategy or playability.

name: Kuado
description:
Kuado is a highly tactical but quick game in which each of the 2 players tries to make a square of 4 sticks on a foundation of 4 stones in a square. The opposing player is trying to build a square of his own. Ecah player gets three moves per turn to place sticks or discs.

Contents:
10 sticks in each of two colors
18 discs (9 for each player)

name: Bait Bazi
description:
Bait Bazi is a verbal game and a genre of Urdu poetry played by composing verses of Urdu poems. The game is common among Urdu speakers in Pakistan and India.

The game starts with the first person reciting a stanza of a poem. The next player has to reply with another verse starting with the last letter of the verse used by the previous player and so on.

A verse that has already been used in a game may not be repeated. The rules used by experienced players can be more stringent, such as allowing the use of only one poet's verses or of one theme.

name: Kingsbridge Solitaire Game
description: Kingsbridge Solitaire Game comes with a board, a styrofoam card holder, two decks of small cards and a book: "150 ways to play Solitaire." The game box says that the game is for children, convalescence, vacationists, invalids, home players, and travelers.
publishers: The United States Playing Card Company

name: Skattejagten
description:
Skattejagten (or in English”The treasure hunt”) is a children’s game.
This game is an treasure hunt adventure with Bamse, Kylling, Kaj and Andrea.
(Bamse and Kylling are famous from children TV in Denmark.)
You can choose to play for either Bamse, Kylling, Kaj or Andrea. You are on an island full of dangerous animals and great obstacles.

Each time it’s you turn, you can move – either with walking, sailing or flying.

The player who first finds the treasure and returns to his home - will win the game.

name: Fisch mich
description:
Big and small anglers meet at the tin pond for the yearly angling competition. Even Andrew Angler is wielding his fishing rod.
Suddenly a green fish finger turns up and yells "Fish for me!" Andrew Angler rubs his eyes. There! A second fish finger and a red pufferfish swim toward him chorusing "Catch me! Catch me!"
But unfortunately Andrew Angler may only catch yellow fish in this angling round. So he has to be careful: as if he gets close to a wrong fish ... snap! The fish will be clinging to his fishing rod.

Who, with some skill and a bit of luck, will catch the most fish?
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Dice

name: Tesserae
description:
Inspired by ancient art, Tesserae combines elements of dominoes and jigsaw puzzles to form a game of shapes and patterns. Since it doesn't rely on a square grid, tiles will fit together in interesting and surprising ways. The basic game provides a good blend of strategy and luck, while advanced rules allow for either pure skill games, or ones where luck is more of a factor. Suitable for solitaire, one to five individual players, and several combinations of teams.

The game of Tesserae pits players against one another, meshing colored tiles into the ever-evolving play field, each trying to exhaust their supply of tiles while preventing their opponents from doing the same. Skillful strategy can pay off, but be careful -- things can change on the luck of a draw! This is a game that will stretch your brain.

name: Lucky Gnomes
description:
[From the box description]

Collecting mushrooms is fun! The one who finds the most mushrooms is a real lucky gnome.

There are red, blue, and yellow mushrooms hidden under 33 panels of tufts of grass. The players hop from tuft to tuft with three colored goblins and uncover the panels again and again. The player who can remember the the most colors finds most mushrooms and wins.

name: Pizza Pests
description: Pizza Pests-A Pizza-building Card Game for Pizza Lovers. Memory-Matching Game where cards are designed like pizza slices.

name: El joc de l'especulador
description:
El Joc de l'Especulador is a card game based in other games like Mafia, Werewolf, etc. In this edition the action takes place in a city where corrupted businessmen want to take control of the city by buying the citizen's estates.

The game is published under a Creative Commons license, and was distributed for free from the web page of the editor. Check the links for the instructions and cards!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Negotiation, Party Game, Political
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Het Grote Taalspel Frans
description:
Het Grote Taalspel Frans ('The big language-learning game French') is a boardgame for Dutch-speaking children and adults, who wants to learn French. The 20-sided dice decides to which region you have to move your pawn. You have to choose a mission in this region. There are 6 missions: figuring - drawing - writing - quiz - translating - speaking. If you're successful in this mission, you become the owner of this region. The player who has 10 regions, wins the game. During the game, you can earn action cards. Those action cards can influence the further game-process.


Het Grote Taalspel Frans is een bordspel voor nederlandstalige kinderen en volwassen die Frans willen leren. Door middel van een dobbelsteen verplaats je je pion naar één van de 20 regio's. In deze regio kies je een opdracht. De opdrachten zijn: Uitbeelden - tekenen - schrijven - quiz - vertalen - spreken. Als je de opdracht juist hebt, dan ben je (mede-)eigenaar van deze regio. Wie eerst 10 regio's bezit, is de winnaar van het spel. Gedurende het spel kan je actiekaarten verdienen die je kunnen helpen of de anderen kunnen dwarsbomen.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil

name: Royal-er Game of Ur
description:
This is an abstract strategy game played with dice and a chess board. You are trying to move your dice across the chess board (in a fixed zig-zag pattern) before your opponent has move their dice across the board in the opposite pattern. The twist comes that after you have rolled and moved a die (which can be your own OR an opponents), it is placed on the board with the rolled number up, and if you land on a die, you move again based on the number showing, but forwards if it is your opponents die, but backwards if your own.

It has feeling of inspiration from a lot of traditional/classic board/chase games, including (obviously) Ur, but also Backgammon and Parcheesi.

name: Operation Westindien
description:
Operation Westindien simulates the devastating effects of the German U-boats in the Caribbean from Feb. 16 to March 16. While Operation Paukenschlag (an upcoming ATO game) began along the US East Coast at the same time (equally devastating), a handful of U-boats, Group Neuland, were ordered to deploy in the Caribbean.

Unknown to most today, in 1942, the oil refineries at Aruba, Curacao, and Trinidad were vital in refining the oil arriving from Lake Maracaibo, Venezuela. Canada heavily relied on this oil, the US and England, also needed this oil for aviation fuel. For the Germans, it was a missed opportunity to really devastate the Allied oil and fuel production, which would have long lasting impact on the war.

Game Details:

System: Double Blind to capture the true flavor of submarine warfare (can be played solitaire), point to point movement

Counters: 280 Map: One 11x17 inch depicting the Caribbean area south of Cuba

Unique rules cover: Aircraft ASW radar, U-boat surface and sub-surface strengths and speeds, U-boat fuel limitations, Torpedo and U-boat surface attacks, Lake tankers, Cargo ships, B-18, A-20 bombers, Destroyers, ASW Ships, Landing saboteurs, Port Capacity.

Unlike every submarine game made, this game forces both players to complete different objectives. For the German, it is to sink cargo and oil tankers in demanding quantities and or destroy oil refineries, depending on orders. The German must find and sink tankers with oil cargo moving to refineries. For the Allied player, they must move their oil and cargo ships across the map. Oil tankers must land at a refinery, unload the oil, refine it, reload it and then move the tanker off the map with the oil through U-boat infested water. Cargo ships with non-oil material must also cross the map. Of course, their other objective is to use their bombers and meager ASW force to sink U-boats!

Available in both DTP and Print-n-Play

name: Velomaster
description:
Velomaster is a cycling game for 2 to 4 players. Each player manages a team of 4 cyclists with a leader. Players move using a 6-sided die and according to the type of surface they are on. A 20-sided die is used to determine the effort and the skill of the cyclists. The game besides chance also requires and tactical choices: how to position, how to try an escape, how to roll in team or make alliances.
There are basic, advanced and expert rules.

Official site: http://www.velomaster.fr
for player: http://www.velomaster.new.fr
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Zug um Zug
description:
Game consists of 120 cards, depicting 12 different train wagons.

Cardbacks show a steam locomotive.
Players try to put together trains consisting of the same sort of wagons.
Each wagon can be used as loco.
If it is a players turn, he can choose to draw 2 cards from the hidden stockpile or 1 card from the open drawpile.
Game can be ended by the player who has at least a train with 5 wagons and all other laid out with at least 3 wagons.

Trains count from the third wagon onwards, from the sixth double points.

If all this sounds familiar to anyone...(look at Express Card game by Mayfair Games!)

name: Kasserine 1943
description:
A wargame about the Battle of the Kasserine Pass. The battle was a victory of the Italo-German forces under Erwin Rommel over unexperienced American forces led by Lloyd Fredendall who was relieved after the battle.

The game uses rules of the B35 (Battles of World War II 1943-1945) system designed for dealing with medium battles of World War II. Counters represent battalions, one hex represents 1000m, one turn represents 8 hours.

name: Arrow Cubes
description:
Equipment:

* 4 x 4 board
* Two Arrow cubes -- one Red, one Black (described on the website)

Goal: Capture your opponents cube or force them to stalemate you.

Each player has a cube with arrows along the faces -- the arrow shows which side of the cube is under attack. Players take turns tipping their cubes over, trying to manoeuver into a position that will capture their opponent. A player captures their opponent when after making a legal move they are adjacent to the enemy piece and the arrow on the top face of their cube is pointing towards the enemy piece.

name: Big Brutal Basketball
description: Big Brutal Basketball (BBB) is a free card game about a basketball match between 2+ players. Play shot, offensive, and defensive cards against your opponents in a no-holds-barred game of basketball!

name: Folio
description:
Folio is an Icehouse-based abstract strategy game for two players. The rules are simple, but the strategy can get mind-bending. It owes some rule ideas to the commercially available game Quarto (thus the name).

To play you require one stack of pyramids from each of four colours plus one extra from each colour (with only two of these being of the same size). You also need a chessboard or similar 8x8 grid.

name: Field of Honour: Jousting
description: Field of Honour is a simple game depicting a medieval jousting contest. The standard game is played by two players: each plays a single knight. You may thus play the standard game (knight vs. knight), or stage a more elaborate tournament with most any number of players in a single-elimination competition. (From the intro to the game in Panzer Digest #2.)

name: APBA SuperStars Baseball
description:
Have young children? Grandchildren? Make their first game APBA SuperStars. Share your passion for sports with your desire to spend quality time with those you love most. Give SuperStars to your little All-Star!

APBA's SuperStars line, is the perfect gift for younger kids who already love board games and sports or who are just learning about both. With photos of real baseball stars on the playing cards and game pieces, a game board designed like a baseball stadium, and moves that send players around the bases in a joyful race to reach home plate (with stops for hot dogs, bats and autographs), APBA SuperStars Baseball will lead young kids right into the ballpark and right into APBA.

Colorful and easy to learn, SuperStars is designed for kids Ages 4 - 7. Have your whole family join in the fun with APBA Andy and the SuperStars. And when the kids are ready to move on to more serious baseball fun, we'll be ready for them with APBA All-Star Edition and APBA Pro-Baseball!

name: Yahtzee: Dragon Ball Z
description:
Like the classic Yahtzee game, you're rolling for various dice combinations. Match Heroes - SS Goku, SS Trunks, and SS Vegeta or Villains - Android 20, Android 17 or Frieza 5th form to earn tiles. The tiles add a different twist to the game, influencing your strategy plan. They may provide you with Dragonball Z Radar or give you an extra roll or two of the dice. You could even lose tiles to Perfect Cell. Pick a Villain tile and you'll have to battle to keep it.

The more tiles you earn, the more points you'll score. Roll Five of a Kind - that's Yahtzee, and you get to collect the Dragonball Tile along with any tiles collected by Perfect Cell. Earn the most points and you win.

This unique combination of battle, chance and strategy makes every game exciting.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mythbusters DVD Game
description:
Game contains gameboard, player tokens that are a washer, nut, wing nut, and bolt, and DVD. DVD is used to show trivia and video clips to answer.

Video clips on DVD are from the Mythbusters TV series from the Discovery Channel.
categories: Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Family Night Frenzy
description:
Family Night Frenzy is an Egyptian Ratscrew variant themed for an LDS audience.

From the publisher: Family Night Frenzy is a heart-pounding, card-slapping match and stack game for the whole family.

When the family gets together . . . things can get a little out of hand. And that’s the whole idea with Family Night Frenzy! It’s a free-for-all where everyone races to be the first to get rid of their cards by matching them and stacking them up. But you can’t stack until you’ve got a match, so keep drawing from the deck until you’ve got something to play. And don’t waste a second-this is quality time! Family Night Frenzy! A treat everyone will enjoy.

Make the treat, gather the kids, and let the frenzy begin!
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition

name: Hopse Frosch
description:
Which frog jumps the furthest?

Place all frogs in a line and place the top of the tube at a certain distance. Then each player chooses one of the 8 sticks and places that in front of his/her frog which then jumps over the stick. Did you pick the stick with the red tip? Then you have to skip a turn.

The player who jumps into the pond (the tube top) first, wins the game.

name: Scene It? To Go!: Marvel
description: All the great features of Scene It? including real Marvel movie clips, trivia questions and on-screen challenges. If you're a fan of the movies, the characters or all of the above, this DVD game will put your Marvel trivia knowledge to the ultimate test. Contains the best of Scene It? - Marvel Deluxe. Only available at Target stores.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Travel, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Dara
description:
A game from Nigeria that may be played by two players or teams. Traditionally the game was played on an area consisting of 5x6 spaces using sticks or stones for pieces.

The game begins with the players taking alternating turns placing one of their twelves pieces in an empty space. Once all of the pieces have been placed, the players alternate moving one of their pieces into an adjacent empty space. Diagonal movement is not allowed.

When a player moves a piece to cause three of their pieces to be in a row, that player may remove one opposing piece that is not part of a row of three such pieces. Players are not permitted to make a move which results in more than three of their pieces being in a row. A player wins the game when the opposing player is unable to make a a row of three pieces.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement
publishers: (Public Domain), KiwiCo, NewVenture Games, W. Forster Games

name: Lieber Nachbar
description: Each player moves 6 pawns on the board. No die is necessary because the pawns moves as far as the number of the field allows. The game is over when one player losses all of their pawns. The winner is the left neighbor of the player who has lost all pawns.

name: Passing the Buck
description:
Four forty piece jigsaw puzzles are muddled together and the pieces shared amongst the players.
Each player has a screen (like a DM screen in RPG's), with a colour picture of the Western themed jigsaw that they must race the other players to complete. Each person's puzzle is different, and so the players must swap pieces by bribery or auction style to win the pieces they need.
Because no-one can see the other players jigsaws, it becomes tense as the race to complete becomes frantic!

name: Hello Kitty Shopping Spree Game
description:
From the publisher:

The ultimate game of friendship, shopping and sharing!

It’s a party for Tippy! Shop for a new outfit and buy a birthday present with this fun and fashionable Hello Kitty® board game. You can make ATM withdrawals, borrow money from friends, get discount coupons and even take express shuttles to your favorite stores! Be the quickest shopper as you collect your dress, shoes, handbag, hair accessory and gift so you can be dressed and at Tippy’s birthday party just in time to start the celebration!

Ages 7 and up
2-4 players

name: Cookie Shapes
description: Preschooler game where players spin, draw cards, and then compete to find the cookie piece with the correct, matching shape. The spinner and game cards have no writing, so no reading is necessary. The cookie pieces are nice plastic pieces that resemble actual cookies in various shapes with various decorations.

name: Professor Noggin's Geography of Canada
description:
From sea to sea… to sea. This game is an educational experience in the world's second largest country. Learn about the provinces and territories, cities and natural wonders that make this country great!

Card_topics_include:
Agriculture
Alberta
Arctic Tundra
Bays
Biggest and Smallest
British Columbia
Canada and the World
Capital Cities
Forests
Geology
Islands
Lakes
Manitoba
Mining
Mountains
National Parks
New Brunswick
Newfoundland & Labrador
Northwest Territories
Nova Scotia
Nunavut
Oceans
Ontario
Prairies
Prince_Edward_Island
Quebec
Rivers
Saskatchewan
That's a Funny Name
Yukon
publishers: Éditions Gladius International, Inc., Outset Media

name: Takeover
description:
Takeover is a stock game for 2-6 players using a Piecepack set. Players take turns merging corporations (tiles) to increase either short-term cash gains (value-up coins) or long-term stocks that pay out at the end of the game (suit-up coins). The suit of a tile represents its industry; the value of each tile, along with the number of other tiles in its stack, represents its worth.

The rules are available on the Piecepack Wiki.

Game System

Piecepack Game System

name: Gambler
description:
“Card & Dice game for 2+ players. Each player is a Gambler trying to win Big. Victory: The Winner is the first player to accumulate $5,000. If you ever lose all your money, you lose the game.” Each player starts with $5000. Pennies or other tokens are used as money, each being worth $100.

The game uses a custom set of cards. There are five types of cards in the deck: Casino Game Bets (Black Jack, Poker, Craps, & Roulette), Race Track Bets (Dogs, Horses, Jai Alai), Sports Bets (Baseball, Basketball, & Football), Win Cards and Special Cards.

Each turn a player plays a Bet card and rolls on a 2d6 Wager Table to determine the result. Win Cards can be played to modify the result. Multiple Casino and Sports bets may be made in one turn, but Casino and Track bets may not be made in the same turn. Special cards are played at the end of a player’s turn and add $100-$600 to a player’s bankroll as determined by a die roll.

The designer notes that the game is based on the gambling practices of his father and uncles.

name: Zulu Spears
description:
"Card game. Simulates a battle between Zulu & British Troops."

One player represents the Zulu forces and the other player is the British. Each side has its own custom deck of 52 cards. Through card play the British may build fortifications, Zulu snipers can attack, and British sharpshooters can fire back.

The Zulu player also gets to decide whether or not there is a melee attack each turn. When the players do battle, the Zulu player tries to inflict casualties by playing cards having a higher total Force Value than those played by the British player.

"Zulu Victory: If all 100 of the British troops are killed than the Zulu win."

"British Victory: If the Zulu player goes to draw a card and there are no cards left in his deck and the British player still has troops remaining, than the Zulu give up and go home, and the British win."
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Post-Napoleonic, Print & Play, Wargame
publishers: Strategy Gaming Society, Warp Spawn Games

name: Eurasian Chess
description:
Eurasian Chess brings together the familiar Western chess with the chess games of China and the far east. Like Chinese chess Eurasian chess is played on intersections (lines) not on the squares. Each player has 12 pieces and 10 pawns. The pieces are King, Queen and two each of horse (knight), chariot (rook), Sage (bishop), Cannon, and Arrow

The cannon is from Chinese Chess. It moves as a Rook, except that it must jump over an intervening piece (called a screen) to capture a piece. When it doesn't capture a piece, it merely moves as a Rook.

The Arrow is the equivalent of the cannon but operates on the diagonals

The board is played with a 'river'

As a compromise with Chinese Chess, the Eurasian King may not cross the river. Like their counterparts in Chinese Chess, which may not face each other across an open vertical line, Kings in Eurasian Chess may not face each other across any open vertical or diagonal line.

name: Insel der Piraten
description:
From the publisher's website:

Find the hidden treasure

Many hidden treasures wait on that secret pirate's isle. Luckily enough, the pirates have left you a treasure-map. But it is ripped in several pieces and no one knows the correct order. Each player can only look at one piece at a time. Try to find the correct location first!

Insel der Piraten - Pirate's Isle is more than a simple game of deduction. You have to draw logical conclusions to find the possible paths. Try to mark your guess first on the map and you'll be the winner. But be careful, other player can see where you're going. There are 20 adventures to solve. The game can be played with 2 to 4 player and even with a single player!

name: Too many cooks
description:
The game is really simple.
Each player has a plastic "fry-pan" and there is a central "stove".
The fry-pans are shaped as mazed and the stove has holes with points on them.

Players drop 1-3 balls on their fry-pans and by balancing the fry-pan aim to drop the balls on the higher value holes.

name: Pirates of Van Zandt
description:
A pirate themed game for 3 to 4 players using one PiecePack (Full rules available at http://www.piecepack.org/).

Each player controls a ship full of pirates, and is allotted 2 actions a turn (to use with a list of 12 possible actions) allowing them to sail and walk around the board, trying to be the first to successfully dig up multiple pieces of treasure. To this end, they may attack the other player's pirates and even try to board opposing ships.

From the game rules introduction:
"Loose lips sink ships, and due to the loosening of several lips by a little bit of grog, several groups of pirates just realized that they've all buried their treasure near each other, in the same group of islands! Now they've all rushed out, not as much to defend their own treasure, which has no doubt been ingeniously hidden, but to unearth the booty the other groups have hidden and claim it as their own."

name: MIG (volym 3)
description:
A traditional quiz game in Swedish.

Two dice are rolled, one to decide category and one to decide if you have a 'MIG-chance'. The first player to correctly answer a 'MIG-chance' in each category is the winner.

The questions come in 5 categories: 'Now & Then', 'Culture & Showbiz', 'Home & Away', 'Sports & All sorts' and 'Nature & Science'.

The game contains 1560 questions.

name: Tokyo (fan expansion for On the Underground)
description: Because of nature of Tokyo's real metro network, the game taste is a little bit different from mother game. In the main game, a circular line bonus is critically bigger for the goal. But, in case of Tokyo map, since there's no real metro-line in northern area which run East-West, circular bonus is very limited.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Trains

name: Yami
description:
This is a funny mixture of Rami and Yams, played with four sets of 32 cards. Players try to improve their hands in order to mark points upon their counting boards. Values give less reward than combinations, but allow access to bonus. After 16 rounds, he who has most points wins.

Reimplemented by:

Yamy
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition, Secret Unit Deployment

name: World War Two Naval Wargame Rules
description: World War Two Naval Wargaming Rules by RA Ellard and JE Hammond published trough both DAVCO and Skytrex (DAVCO later merged with Skytrex). Is small (20 pages including charts) and lightweight set of rules for playing naval surface actions in the period of 1929 till 1952, the era of super-dreadnoughts, using 1/3000th miniatures from Davco/Skytrex.

name: 3D Memo Smurfs
description:
Can you remember who is hiding where? Join Papa Smurf and all his friends in a fun game of hide and seek! Flip over a card and find the matching figurine underneath one of the five cups. There’s more than one of each card so you still have a chance to find it’s match…even if it’s already been won by another player! It’s all the fun of classic memo…and more, in an easy to learn 3D game.

Available in Spain, Italy, France, Germany, Austria, Switzerland, Belgium, the Netherlands, and Luxembourg.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Cubiformas
description:
The objective of the game is to build a build a big cube (3x3)using little ones (1x1). The first player who finishes the cube wins.
The small cubes are in two colours, black and white, so you can't have a small cube next to another one of the same colour.
Once the player placed some small cubes to build the big one ha can not remove them.

El juego consiste en que cada jugador debe montar un cubo grande (3x3) a base de cubitos (1x1). El primero que lo consiga gana el juego.
Los cubitos son de dos colores, negro y blanco, no se pueden usar dos cubitos del mismo color juntos en el cubo grande.
Una vez se han colocado cubitos en el cubo grande no se pueden mover ni quitar.

name: Sea Dogs Attack! The Defeat of the Spanish Armada (1588 AD)
description:
“King Philip II decided to invade England and depose Queen Elizabeth I. He assembled a powerful armada of ships and sent them to the Netherlands to link up with a powerful army led by the Duke of Parma."

"As the Armada sailed up the English Channel they were harassed by English ships. When the Armada arrived at Calais they anchored off the coast while the army got ready for the invasion. The English used fire ships to attack the Armada. The tactic forced the Spanish to cut their anchors and left them scattered and vulnerable to attack. The English ships pounded the disorganized fleet until they ran low on powder and shot, causing considerable damage. With the Armada low on provisions and blown by an uncooperative wind the Spanish decided to abandon the invasion plan and sail north around the British Isles and back to Spain.”

A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table using miniature ships. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are provided for use with the rules.

Concepts covered in the game include cannon fire (front and broadside), fouling, grappling, boarding, drifting, and wind effects.

Colored yarn is taped around the edges of the game table to give a quick visual guide to the effect of the wind based on which color a ship is facing. “Green yarn marked the East and South table edges (wind at your back, full speed). Yellow yarn bordered the West edge, and 2/3 of the North edge (close quartered, half speed). Red yarn ran 2.5' south from the northwest corner (can't move directly into the wind).”
categories: Educational, Miniatures, Nautical, Print & Play, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Catch me if you can
description:
This is an abstract game a little similar to checkers.
Theme is rabbits and hunters, but that is of no meaning in the game - rabbits can kill hunters as well as the other way around.

Each player has a set of blocks numbered from 1 through 7, which is hidden from his opponent.
The number represents the amount of spaces the piece can move.
The board consists of a grid of 9*7 squares.

Goal of the game is to capture opposing pieces. In order to do this, you have to enclose an opponent's block in a straight line between two of your own blocks. These blocks have to sport consecutive numbers, e.g. 2-3 order 4-5.

The game is over, if one of the players has no such pairs left. The player who can no longer make captures loses.

name: All-purpose Miniatures Rules
description:
A booklet (120 pages) containing three universal sets of miniature rules and some supplemental materials. Main rules are:

Section 1: Skirmish Combat (For 25mm figures. 24 or less figures per side. For 15mm figures, halve all distances)
1 inch = 10 feet, 1 figure = 1 man.

Section 2: Mass Combat (For 25mm figures. About 24-150 figures per side. For 15mm figures, halve all distances)
1 inch = 10 feet, 1 stand = 3 men, 1 unit = 2-4 stands (6-12 men)

Section 3: Massive Combat (For 1/300 (6mm) figures. More than 150 figures)
1 inch = 20 feet, 1 stand = 6 men or 1 vehicle

Supplemental materials are:
Section 4: Vehicles (land, air, naval and space vehicles can be designed)
Section 5: Giant Robots
Section 6: Creature Creation
Section 7: Magic and Psionic Powers
Section 8: Building Your Army
Section 9: Designer's Notes
Section 10: Army Lists (sample armies and scenarios)

(worksheets and templates)

NOTE: These rules require use of at least one d12 (twelve-sided die).

[From Back of Cover]
In one place! All the rules you'll ever need to game with any miniatures you own! Any time period! Any genre! And any combination! The game system has been designed with ease of play in mind, emphasizing fun over rules, excitement over monotony.[...]

ISBN=1-929332-10-6

name: Missouri Rummy
description: Missouri Rummy is a rummy/poker variation where poker hands are used to win various pools of chips. For instance, a pool will made for club flush, diamond flush, heart flush, full house, etc. and it is up to the players to determine when to play their hand for that pool and cash-out. The longer the pool remains, the more chips it can potentially pay out.

name: WWF Superstars Card Game
description:
WWF Superstars Card Game was sold in double packs featuring two WWF wrestlers. Each wrestler is represented by a 30-card deck, although the card distribution is identical for each deck.

Players draw a hand of four cards and take turns either playing or discarding a card and then drawing a new one. Players try to have the highest Takedown card in the center stack. Break] cards restart the stack. If a player is unable to play a card, they must discard. If your opponent discards, you can then play a Pin card, which can only be defeated by an Illegal Hold. If you are able to play two Pin cards and then a Referee, you gain 3 points, and a new round begins. Else, if both players' decks run out, the last player to play a card gains 1 point. The first player to 5 points wins.

Out of the box, the game is for 2 players. However, a second set allows for 4-player tag team matches.

name: Voff sa grisen
description:
(Translated from the box - in Swedish)

You know what sounds all the animals on the farm makes, right?

Put the dvd in the player.
Now you see a flying pig that can bark like a dog.
An elephant that jumps while at the same time farts involuntarily and is ashamed.
A dancing cow and a lion that sounds like a horse and lots more foolish nonsense!

When the animal makes it's "natural" sound, you mimic this. Afterward you take a puzzle part with this animal on it and lay it down on your player board. The player who finishes it's puzzle first wins!

Informative, imaginative and incredibly fun!

name: Huroy
description:
A mancala game.

From Mancala World:

http://mancala.wikia.com/wiki/Huroy

Huroy is a mancala game played by the Mursi people in the lower Omo valley, Ethiopia, at Ulichagi and Bilugu. They live in one of the least accessible areas of Ethiopia and many of them are heavily armed with guns.

The game is a recreation of adult males who play in the shade of trees. The board is dug in the ground.

Huroy was first recorded by the British anthropologist David Turton in the early 1970s who was the first European to visit them. At this time the Mursi didn't even know that they live in a country called Ethiopia.

Rules:

The game is played on a two-row board of six holes (holog, pl. hologunya) per row. One end of the board is called saba ("head"), the other end karenni ("downstream"). Initially each hole contains four stones (be, pl. benna, also known as benna huroin = "huroy stones").

On his turn a player distributes the contents of one of his holes one by one into the ensuing holes. The move ends after a single lap.

If, at the start of his turn, a player has a singleton and the opponent's opposite hole is occupied, he captures the contents of both these holes. Note that a capture is not effected by alighting in an empty hole.

The game ends when a player has nothing to move with. The remaining stones are won by the player who moved last.

The player who has captured more stones wins the game. Winning a game is referred to as "driving a cow".

Players try to achieve 10 victories called katog uli ("I drive a bull.").

Huroy Sayings

If a player places his penultimalte stone into his last hole of the saba end and the last stone into the opposite hole, he might say karag saba ("I hit the head."). At the other end of the board he says karag karenni ("I hit downstream.").

If a player captures just a single stone from an opponent's hole, he would say kamati lili ("I am eating two holes opposite each other."). If he captures more, he would remark kamati uro ("I am drinking milk.").
